class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_4818925" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/4818925" />    <a title="Nikki Jo Lucero" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/293830-nikki-jo-lucero"><img alt="Nikki Jo Lucero" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1189480502p2/293830.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/4818925?book_show_action=false">Mar 30, 2008</a>      <a title="Nikki Jo Lucero" class="user" name="Nikki Jo Lucero" href="/user/show/293830-nikki-jo-lucero">Nikki Jo Lucero</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Teens and Adults, It is not for ALL CHILDREN</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer4818925" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12501282852453906958">IT IS NOT FOR ALL CHILDREN some SHELTERED CHILDREN might not be permitted by parents to read such harsh language and killing scenes.<br />Some CHILDREN might not be educated enough to understand the plot and deep messages this book does have, which are intended for adult readers.<br />Yes, some CHILDREN may be ready for this type of story, but many are not, due to parental restrictions in their lives.<br />I firmly believe if a child has lived through horrid events then they will be able to read this.<br /><br />I guess some</span>  <span id="freeText12501282852453906958" style="display:none">IT IS NOT FOR ALL CHILDREN some SHELTERED CHILDREN might not be permitted by parents to read such harsh language and killing scenes.<br />Some CHILDREN might not be educated enough to understand the plot and deep messages this book does have, which are intended for adult readers.<br />Yes, some CHILDREN may be ready for this type of story, but many are not, due to parental restrictions in their lives.<br />I firmly believe if a child has lived through horrid events then they will be able to read this.<br /><br />I guess sometimes it was hard for me to imagine that there was someone writing these remarkable stories. I really started to feel the characters after seeing the movies. I could hear them in my head their accents and everything!<br /><br />I forgot that there was a WOMAN behind the scenes. Someone a lot like me.<br /><br />J.K. Rowling was a single mother of two kids and on welfare! She started the books not really understanding what an impact they would make in people's lives!<br /><br />She never thought her books would be banned and hated my many people.<br /><br />Or that many billions more would LOVE her and her brilliant writing skills.<br /><br />I have learned that we all are magical beings. No matter what religion we are, we have love, bravery and imaginations...we are creative and romantic...There is a story in all of our hearts. I found that I have been fighting DEMENTORS and Voldemort's for a long time. I found that my own life struggles are a lesson for me. A journey I must take sometimes alone and sometimes with friends or family.<br />Before I read Deathly Hallows I understood something, Death is a part of our Lives. We cannot survive one without the other. <br />If we are not born we would not die.We must do both.<br />I knew this before reading the last book.<br />I have the Magic in me to survive death, by walking right into it when the time comes.<br />It will not be a terrible thing, only leaving behind the ones we love and knowing that they will miss us sorely. Knowing that and end of our journey here the end of our story...the book will be replaced on the shelve and maybe not read again for a long time...When someone we love takes a photo of us or a letter we wrote long ago while we lived, and read it and for a moment remember us and we will be alive again in a memory in a heart beat in the tears...<br />We will be once more remembered and for a few moments alive...and then we will rest again...a memory for another day. Inside the hearts of those who love us we will remain alive and warm and LOVED...<br />Our spirit will have long journeyed on to a new place a new time making more friends and families and stories...<br />I love my mind how it is.<br />I might not be societies perfect person but who is?<br />I have flaws.<br />I am moody and emotional. I love too much and give of myself. I am a great friend and mother. A healer and artist and creator of stories and I grow plants and care for animals...I am human.I am me.<br />And J.K. Rowling where ever you may be, THANKS I did enjoy my travels with you and Harry and ALL those wonderful people you created to become a part of my life and memories. Because it will add some excitement to the pages of my life-book! I am sure my girls will always remember my nerdish obsession with HARRY POTTER.<br />THIS BOOK: HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS <br />Is not for ALL children under the age of oh let's say 10.<br />It is full of death and killing. Of course it was coming, all this drastic drama, but I really do not see a reason for J.K. Rowling to feel she needed to kill certain people.<br />I will not spoil WHO gets the axe, but I have never cried so much in any of these books!<br />However in LIFE there comes DEATH, and some people must stand up and choose between what is RIGHT and what is EASY!<br />And I will always remember the ones who gave their lives in this book to make the Witch & Wizarding world safe once more!<br />A great read, I am planning to keep this as all the books in my collection for as long as I live. <br />I will re read them all again and again.<br />I wait for the MOVIES 6 and 7!<br />THANKS! Nikki Jo</span>  <a data-text-id="12501282852453906958" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext <span id="reviewTextContainer1745863377" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5243334890510578106">Realmente no sU+00E9 cU+00F3mo me siento, fue increU+00EDble leer estos siete libros este verano y el mundo de Harry Potter es maravilloso. Me ha encantado esta saga tanto y los personajes y todas las aventuras que me cuesta pensar que ya estU+00E1, que no tengo mU+00E1s que leer sobre ellos. </span>          </span>        </div> was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1660286998" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6329266170222315465">I just completely finished this series for the first time ever and it feels so so weird to say it out loud. <br /><br />I loved every single one of these books with all my heart and I can't believe I've waited this long to actually get around to finishing them. But now that I did...WOW, DOES IT FEEL GOOD. <br /><br />As many and as powerful as the deaths were in this book, the moment when Harry is forced to confront it himself, forced to feel the fear and crippling anxiety and horror that comes with the inevitability o</span>  <span id="freeText6329266170222315465" style="display:none">I just completely finished this series for the first time ever and it feels so so weird to say it out loud. <br /><br />I loved every single one of these books with all my heart and I can't believe I've waited this long to actually get around to finishing them. But now that I did...WOW, DOES IT FEEL GOOD. <br /><br />As many and as powerful as the deaths were in this book, the moment when Harry is forced to confront it himself, forced to feel the fear and crippling anxiety and horror that comes with the inevitability of death, the moment when he asks the ones he loves who have already passed on if it hurts and if they'll stay with him, THAT was what had me in tears more than anything. THAT was the moment that had my family giving me strange looks. <br /><br />But to hell if I regret a single bit of it.</span>  <a data-text-id="6329266170222315465" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1680556592" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16142802195726414743"><blockquote> Until the very end</blockquote><br /><br />Damn, this took me very long to finish :( I struggled with the last 200 pages over 3 weeks :( not because it was so awful, it definitely isn't at all :) but this book broke my heart the first time reading it, so I was very afraid about this re-read :)<br />and let me tell you... after turning the last page...my heart shattered into thousand pieces :(<br />The Harry Potter series will always be my favourite book series of all time and Jo will always be my Queen :) ALWAYS ! ! !</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1680556592">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1277493681" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1277493681" />    <a title="Steve" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2314568-steve"><img alt="Steve" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277493681?book_show_action=false">May 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Steve" class="user" name="Steve" href="/user/show/2314568-steve">Steve</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/17191750-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1277493681" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2959543518689442774">The bar of expectation has been set phenomenally high for Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows. And the book not only meets the expectations, but exceeds them.<br /><br />The themes examined in this book are quite mature: how governments twist the truth, how newspapers and media, as the voice of the government, feed misinformation for all sorts of reasons, how trusted adults may have dark pasts and not-so-pure motives. We're past the "simple" issues of revenge and love and well into far more complex agendas</span>  <span id="freeText2959543518689442774" style="display:none">The bar of expectation has been set phenomenally high for Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows. And the book not only meets the expectations, but exceeds them.<br /><br />The themes examined in this book are quite mature: how governments twist the truth, how newspapers and media, as the voice of the government, feed misinformation for all sorts of reasons, how trusted adults may have dark pasts and not-so-pure motives. We're past the "simple" issues of revenge and love and well into far more complex agendas.<br /><br />Many children's books (fairy tales) have clear sets of morals and well-defined heroes and enemies: the wicked stepmother, the beautiful princess, the knight in shining armor. This final volume is much more grey; the lines of black and white, good and evil, are not so clear-cut in this book. This is probably very unsettling for younger readers who need to feel secure in a world where grown-ups can be trusted. For more mature readers, this is a beautiful example of peeling back the layers of the onion of life. The series began with a very innocent view of the world, from the viewpoint of a young Harry Potter. As he aged and matured, so did our ability to see what was happening, and we saw his attempts to understand the reason for the actions of his teachers, his friends' parents, and other characters in his ever-expanding world.<br /><br />In Deathly Hallows, Harry is now an adult. He has turned 17, age of adulthood for wizards. He is no longer safe with his aunt and uncle, the protective spell now removed. He can take control of his own actions and path in life. As we all know (and maybe even learned the hard way), this is hardly the freedom that teenagers think it will be. That freedom to rule your own life brings the responsibility for how your actions will affect those around you, the ones that you care for. Harry's choices have a huge impact on Hermoine and Ron, and many, many others who valiantly stand by their friend.<br /><br />In one sense, Harry has been set on a path by Dumbledore, and perhaps all that happens is Dumbledore's fault. On the other hand, Harry has free will, and Dumbledore's instructions have always been vague at best. Harry has quite a range of choice in what he does and does not do. Almost every one of those choices are difficult at best.<br /><br />There are meditations here on the meaning of death and life, on the value of sacrifice. Every character has known pain and has made decisions for selfish reasons. There are celebrations of new beginnings, and there are some endings as well. These mediations shows up often in fine literature; this imagery has been around since mankind began civilization and it is an integral part of how our society works. It is central to this Deathly Hollows, and the book wouldn't be nearly as successful if Ms. Rowling didn't address these thoughts.<br /><br />People looking for non-stop high school hijinks and game competitions will be disappointed. This final novel has none of that. In fact, there are long stretches where the characters feel stymied, and it feels like no progress is being made. The book forces the reader to slow down, to think deeply about what is going on, to feel the strain and pressure of achieving extremely difficult goals. There are action sequences and well-described battles, but these are the exception, not the rule. Deathly Hallows is about intense internal struggles and deeply emotional challenges.<br /><br />The vocabulary reflects this as well. This book is not meant to be skimmed or jumped through. The wording and the sentence structure encourage the reader to go slowly, to contemplate, to think about what is being said. While Harry spends weeks contemplating issues and trying to figure out how he feels about an issue, the reader is encouraged to do the same. It's an adventure of self-exploration.<br /><br />As I already mentioned, the bar was set exceedingly high for this book. It was expected to be exactly perfect, a stunning work of literature appropriate for every age group. It was expected to satisfy both those who wanted a blockbuster "Hollywood Ending" as well as those who feel realism requires death, destruction, and bleak despair. While it did not quite achieve all of those goals (it came REALLY close), it is an outstanding book which has exposed millions of people to questions and issues they might not have otherwise encountered. It encourages people to think about the world they live in. You cannot ask any book to do much more than that.</span>  <a data-text-id="2959543518689442774" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1277493681">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1277493681" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1277493681&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1277493681'><a id="like_count_review_1277493681" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1277493681?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1277493681" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1277493681" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" />It's war-time folks. The Battle of Goodreads is finally here.<br /><br />It's Us - the Muggle Readers - versus Them - The Review-Eaters.<br /><br />Unfortunately, we do not have any Chosen Ones to defeat the evil-corporation-that-must-not-be-named.<br /><br />But we do have The Order of the Hydra, as <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/740242918">Nandkishore</a> puts it, founded by <a itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/932194018" />    <a title="Hailey (HailsHeartsNyc)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc"><img alt="Hailey (HailsHeartsNyc)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470194710p2/21937982.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/932194018?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2015</a>      <a title="Hailey (HailsHeartsNyc)" class="user" name="Hailey (HailsHeartsNyc)" href="/user/show/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc">Hailey (HailsHeartsNyc)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545583008" href="/book/show/17347379-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer932194018" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12091057955778495061">After 10 years of procrastination I've finally finished the Harry Potter seriesU+2026 no one speak to me for at least another 10 years.<br /><br />But in all seriousness this has been an amazing adventure and I've fallen in love and I'm a blubbering mess so I'm just going to leave it at that.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review932194018">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link932194018" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=932194018&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_932194018'><a id="like_count_review_932194018" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/932194018?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">23 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_932194018" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_932194018" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=23&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=932194018&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_932194018" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 932194018, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/932194018?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=4">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_932194018' style='display: elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1733617680" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1733617680" />    <a title="Rikke" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4327582-rikke"><img alt="Rikke" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467464893p2/4327582.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1733617680?book_show_action=false">Aug 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Rikke" class="user" name="Rikke" href="/user/show/4327582-rikke">Rikke</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1733617680" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4686919652246567276">This book settles it: Dumbledore may be one of the greatest characters ever created in the world of fiction. <br /><br />As Rowling turns her universe upside-down and reveals the past of a man who is fully accepted as the greatest wizard of all time, she reveals a character depth beyond belief. Dumbledore is made out to be a sinner, a villain, a God-like figure who does not stand in the way for an innocent sacrifice. He <i>is</i> good, but he is focused on the <i>greater good</i>, sacrificing individuals in order to achi</span>  <span id="freeText4686919652246567276" style="display:none">This book settles it: Dumbledore may be one of the greatest characters ever created in the world of fiction. <br /><br />As Rowling turns her universe upside-down and reveals the past of a man who is fully accepted as the greatest wizard of all time, she reveals a character depth beyond belief. Dumbledore is made out to be a sinner, a villain, a God-like figure who does not stand in the way for an innocent sacrifice. He <i>is</i> good, but he is focused on the <i>greater good</i>, sacrificing individuals in order to achieve his goal. He loves Harry, heart and soul, but he still needs him dead. And worst of all? He has coldblodily known it all the time. <br /><br />While people has celebrated Snape's surprising sacrifice, I will always celebrate Dumbledore's betrayal. Purity and peace doesn't come without a price, and Dumbledore is willing to pay. He is a brilliant exception in Rowling's black-and-white universe. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Along with Harry Potter of course. The part of Voldemort that lives in him reminds us that no one is pure. That we all hold a bit of evil U+2013 even though it has been attached to us by accidental spells and curses. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />One thing that has been clear to me on rereading these books, is how black-and-white Rowling usually operates. Like the sorting hat, she conveniently divides her characters into good and evil and very few outsteps this path. I have always found it cowardly, how this book dismisses Slytherin-pupils for instance. An entire house of people, thrown out of the defining battle because they happen to be wearing green and silver. <br />Rowling spends the entire series preaching how Slytherin isn't necessarily defined by evil U+2013 and yet, she chooses to dismiss them, when the fight is about to come. I've always hated it. I have always hated how the Slytherins in the end only seem to be allowed a single character trait. <br /><br />This time around, I also had a bit of trouble grasping the scope of Voldemort's evil. Is he about to destroy the universe? Will his rise to power mean the end of muggle-life? And if so, will it mean the end of every muggle in the world, or is his power restricted to Britain only? Why does the world not send help to fight him U+2013 why does the Order not include African, American or even European wizards? <br />Voldemort's power and evil seems unlimited, and yet he is fought by an underground army consisting of Britains only, fighting the ultimate battle at a schoolground. <br />I am confused by the perspective; Voldemort could rule the world, crush every offender U+2013 and yet he is at Hogwarts, fighting children. <br /><br />The suspense is however undeniable. We don't have time for so many strategic questions while reading this book, because it is nerve-wracking to read. Rowling makes you forget time and space U+2013 and even plot holes U+2013 as she drags you along for break-in's, wandlore, secret missions and treasure hunts for pieces of an evil soul.<br /><br />I have always loved the horcruxes and the psychological insight they provide into both Harry and Voldemort's soul. Little by little, you become fascinated with Voldemort's anger and his desire to be accepted, and you even come to understand the darkest corners of Harry's soul. While the treasure hunt itself is a bit tedious at times, its ultimate goal is breathtaking. <br />However, as much as I've always loved the horcruxes, I've always hated the Deathly Hallows. It's puzzling why no one has ever mention Beedle the Bard earlier, as his tales are supposed to be the mythic pillars of the wizarding world. Why has Hermione, who has read about every book of wizardry, never stumbled upon these ancient tales U+2013 and why has Ron, who has grown up with these stories and loved them forever, never mentioned them? Why isn't there a magic frog card with Beedle the Bard? Why has Rowling never let a bit of the enthralling tales slip earlier? It's all so sudden. And to me, it's a bit implausible. As is wandlore itself.<br /><br />Wandlore is mythical, wonderful to read about, and impossible to understand. I'm still not sure about the whole allegiance thing; how exactly a wand's power is transferred or why. It's messy and I'd have loved a bit more explanation.<br /><br />But of course, I'd loved a bit more of everything. I love this book U+2013 mostly because of Dumbledore's character development (even beyond his death), and because it is so actionpacked and gratifying. Seven books, read in the dark with a galloping heart, and then this wonderful ending, where only a few characters are spared, and all are forever marked. This book may be filled with errors, but I am willing to overlook them. It is hard not to as these wonderful characters has been part of my life for so long.<br /><br />The Harry Potter-books are magical. And magic is hard to define. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ A final note: I hate the ending relationships. This is perhaps more related to book six than book seven, but I've never understood Ginny and Harry. We get no explanation, no gradual falling-in-love process; suddenly Harry is in love with Ginny, while one moment earlier he wasn't. There was so much potential; so many scenes at the Burrow, Rowling could have used in order to build these feelings. Instead Harry falls in love out of jealousy.<br />And then there's Ron and Hermione U+2013 another relationship enabled by hurt and jealousy. I can understand why Ron loves Hermione, but I can't understand why she loves him. He has been mean to her, ridiculing her, never appreciated her and even hinted she was ugly on several occasions. Would you fall in love with someone, who asked you out as a last resort, and loudly exclaimed that no one else wanted to go out with you? Would you fall in love with someone who got angry on the same occasion, because you actually went with someone else? Someone who ignored you, because he didn't appreciate you enough to ask? Someone who created an entire relationship with another girl, because he was jealous of a relationship you had before he had even shown interest in you? I think not. <br /><br />Ron is a lovely person, but he never treated Hermione well. At least not in my opinion. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="4686919652246567276" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1733617680">  <td id='like_container_review_1733617680'><a id="like_count_review_1733617680" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1733617680?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=18&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1733617680&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1733617680" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1733617680, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_149066960" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/149066960" />    <a title="Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow"><img alt="Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1428960569p2/886144.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/149066960?book_show_action=false">Jul 09, 2011</a>      <a title="Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*" class="user" name="Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*" href="/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow">Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=5-star-books">5-star-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=made-me-cry">made-me-cry</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer149066960" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14579277471094413397">Well ahh, I'm the 26,372nd person to review this, so I guess there's not much I can say that hasn't already been said. <br /><br />So, Harry Potter. I finally finished reading all of them. It took me forever and a day, but I did it! For some reason this one took me a particularly long time. Don't know why. I kept being like, "*Reads five pages* .... OKAY! Off to do something else." I guess because it was a little slow starting out. The first half of it was a lot of sitting around in the woods and being like</span>  <span id="freeText14579277471094413397" style="display:none">Well ahh, I'm the 26,372nd person to review this, so I guess there's not much I can say that hasn't already been said. <br /><br />So, Harry Potter. I finally finished reading all of them. It took me forever and a day, but I did it! For some reason this one took me a particularly long time. Don't know why. I kept being like, "*Reads five pages* .... OKAY! Off to do something else." I guess because it was a little slow starting out. The first half of it was a lot of sitting around in the woods and being like *ARGUE ARGUE ARGUE* But, it got a lot better as it went along. I know J.K. Rowling did have to tie up a lot of things, so that's probably why it was so long and had so much information, etc.<br /><br />Anyway. So I read the second half of it in the car on a 2-hour ride home from Connecticut about a week ago. And toward the end it was getting dark outside, so I had to use my iPod as a flashlight and it was rather difficult and I was getting a headache. But I was like, "MUST. FINISH." <br /><br />It was a good ending. Very satisfying. I've heard people complain about the ending being too happy and whatnot, but it wasn't really ... I mean, half the characters died. (Well, okay, not half. But a lot.) It was bittersweet. And heck, after all that crap he went through, HARRY POTTER DESERVES TO BE HAPPY.<br /><br />Blah blah blah. Still wracking my brain for things to say. <br /><br />I don't know. The thing is, the series was a bit ruined for me because I waited so long to read them; hence, I pretty much knew everything that was going to happen and was mentally/emotionally prepared for everything. So it's kind of hard to evaluate.<br /><br />UMMMM well. I know everyone says this but ... oh my gosh, this series has so much detail. As a writer I utterly fail at details. I'm like, "I should probably explain this more. Nah. I should give this character some kind of backstory. Nah." Whereas, J.K. Rowling has some crazy detailed history for every single one of her characters. AGGGHHH. How did she write these books in less than a hundred years? There's a purpose for everyone and everything in these books. And evidently, she had the last book planned even when she was writing the first book. A lot of series fall flat on the planning aspect; they seem like the author says to his/herself, "Meh, I don't have any other ideas so I'll just write some crappy sequel to that other thing I wrote!" But with Harry Potter, there's a reason for every book, and for everything that happensU+2013 U+2013even the smallest details. Just .... GAHHH GAHHHHHH HHHAAHGKL;KLDJ. I don't know how to express my awe. It's not fair. I now feel the need to write 100-page outlines for everything I'm writing ... which I guess is a good thing. <br /><br />Anyway, so, the characters. Well, as I said, there's a reason for all of them. And they all have such cool backstories. Except Harry Potter is kind of annoying. And I wish Ginny had been more interesting and that Harry's interest in her hadn't been so random. But, whatevs. I like everyone else. Ron and Hermione are an adorable couple. Voldemort is really creepy (but I love his backstory). Dobby is awesome *cries*. And OHMYGOSH I love Snape. He's so cool. I was the most sad about his death. Especially afterward when you find out his whole backstory. He and Lily had such a sweet relationship. It was so sad. AGGGH. That was the only part that almost made me cry. (Don't get me wrong, a lot of other parts made me sad, it's just that books rarely make me shed actual tears.)<br /><br />Recently I read this thing on Cracked.com about how it would have been cool if it turned out Neville had been the Chosen One all along. Haha. That would've been kind of awesome. But oh well. The ending was still awesome. (This has nothing to do with anything, I just wanted to mention it.)<br /><br />Sorry this review has pretty much no thought or structure to it whatsoever. I'm just not sure how to sum up my thoughts on all seven books. I should read them again sometime to find any cool details I might have missedU+2013 U+2013now that I know everything that happens, yada yada. Right now I just feel kinda overwhelmed by the series as a whole though, so I probably won't be rereading them for a while. But anyway, they were great.<br /><br />I kind of wonder whether Rowling will ever write anything else. Maybe she's the Harper Lee type and only had one good story to tell. Also I feel like if she writes about anything else, everyone will be like, "THIS IS NOT AS GOOD AS HARRY POTTER." But, oh well. I'm sure the Harry Potter legacy will live on. People will keep reading these books to their kids. J.K. Rowling is probably set for life. So, WOOHOOOO!<br /><br />ONE MORE THING.<br /><br />I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.<br /><br />I just love saying that. :] Heh heh.</span>  <a data-text-id="14579277471094413397" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1633629693" />    <a title="Toby" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/46393409-toby"><img alt="Toby" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478117862p2/46393409.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1633629693?book_show_action=false">Oct 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Toby" class="user" name="Toby" href="/user/show/46393409-toby">Toby</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46393409-toby?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46393409-toby?shelf=always-reccomending">always-reccomending</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46393409-toby?shelf=emotional">emotional</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46393409-toby?shelf=sad">sad</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1633629693&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1633629693" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6884128571788845107"><i> "'Hogwarts is threatened!' shouted McGonagall. 'Man the boundaries, protect us, do your duty to our school!'" </i><br /><br />I was so emotional throughout this whole thing. From the happiness of Harry reuniting with his friends, to the sadness of when so many dearly beloved characters died, and not to mention the anger at Dumbledore for his intricate web of lies, and the hopefulness when Dumbledore explained himself, and I realized he could be forgiven.<br /><br /><i> "'Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but</i></span>  <span id="freeText6884128571788845107" style="display:none"><i> "'Hogwarts is threatened!' shouted McGonagall. 'Man the boundaries, protect us, do your duty to our school!'" </i><br /><br />I was so emotional throughout this whole thing. From the happiness of Harry reuniting with his friends, to the sadness of when so many dearly beloved characters died, and not to mention the anger at Dumbledore for his intricate web of lies, and the hopefulness when Dumbledore explained himself, and I realized he could be forgiven.<br /><br /><i> "'Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?'" </i><br /><br />Everything came to a close perfectly. I don't really think JK Rowling could have done better. Hedwig, Mad-Eye, Ted, Fred, Lupin, and Tonks will all, forever be missed. But that was what was so brilliant about this book. It was emotional, and raw, and real. And I am forever thankful for it.<br /><br /><i> "'Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all, those who live without love." </i><br /><br />Do I love this series with all my heart? Will I read it again and again? Will it be a part of me from now on?<br /><br />The answer is simple.<br /><br /><i> "'Always.'" </i><br /><br />Because,<br /><br /><i> "All was well." </i><br /><br />Initial reaction:<br /><br />"All was well."<br /><br /><br />And with this book, I cried many a time. It was wonderful. It was emotional. It was everything a conclusion should be.<br /><br />I guess it's true what they say. The ending is the best part. So, JK Rowling presents the best part of her epic story that I will love until the end of time.</span>  <a data-text-id="6884128571788845107" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1443371512" />    <a title="Liam Gardner" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner"><img alt="Liam Gardner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451864455p2/38154660.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1443371512?book_show_action=false">Feb 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Liam Gardner" class="user" name="Liam Gardner" href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner">Liam Gardner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1443371512" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9634159348011356807">I DID IT! I CAN'T BELIEVE I'VE FINISHED THE COMPLETE HARRY POTTER SERIES, AHHH!<br /><br /> I didn't really enjoy The Deathly Hallows as much as I enjoyed the previous books (although I did still thoroughly enjoy it) it was lacking Beloved characters and settings the previous books had until the very end. I missed Hogwarts, I missed Hagrid, Dumbledore, Neville, Luna. The first half of the book up until Harry, Ron and Hermione arrived at Hogwarts was a little too slow for me!<br /><br />On the other hand, the second hal</span>  <span id="freeText9634159348011356807" style="display:none">I DID IT! I CAN'T BELIEVE I'VE FINISHED THE COMPLETE HARRY POTTER SERIES, AHHH!<br /><br /> I didn't really enjoy The Deathly Hallows as much as I enjoyed the previous books (although I did still thoroughly enjoy it) it was lacking Beloved characters and settings the previous books had until the very end. I missed Hogwarts, I missed Hagrid, Dumbledore, Neville, Luna. The first half of the book up until Harry, Ron and Hermione arrived at Hogwarts was a little too slow for me!<br /><br />On the other hand, the second half of the book was fantastic! The battle of Hogwarts was written so well, I was on edge the whole time! There was a lot of deaths that broke my heart and a lot of twists (that I actually saw coming because I saw the movie first, haha.) My favorite chapter has to be 'The Princes Tale' Snape is such a wonderful character and JK. Rowling wrote the characters story so so well!<br /><br />Overall, I did really enjoy this even though it lacked a lot in the first half. It was beautifully written and the ending was perfect! I loved the whole 19 years later chapter, it was an amazing end to a fantastic series! <br /><br />My favorite -> least favorite <br />#1 Half Blood Prince <br />#2 The Order of the phoenix <br />#3 The Prisoner Of Azkaban<br />#4 The Goblet of Fire <br />#5 The Philosophers Stone <br />#6 The Chambers of Secrets <br />#7 The Deathly Hallows</span>  <a data-text-id="9634159348011356807" href="#" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1090984874" />    <a title="Karina " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36019667-karina"><img alt="Karina " itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1090984874?book_show_action=false">Mar 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Karina " class="user" name="Karina " href="/user/show/36019667-karina">Karina </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/17191750-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36019667-karina?shelf=2016-re-reads">2016-re-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1090984874" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14470034918488433619">It doesn't matter how many times I re-read these books. They still make me sob so much. They're just so beautiful and I am so glad I re-read them after wanting to for so long. Being able to experience this world all over again was amazing. Now to drown in my feels. <3</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"            >            <span id="freeTextContainer11191769339573637070">THIS BEAUTIFUL, MAGICAL PERFECTION OF A BOOK DESTROYED ME!!!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1565065617">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1565065617" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1565065617&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1565065617'><a id="like_count_review_1565065617" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1565065617?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">17 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1565065617" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1565065617" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=17&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1565065617&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1565065617" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1565065617, true, &#39;&#39;); return elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1354077320" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1354077320" />    <a title="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13"><img alt="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1447807212p2/45616064.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1354077320?book_show_action=false">Jan 25, 2016</a>      <a title="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" class="user" name="Melanie (itsabookishthing13)" href="/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13">Melanie (itsabookishthing13)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1354077320" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16173114329299468347">"After all this time? Always."<br /><br />I've been staring at this blank box for over 10 minutes trying to think of a way to start reviewing the majesty of a book that was Deathly Hallows.<br /><br />There are truly too many emotions clouding my judgement at the moment, just give me a sec.<br /><br />First off I want to say that I'm utterly heartbroken, not only because this book was heartbreaking itself, but because I've just finished reading the Harry Potter series for the first time. I had seen the movies, many, many, MANY tim</span>  <span id="freeText16173114329299468347" style="display:none">"After all this time? Always."<br /><br />I've been staring at this blank box for over 10 minutes trying to think of a way to start reviewing the majesty of a book that was Deathly Hallows.<br /><br />There are truly too many emotions clouding my judgement at the moment, just give me a sec.<br /><br />First off I want to say that I'm utterly heartbroken, not only because this book was heartbreaking itself, but because I've just finished reading the Harry Potter series for the first time. I had seen the movies, many, many, MANY times, but I'd never picked up the books, don't ask me, I honestly don't know why. Now that it's over, I truly don't know what to do with myself, I'm so invested in this world, and in this story...to not have another book to look forward to is the most saddening thing. But, still, it was an indescribable experience, and I'm so glad I decided to start this journey back on September. I remember that I actually read Harry's first September 1st scene, on September 1st. I don't know why that brings me so much happiness. The coincidence made it feel like fate, and I DON'T CARE IF IT'S CHEESY, IT'S REAL.<br /><br />On to the good stuff: THIS BOOK WAS UNREAL. Everything, literally EVERYTHING was pure magic. Pun intended. This epic conclusion was, by far, the best series closer I've ever read in my life, nothing could beat this magnificent ending. Everything was so well explained, and thought-out, many loose-ends from other books were corrected in this conclusion, making every book essential, every pointless detail was taken into consideration, and made part of something bigger. That's where J. K. Rowling's true magic lies: being able to forge simple details and conversations into something so big, none of us could see it coming.<br /><br />Harry's, Ron's and Hermione's friendship was severely tested in this book, and their weaknesses were enhanced, so we got to witness the good, the bad, and the ugly that each character has, part because of the environment they endured for basically the whole book (being hunted 24/7, and having to live in the woods for a ridiculously long period of time) and because of the Horcruxes' effect. The whole deal with the Horcruxes was utterly fascinating, every aspect of it intrigued me, from Voldemort's fascination with conquering death, to how he came to know about the Horcruxes, to how he started making them, to the importance of his past, to the though-out locations where he hid them, to the effect they had on people, to how they had to be destroyed, and to the fact that he made a seventh unintended Horcrux that lived inside the boy he most desired to kill. The irony in all of it made me relish with amazement. Something I'd missed with the movies were the lengthy explanations that we get with the book, the explanations of why this Horcrux lived inside Harry, why he lived through two Killing Curses, and how Dumbledore wasn't truly the great man we thought he was.<br /><br />I'm not going to go into a lot of details about the book in case some of you haven't read it, or don't know what happens. Basically, I loved all of this:<br />1. RON AND HERMIONE. -- this the book where Ron's actively trying to start things up with Hermione, with his love advice book at the beginning, and his distraught at Voldemort's Harry/Hermione ship (the scene when he destroys the Horcrux), and protecting her at EVERY moment. This book made Ron shine so much, through the ups and downs, we say an incredible, loyal man.<br />2. HARRY AND GINNY. -- I mean. MUST I SAY MORE? I LOVE THEM.<br />3. THAT EPILOGUE, MAN. -- Perfection. I do wish we'd gotten intel about what became of our three main characters: did Harry become an Auror? What did Hermione & Ron end up doing?<br />4. The EPIC HOGWARTS BATTLE -- Neville. UGH what a SWEETHEART.<br />5. EVERYTHING THAT HAD TO DO WITH HORCRUXES -- finding them, their locations, what they were, how to destroy them, their meaning, EVERYTHING.<br />6. DEATHLY HALLOWS -- I ESPECIALLY loved the scene where they share the myth revolving the three objects.<br />7. HAGRID -- THAT MAN KILLS ME. He's a sweetheart, and everything he does and says will always be beautiful to me. The scene where he has to carry Harry's body. Jesus. That scene is powerful. It brings everything full circle. <br />8. Kreacher's redemption: DEAR LORD, this elf was the death of me. I used to hate his GUTS, and in the movie, his redemption didn't happen, but in the book it did, and it was beautiful. He helped Harry, Ron & Hermione get one of the Horcruxes, and he had a hand in the final epic battle, where he led the elves against Voldemort's army.<br />9. Dobby: Dobby was very painful. I can't quite put into words how much I loved this character and the sadness his ending caused me. <br />10. I LOVED the breaking into the Ministry's scene. EPIC. And breaking into Gringotts was SO MUCH FUN, Hermione's impression of Bellatrix was everything.<br />11. SNAPE'S TRUTH: This was my absolute favorite part of the book. When we (FINALLY!) get to see his memories, and see how he's been protecting Harry all this time, was truly on our side, and beautiful his character actually was... He wasn't perfect. He wasn't a great guy. He had his flaws. But he was real. He was loyal, to a fault. He protected, even when sometimes he shouldn't. He was a magnificent character with an incredible arc, without a doubt my favorite character of all-time. Watching him during this book was heartbreaking, but the end was worth it. When Harry finally found out the truth...it was worth it. Silver doe. SILVER DOE. Enough said. I'm done. No more.<br />12. "Not my daughter, YOU BITCH" -- epic.<br /><br />When Percy came back, to help in the Hogwarts battle... I broke down. I broke down BAD. And his stunning scene with Fred... where Perce made that joke. I still can't quite put into words how much it affected me. My heart breaks. Every time.<br /><br />As I said, this was an amazing experience, I can't wait to reread them, and then re-read all my reviews. It's been amazing.<br /><br />I really can't say more, I keep crying every time I write a new bullet, so I'm gonna go, watch the final two movies, and cry some more. If you're still here, thank you for reading. You're the best. <3<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16173114329299468347" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div Bueno, me pasU+00C3 U+00B3.<br>Hasta el dU+00C3 U+00ADa de hoy recuerdo la vez que, cuando tenU+00C3 U+00ADa 12 aU+00C3 U+00B1os terminU+00C3 U+00A9 de leer TDH y me iba a morir... Ya habU+00C3 U+00ADa visto las pelU+00C3 U+00ADculas pero no es lo mismo...<br>Para nada es lo mismo...<br>LlorarU+00C3 U+00A9 hasta el final de mis dU+00C3 U+00ADas... Vi mi infancia desmoronarse frente a mU+00C3 U+00AD...<br>Adios, Harry... nos vemos pronto...</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr id="reviewTextContainer1001936305" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2568111115678656714">Rating: 5 stars :)<br /><br />I forgot how beautifully detailed and how well this book played out. The whole thing was so emotional too, especially now that I'm older and can appreciate everything more. Unfortunately school got in the way and it took me almost an entire month to finish my reread, but overall the experience was pretty awesome.<br /><br />If you haven't read this series yet...um...I have nothing to say.<br /><br />Harry Potter 4eva! ;)</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_846814510" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/846814510" />    <a title="Kristin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4422684-kristin"><img alt="Kristin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450065875p2/4422684.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/846814510?book_show_action=false">Jan 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Kristin" class="user" name="Kristin" href="/user/show/4422684-kristin">Kristin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=young-adult-fantasy">young-adult-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=i-own">i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=5-star-reads">5-star-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=heart-emoji">heart-emoji</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=really-enjoyed">really-enjoyed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=would-recommend">would-recommend</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=me-like">me-like</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=best-of-the-best">best-of-the-best</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer846814510" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1117379623023510207">I feel like this isn't a Harry Potter novel. It doesn't follow Rowling's typical formula of following Harry's rule-breaking antics at Hogwarts and there is a <i>crap ton</i> of stuff that happens in this book. To read this book as a Harry Potter lover is a very emotional journey; it is truly heart breaking. For me, when this book first came out it marked the end of my childhood. I was in 5th grade when the first one came out and a freshman in college when this one finally hit shelves. My heart has neve</span>  <span id="freeText1117379623023510207" style="display:none">I feel like this isn't a Harry Potter novel. It doesn't follow Rowling's typical formula of following Harry's rule-breaking antics at Hogwarts and there is a <i>crap ton</i> of stuff that happens in this book. To read this book as a Harry Potter lover is a very emotional journey; it is truly heart breaking. For me, when this book first came out it marked the end of my childhood. I was in 5th grade when the first one came out and a freshman in college when this one finally hit shelves. My heart has never recovered from the ending of this series...<br /><br />I don't know where this ranks on my "Harry Potter list" because it's sort of an outlier to the series and it's a hard book to read (there should be a warning label that tissues are required). <br /><br />Here is my <i>list</i> of Harry Potter novels in order of my most favorite to my least favorite (<i>for those who care...I guess! ha ha</i>): <br /><br />1.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince__Harry_Potter__6_" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (Harry Potter #6) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a><br />2.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter__4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a><br />3.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter__3_" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter #3) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a><br />4.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix__Harry_Potter__5_" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Harry Potter #5) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a><br />5.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a><br />6.)<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter__2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a><br />*Honorable mention - <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Harry_Potter__7_" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter #7) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a> (seriously I can't rank this one)<br /><br />What a journey it was re-reading these! Till next time....</span>  <a data-text-id="1117379623023510207" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext Micheal Goddard" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16654757-j-micheal-goddard"><img alt="J. Micheal Goddard" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469238486p2/16654757.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1073783250?book_show_action=false">Aug 25, 2015</a>      <a title="J. Micheal Goddard" class="user" name="J. Micheal Goddard" href="/user/show/16654757-j-micheal-goddard">J. Micheal Goddard</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1073783250" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3948860582669928029">And with the turning of the final page, I have once again finished this amazing series. All questions were answered, and as this series was basically my childhood the nostalgia was greatly felt. The experiences I have with these books, like the others before it, just keeps getting better with each read. I might have a slight book hangover from this, however I am very much looking forward to discovering (or maybe even rediscovering) other worlds until such time I might consider revisting this one</span>  <span id="freeText3948860582669928029" style="display:none">And with the turning of the final page, I have once again finished this amazing series. All questions were answered, and as this series was basically my childhood the nostalgia was greatly felt. The experiences I have with these books, like the others before it, just keeps getting better with each read. I might have a slight book hangover from this, however I am very much looking forward to discovering (or maybe even rediscovering) other worlds until such time I might consider revisting this one once again in the future. Until next time...</span>  <a data-text-id="3948860582669928029" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_137775965" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 137775965, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">13 none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/137775965/comments?reverse=true">View all 13 comments</a><span  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1477096942" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1477096942" />    <a title="Moraes the Bookworm" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm"><img alt="Moraes the Bookworm" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465866511p2/50389307.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1477096942?book_show_action=false">Jun 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Moraes the Bookworm" class="user" name="Moraes the Bookworm" href="/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm">Moraes the Bookworm</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=amazing-scenery-description">amazing-scenery-description</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=high-angst">high-angst</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=in-your-face-magic">in-your-face-magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=original-magic-system">original-magic-system</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=contemporary">contemporary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=memorable-secondary-characters">memorable-secondary-characters</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1477096942" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2866360020105228720">Goodbye is the word that best describes this book, as I see it. Of course I am talking about the millions of fans worldwide that found themselves holding the end of this story on their hands, after so many years, having conflicting emotions about it: on one hand, happiness for finally being able to see how Harry's story ends; on the other, the feeling of loss for having to say goodbye to so many "friends" in so little time. I think knowing that is what makes people read this book so avidly;</span>  <span id="freeText2866360020105228720" style="display:none">Goodbye is the word that best describes this book, as I see it. Of course I am talking about the millions of fans worldwide that found themselves holding the end of this story on their hands, after so many years, having conflicting emotions about it: on one hand, happiness for finally being able to see how Harry's story ends; on the other, the feeling of loss for having to say goodbye to so many "friends" in so little time. I think knowing that is what makes people read this book so avidly; everything that happens to every character seems to matter tons more now than in any of the previous books, because now there's no more room for elaborate cliffhangers and twists and turns. If someone gets badly injured here, they are probably going to die. If someone goes missing, they are probably going to die too or it might be that they already have died. It's only natural that you don't want to see your favorite character gone, so you cling to the pages as if your life depends on it. Also, returning to Hogwarts is not an option for Harry anymore, since the castle is being run by, mostly, Voldemort's minions. Thus we also have to say goodbye to the idea of wandering our beloved corridors and secret passages, indefinitely, which kind of sucks.<br><br>The bitterness of unwanted <i>adios</i> is not only experienced by us fans, though. Some of the characters find themselves on similar situations. The book already begins with Harry having to say goodbye to the home he was brought up in and also to the Dursleys (apparently the spell that made it impossible for Voldemort to reach him under their roof is going to expire as soon as he completes 17 years of age, so his not so friendly family is not safe anymore). I wouldn't believe if someone had told me how emotional things would get, especially regarding Dudley.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1440454997i/15977050._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Soon enough, knowing the burden that is laying onto Harry's shoulder and wanting to help him, Hermione and Ron also have to say goodbye to their families, for their quest must begin. The way Hermione has to deal with her parents in order to keep them safe is especially heart-breaking.<br><br>Anyway, once the trio is out in the world searching for the horcruxes, things get increasingly bad. <b>Being on the road with little or no clue what the next step is might be too much for some people; the feeling of desperation starts to seep into your veins until you don't know if what you're doing is worth it anymore.</b> Despite the adversities, the group little by little starts getting some important information about Voldemort's past and, at some point, they start getting their hands on some horcruxes. It goes without saying that on every little step of their journey they have to worry about being caught by the Ministry, now that they are unwanted fugitives of the law, so every little task becomes ten times more difficult. I must say that they overcoming such serious hardships in the real world was very satisfying to see, <b>I felt even proud of seeing how much stronger Harry, Ron and Hermione have become as individuals and also as friends.</b><br><br>After some misadventures and major struggles they are finally led to Hogwarts, where some clues indicate that one of the remaining undamaged horcruxes is. Of course, at this point, Voldemort and his gang are well aware of their attempts on finding every single horcrux, so from the point when Harry, Ron and Hermione get to Hogwarts they have to fight their way into the castle and take it back. The following chapters are just breathtaking; it's just surprise after surprise, not only about Voldemort's past but also about Harry's and his parents'. All this events culminate with an epic battle such as I've never read in <i>any</i> other story. So, yeah, take it, World, I find the best action scene ever written was made by a woman.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1440454997i/15977051.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Gender favoritism aside, it is a wonderful book that makes justice to all the years of supporting this series. All the lose ends planted years ago were very well put together, there's nothing left out or poorly executed. I just love it, so it was very hard when the time came to finish reading the last paragraph and say goodbye.<br><br><u>  <b>Interesting quotes that I didn't include in the review:</b></u><br><i>  <blockquote>Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable of both inflicting injury, and remedying it.</blockquote></i><br></span>  <a data-text-id="2866360020105228720" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1477096942">  <td colspan="2">    <div
