href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1771257674" />    <a title="Ale Rivero" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8429859-ale-rivero"><img alt="Ale Rivero" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1332890250p2/8429859.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1771257674?book_show_action=false">Oct 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Ale Rivero" class="user" name="Ale Rivero" href="/user/show/8429859-ale-rivero">Ale Rivero</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788498381436" href="/book/show/6015186-harry-potter-y-las-reliquias-de-la-muerte">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1771257674" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15245091757170584383">Este libro es sufrimiento puro, mU+00E1s allU+00E1 de ciertos momentos de dicha que resultan ser una bocanada de aire fresco entre tantas desdichas. <br />Coincido con muchos en que Rowling desatU+00F3 su lado malvado en esta historia, porque hay sucesos que pueden solo justificarse de esa manera. <br />Por otro lado, los misterios que se van desenrollando a lo largo de las pU+00E1ginas resultan uno mU+00E1s macabro que otro, y eso no es que logre aplacar nuestros nervios ante lo que pueda sucederle a nuestros queridos personajes.</span>  <span id="freeText15245091757170584383" style="display:none">Este libro es sufrimiento puro, mU+00E1s allU+00E1 de ciertos momentos de dicha que resultan ser una bocanada de aire fresco entre tantas desdichas. <br />Coincido con muchos en que Rowling desatU+00F3 su lado malvado en esta historia, porque hay sucesos que pueden solo justificarse de esa manera. <br />Por otro lado, los misterios que se van desenrollando a lo largo de las pU+00E1ginas resultan uno mU+00E1s macabro que otro, y eso no es que logre aplacar nuestros nervios ante lo que pueda sucederle a nuestros queridos personajes. <br />AdemU+00E1s, hay una cosa en la que coincido y a la vez disiento con muchas personas. Creo que una acciU+00F3n buena puede justificar alguna que otra mala, pero no aU+00F1os de maldad, aunque entiendo a aquellos que piensan que un U+00FAltimo acto de bondad lo puede todo. <br />En principio podrU+00EDa decirse que en este sU+00E9ptimo libro de la saga, Harry, Ron y Hermione viven una nueva aventura, pero al ser ya adultos, esa aventura no es necesariamente divertida e inofensiva. <br />Por U+00FAltimo, este libro me ha roto el corazU+00F3n, me lo ha dejado en cachitos y me lo ha vuelto a armar, pero el daU+00F1o ya estaba hecho. Por supuesto es mU+00E1s que recomendable.</span>  <a data-text-id="15245091757170584383" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div id="reviewTextContainer1747391424" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10908630024672216361">It felt great to reread Harry Potter mainly because it has been so long since I read it. 8 or 9 years? I will probably rearead it in the near future but in German.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1747391424">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1747391424" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1747391424&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1747391424'><a id="like_count_review_1747391424" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1747391424?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1747391424" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1747391424" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=15&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1747391424&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1747391424" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1747391424, true, &#39;&#39;); class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1602323219" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1602323219" />    <a title="Juli" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35755053-juli"><img alt="Juli" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1436125802p2/35755053.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1602323219?book_show_action=false">Jun 22, 2016</a>      <a title="Juli" class="user" name="Juli" href="/user/show/35755053-juli">Juli</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788498381405" href="/book/show/3151358-harry-potter-y-las-reliquias-de-la-muerte">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35755053-juli?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1602323219" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3242053922074340821">Lo termine ayer, pero tuve que tomarme un tiempo para reflexionar, para poner en orden mis ideas.<br />El libro me ha encantado<br />Sin lugar a dudas me da pena terminar esta saga, aunque se que Hogwarts siempre estarU+00E1 con las puertas abiertas esperU+00E1ndome. Y pienso volver.<br />Es un mundo lleno de magia, y aventuras. <br />Y no puedo terminar esta reseU+00F1a sin agradecer a Flor, quien se ha convertido en una persona muy importante en mi vida, a travU+00E9s de esta saga. Con ella leU+00ED los libros, con ella disfrute de las avent</span>  <span id="freeText3242053922074340821" style="display:none">Lo termine ayer, pero tuve que tomarme un tiempo para reflexionar, para poner en orden mis ideas.<br />El libro me ha encantadoU+2665<br />Sin lugar a dudas me da pena terminar esta saga, aunque se que Hogwarts siempre estarU+00E1 con las puertas abiertas esperU+00E1ndome. Y pienso volver.<br />Es un mundo lleno de magia, y aventuras. <br />Y no puedo terminar esta reseU+00F1a sin agradecer a Flor, quien se ha convertido en una persona muy importante en mi vida, a travU+00E9s de esta saga. Con ella leU+00ED los libros, con ella disfrute de las aventuras, ella me acompaU+00F1o en las lU+00E1grimas y en las risas. Se banco mi amor por RemusU+2665. A veces se nos complicaba con el tiempo y nuestras actividades pero LO LOGRAMOS. Asique gracias ParabataiU+2665, no hubiera sido lo mismo sin vos, no hubiera sido tan entretenido, tan divertido, tan desgarrador, tan perfecto. <br />Y vamos por mU+00E1sU+2665<br />Y como te dije hace unos meses, en un futuro haremos maratones de las pelU+00EDculas juntas, y haremos pijamadas con nuestros hijos y les leeremos los librosU+2665 (con la excusa de poder volver a estar juntas leyendolos). <br />Gracias por acompaU+00F1arme y animarte a compartir vagU+00F3n conmigo en el Expreso Hogwarts!</span>  <a data-text-id="3242053922074340821" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1602323219"> id="reviewTextContainer934850314" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16313187379286476085">Review before finishing the book (page 603) because ALL THE FEELS. It will contain spoilers.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />- LUPIN AS A DAD. HE WAS SO HAPPY AND I WAS CRYING OF JOY. TEDDY REMUS LUPIN *crying hard*. <br /><br />- I LOVE IT WHEN GOOD WIZARDS USE THE UNFORGIVABLE CURSES. SO EXCITING!<br /><br />- I LOVE MINERVA MCGONAGALL AND POMONA SPROUT AND FILIUS FLITWICK.<br /><br />- ALSO, I LOVE ALL THE DA MEMBERS AND THE ORDER OF THE PHOENIX.<br /><br />- AND PERCY, PERCY CAME BACK *still crying*.<br /><br />I can't cointaing myself! The battle of Howarts is just starting an</span>  <span id="freeText16313187379286476085" style="display:none">Review before finishing the book (page 603) because ALL THE FEELS. It will contain spoilers.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />- LUPIN AS A DAD. HE WAS SO HAPPY AND I WAS CRYING OF JOY. TEDDY REMUS LUPIN *crying hard*. <br /><br />- I LOVE IT WHEN GOOD WIZARDS USE THE UNFORGIVABLE CURSES. SO EXCITING!<br /><br />- I LOVE MINERVA MCGONAGALL AND POMONA SPROUT AND FILIUS FLITWICK.<br /><br />- ALSO, I LOVE ALL THE DA MEMBERS AND THE ORDER OF THE PHOENIX.<br /><br />- AND PERCY, PERCY CAME BACK *still crying*.<br /><br />I can't cointaing myself! The battle of Howarts is just starting and I'm so thrilled! I know from the movies what'll be the final outcome, but reading it is so different and much more exciting! <br />.<br />.<br />.<br />UPDATE ON PAGE 632: I'M AS PROUD OF NEVILLE AS HER GRAN <3.<br itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1149572073" />    <a title="Rachael Hobson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36253976-rachael-hobson"><img alt="Rachael Hobson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1424614578p2/36253976.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1149572073?book_show_action=false">Jan 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Rachael Hobson" class="user" name="Rachael Hobson" href="/user/show/36253976-rachael-hobson">Rachael Hobson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36253976-rachael-hobson?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1149572073" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17304602782744649294">Listening to this at work probably wasn't the best of decisions. At various times within the story, I found myself choking back tears! Every loss felt as if I experienced it for the first time. And after every re-read, I find myself appreciating how flawed all these characters were. All these characters felt real because they embodied real human behavior. "...The world isn't split between good people and death eaters. We've all got good and bad inside us. What matters is the part we choose to</span>  <span id="freeText17304602782744649294" style="display:none">Listening to this at work probably wasn't the best of decisions. At various times within the story, I found myself choking back tears! Every loss felt as if I experienced it for the first time. And after every re-read, I find myself appreciating how flawed all these characters were. All these characters felt real because they embodied real human behavior. "...The world isn't split between good people and death eaters. We've all got good and bad inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are." Jo's writing exhibited this at every turn. This truly was a magical world, full of life and possibility, and a place where I can call home. </span>  <a data-text-id="17304602782744649294" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1149572073">  <td amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1619058214" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6943971750198479035">My feelings are all over the place right now. What an end to a series that was so famous? What an amazing book in every sense! I have tears rolling down my cheeks as I try to comprehend what just happened, that I have now finished with these characters (until the Cursed Child comes out). If anyone has not read this series I would without a doubt suggest them as they're absolutely breathtaking and every single character worms their way into your heart. </span>          </span>           <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30679152-melissa?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer914602850" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6721449785419196909">This is my second time reading this series, and I don't think this book really needs a review. 99% of the people who've read it, love it. And the rest are crazy. And those who haven't read it? Well, they're even crazier.<br /><br />This series will forever remain one of, if not my all time favourite series, and I cannot express my wholehearted adoration for every single page of every single book. I cried like a baby at the end, just because it's over. <br /><br />Hogwarts is my home.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr I wish I could rate this more than 5 stars!!<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />***************************<br />An excellent ending!<br /><br />"Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_385938900" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/385938900" />    <a title="Namratha" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/114559-namratha"><img alt="Namratha" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/385938900?book_show_action=false">Aug 07, 2012</a>      <a title="Namratha" class="user" name="Namratha" href="/user/show/114559-namratha">Namratha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=thrillers">thrillers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=urban-fantasy">urban-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=mystery">mystery</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=journey-within">journey-within</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit">ya-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love">books-i-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania">pottermania</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer385938900" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17713423343418545166">Yesterday I read <b> <u>Harry Potter and The Deathly Hallows</u> </b> for what seemed like the gazillionth time. <br>I didnU+2019t want to write a review. <br>Again. <br>ItU+2019s been done and it was a gushing, brimming with love and adulation write-up.<br>Today, I just wanted to make a mini-keepsake. A little something for all my Potterhead friends. Something that encapsulated all the key moments in the books...moments that moved me...moments that made me smirk gleefully..moments that broke my heart (in a nice way, if thatU+2019s even po</span>  <span id="freeText17713423343418545166" style="display:none">Yesterday I read <b>  <u>Harry Potter and The Deathly Hallows</u></b> for what seemed like the gazillionth time. <br>I didnU+2019t want to write a review. <br>Again. <br>ItU+2019s been done and it was a gushing, brimming with love and adulation write-up.<br>Today, I just wanted to make a mini-keepsake. A little something for all my Potterhead friends. Something that encapsulated all the key moments in the books...moments that moved me...moments that made me smirk gleefully..moments that broke my heart (in a nice way, if thatU+2019s even possible). So here goes:<br>U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014-<br><br>MOMENT #1:<br><b>  <i>U+2018I donU+2019t think youU+2019re a waste of space.U+2019</i></b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380386726i/746367._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014 U+2014-<br><br>MOMENT #2:<br><b>  <i>U+201CAre you planning to follow a career in Magical Law, Miss Granger?U+2019 asked Scrimgeour. U+2018No IU+2019m not,U+2019 retorted Hermione. (<i>U+00E2 U+0080 U+00A6and I liked the fact that it was appropriately enough, the 19th moment</i>)<br><b>  <i>The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.</i></b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380386726i/746385._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>U+00E2 U+0080 U+0094 U+00E2  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_3175501" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3175501" />    <a title="Sarah" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/193255-sarah"><img alt="Sarah" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453355697p2/193255.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3175501?book_show_action=false">Dec 28, 2010</a>      <a title="Sarah" class="user" name="Sarah" href="/user/show/193255-sarah">Sarah</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Fantasy fans</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/193255-sarah?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/193255-sarah?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/193255-sarah?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/193255-sarah?shelf=brit-lit">brit-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/193255-sarah?shelf=magic-and-sci-fi">magic-and-sci-fi</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer3175501&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer3175501" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11210500604755226710">July 2009<br />After my second reading of this book, I have so many more feelings and comments about it than I did after the first reading. But I think those comments mainly deal with the series as a whole, rather than just this book, and this book (being the conclusion of the saga) just brings some of the brilliance of the entire series more fully into focus. I may take a page from Madeleine's book and write a review of the entire series. I also think that this is a series I could read once a year. <br /><br />J</span>  <span id="freeText11210500604755226710" style="display:none">July 2009<br />After my second reading of this book, I have so many more feelings and comments about it than I did after the first reading. But I think those comments mainly deal with the series as a whole, rather than just this book, and this book (being the conclusion of the saga) just brings some of the brilliance of the entire series more fully into focus. I may take a page from Madeleine's book and write a review of the entire series. I also think that this is a series I could read once a year. <br /><br />July 2007<br />Wow. I cannot believe it's over! This book was an absolute emotional roller coaster. I don't even know where to start so I'm just going to list some random thoughts:<br /><br />1. I am exceedingly happy (and surprised) that the trio survived. I was sure Ron or Hermione was going to die. In the scene where Bellatrix is torturing Hermione, I thought that was going to be it and I was pissed that Ron never got the chance to tell her how much he loved her. <br /><br />2. Along those same lines, I didn't really like how LONG it took Ron and Hermione to finally get together. I understand this is war, and there were more pressing things on their minds than dating, but they escaped death so many times that I thought they'd declare their love for each other out of the heat of the moment. It was cute how, once Ron finally embraced Hermione's passion for S.P.E.W., she lays one on him.<br /><br />3. The death of Dobby was very sad. But Dobby would have wanted to die saving Harry Potter. This was not the first time he risked everything to come to Harry Potter's aid. I think it'll be harder for me to read the second time, though, The first time, I was so worried that Hermione was going to die that it numbed the pain of Dobby's death. But the funeral scene was very sad.<br /><br />4. I was very saddened by Fred's death, but I wasn't altogether surprised. I never thought that all of the Weasleys would survive, and I figured it would be Fred or George. I was really happy to see Ginny, Hagrid, and Neville live. I was also sad about Tonks and Lupin, but I think it's intersting that Harry's godson was orphaned in the fight to defeat Voldemort just as Harry was. It'll definitely give Harry some insight into his godson's feelings. But my question is, who raised him? Clearly, he didn't grow up living with Harry, so did he get raised by Tonks' mother? <br /><br />5. My "Yay for you!" character moments: Dudley shaking Harry's hand. Mrs. Weasley calling Bellatrix a bitch. Percy redeeming himself. NEVILLE stepping up and becoming a full-on leader with the DA, and then drawing the sword out of the hat and killing Nagini, allowing Harry to defeat Voldemort once and for all!<br /><br />6. I wish we'd have had a few more clues throughout the series as to Dumbledore's past. I never even knew he had a sister, did anyone else? Even just a passing mention of her somewhere... I understand now why Dumbledore had to die. I mean, I knew it would have something to do with Harry needing to go it alone, but it was more than that. Had Dumbledore been around for Harry to ask about the Deathly Hallows, I think things would have turned out differently.<br /><br />7. Voldemort's arrogance was his undoing. He was too arrogant to think there would be more to the prophecy, so he went after baby Harry, thereby fulfilling his own prophecy and equipping Harry with his own power, his own soul. He was arrogant enough to think that Harry's blood in his own veins would give him Lily's protection without giving Harry any ties to him. He was arrogant enough to think that his own wand would work against Harry, arrogant enough to think Lucius' wand would work against Harry, arrogant enough to think he could just steal the Elder Wand without earning it.<br /><br />8. Let the Christ/Messiah comparisons continue: not only did Harry willingly sacrifice himself for all of mankind, but he even was, in a way, resurrected.<br /><br />9. Didn't Rowling say that a non-magic person would use magic late in life? Who was it? DId I miss something?<br /><br />10. And finally... SNAPE! I knew he was good, I knew it, I knew it!! Brent and I had just discussed Snape carrying a torch for Lily. Brent even called it that Voldemort was going to spare Lily because Snape asked him to, and that when Lily died, Snape left Voldemort forever. I was disappointed that we learned all about Snape at the end, though, I would have liked to find out little by little, and have Harry piecing it together. I guess this way was more dramatic though. I definitely teared up when Harry named his son Albus Severus and told him that Severus Snape was probably the bravest man he ever knew.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="11210500604755226710" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id='like_container_review_3175501'><a id="like_count_review_3175501" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/3175501?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">14 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3175501" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3175501" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_3175501" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 3175501, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/3175501?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_3175501' style='display: none;'><div </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_4530511" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/4530511" />    <a title="Max Ostrovsky" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/151055-max-ostrovsky"><img alt="Max Ostrovsky" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1182971578p2/151055.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/4530511?book_show_action=false">Aug 26, 2007</a>      <a title="Max Ostrovsky" class="user" name="Max Ostrovsky" href="/user/show/151055-max-ostrovsky">Max Ostrovsky</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/151055-max-ostrovsky?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/151055-max-ostrovsky?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/151055-max-ostrovsky?shelf=children">children</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer4530511" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4506217853219187781">I just wanted to say that I loved it and it exceeded all my expectations. I know most people finished their books weeks ago, but I didn't have that luxury with everything else I had going on this summer. The Girl and I decided that we wanted to reread some of the more recent books and we thought it'd be neat if we did it together. So, with her hard cover copy we read aloud the 6th book, beginning it the night we bought the 7th. <br />Yes, it was hard not starting that right away. And even harder that</span>  <span id="freeText4506217853219187781" style="display:none">I just wanted to say that I loved it and it exceeded all my expectations. I know most people finished their books weeks ago, but I didn't have that luxury with everything else I had going on this summer. The Girl and I decided that we wanted to reread some of the more recent books and we thought it'd be neat if we did it together. So, with her hard cover copy we read aloud the 6th book, beginning it the night we bought the 7th. <br />Yes, it was hard not starting that right away. And even harder that I was reading it out loud, since that would take more time. But it was a whole lot more fun. I would do all the voices and inflections. I even did some of the voices with their accents (not all, my British Isles accents are limited). <br />Of course, at the end of the 6th and several times during the 7th, I had to close the book and try to compose myself. I'm a guy and should never been seen weeping. Especially from reading! Now, if I were kicked in the nuts or my favorite team lost or my life long dog died, then it would be acceptable to openly weep. Definitely not from a book. <br />So I had to read a line and I would see the next line and I'd have to take a few moments, while The Girl was agonized. She would exclaim, "Well? What happened?" And I would see what happened. I could see the next few lines. But I just couldn't say them aloud just yet. It was quite emotional. <br />And just a few short years ago, I couldn't stand anything Harry Potter. Of course I hadn't read any of the books or seen any of the movies. I just didn't like the mass hysteria surrounding it. So I avoided it. And then people I trusted and respected began to scoff at me. The couldn't understand why I hadn't joined the Harry Potter bandwagon. The promised me that if I made it through the first two books, I would love the third. <br />So I picked up the first book and read it in a day. I thought it was cute. I picked up the second book. And read it in a day. I thought it was cute. Then I picked up the third book. And read it in a day. I thought it was good. <br />No. Really good. This was no Scooby Doo with magic adventure anymore. This actually had a larger story. After that, I read all the books, watched all the movies and had my own sort of theories about what was going to happen in the last book. I made my own death list (people sure to die). I made my survivor list (people sure to live). And finally The Girl and I read the last book. <br />Of course, I went in with high expectations, but with a realistic goal of being mildly disappointed. Isn't it always the case that anything and everything that you highly anticipate never reaches the level that you thought it'd be. <br />The last book, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows was everything I wanted from the ending to the series. I laughed. I (almost) cried. I smiled all through it at the joy of reading it. If you haven't yet gotten into Harry Potter, move out of the cave and go to a bookstore. This is a bandwagon that I'm not ashamed to have jumped on.</span>  <a data-text-id="4506217853219187781" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review4530511">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks"> href="/user/show/50332499-erato">Erato</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar id="reviewTextContainer1532507765" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8387259019757255642">U+0397 U+03AC U+03BD U+03BF U+03B9 U+03BE U+03B7 U+03C4 U+03BF U+03C5 2016 itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/597862953" />    <a title="Nina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7664770-nina"><img alt="Nina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473158830p2/7664770.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/597862953?book_show_action=false">Jun 10, 2013</a>      <a title="Nina" class="user" name="Nina" href="/user/show/7664770-nina">Nina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408812792" href="/book/show/9476275-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=5-star">5-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=ya-pnr">ya-pnr</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=read-in-2013">read-in-2013</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=hp">hp</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer597862953" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17690957993450342434">EDIT: reading this review two weeks later, that doesn't look like a very healthy reaction.<br /><br /><br />I'm kind of dead at the moment. My heart is beating at a breakneck speed but I'm breathing once a minute. I'm dizzy, too.<br />I've cried my heart out today.<br /><br />It frustrates me to no end, having so many thoughts and feeling jumbled in my head and not being able to express them clearly - or in any way.<br /><br />I can't - not that I don't want to, I'm actually unable to - talk about the plot of this book in detail, or about the</span>  <span id="freeText17690957993450342434" style="display:none">EDIT: reading this review two weeks later, that doesn't look like a very healthy reaction.<br /><br /><br />I'm kind of dead at the moment. My heart is beating at a breakneck speed but I'm breathing once a minute. I'm dizzy, too.<br />I've cried my heart out today.<br /><br />It frustrates me to no end, having so many thoughts and feeling jumbled in my head and not being able to express them clearly - or in any way.<br /><br />I can't - not that I don't want to, I'm actually unable to - talk about the plot of this book in detail, or about the characters, but I'd like to say that I have never, in my entire life, read a book or series that had such an enormous impact on my life. Aside from the fact that it completely transported me away from real life, to the point that people were actually worried about me, it's quite simply a huge accomplishment. It gives a feeling of change throughout the years that makes me feel as if <i>my</i> existence had changed, as if <i>I</i> had been through such life-altering experiences.<br />I've grown with these characters, I've felt what they've felt, I've seen every little change or adventure they've been through, and now that it's over, I feel as if I'd just been ripped apart limb from limb.<br /><br />I'm going to actually be mourning those who have died in this war.</span>  <a data-text-id="17690957993450342434" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review597862953">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link597862953" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=597862953&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_597862953'><a id="like_count_review_597862953" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/597862953?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">14 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_597862953" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_597862953" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=14&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=597862953&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_597862953" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 597862953, true, &#39;&#39;); And then when they announced the change,</span>  <span id="freeText16003092052952422709" style="display:none">HAHHA I know exactly how you feel! Up until this year, we used to have 40 minute periods and 8 periods a day. And then when they announced the change, some of the students went ballistic and our grade was thinking a petitioning (really, <i>juniors</i> petitioning).<br /><br /> The seven minute break sounds ridiculous and I don't even know how to works, honestly! It's meant to be reprieve between two 80 minute periods though, which we're decidedly unused to.<br /><br />I have 30/40 minute train+bus ride to our school, though even I think that two hours is excessive. class="section">      <div id="review_1649019361" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1649019361" />    <a title="Camilla" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19429438-camilla"><img alt="Camilla" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1439390296p2/19429438.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1649019361?book_show_action=false">Aug 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Camilla" class="user" name="Camilla" href="/user/show/19429438-camilla">Camilla</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855713" href="/book/show/22844208-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=my-finished-series">my-finished-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=want-to-read-2016">want-to-read-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=favorite-series">favorite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19429438-camilla?shelf=own-and-read">own-and-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1649019361" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15232737677593323609">I just can't believe it's over.<br /><br />This fantastic series has given me <i>so incredibly much</i> - I don't even know how to describe it. It has helped me through some really bad days, and it has made me feel a lot better on so many occasions. I just love the world, its characters, the friendships, the plot, the humor - everything! Absolutely everything. And I actually think that Harry Potter is my number one favorite series of all time, and that it somehow always will be. Just the fact that this series exis</span>  <span id="freeText15232737677593323609" style="display:none">I just can't believe it's over.<br /><br />This fantastic series has given me <i>so incredibly much</i> - I don't even know how to describe it. It has helped me through some really bad days, and it has made me feel a lot better on so many occasions. I just love the world, its characters, the friendships, the plot, the humor - everything! Absolutely everything. And I actually think that Harry Potter is my number one favorite series of all time, and that it somehow always will be. Just the fact that this series exists in the world makes me so extremely happy to think about - that a lot of children, teenagers and adults can enjoy them over and over again, laugh and cry at the same parts, fall in love with the same characters, be highly engaged in the same world and all its happenings, and just take part in an amazing journey and feel all the magic for themselves. As said, these books existence simply makes me so very happy just to think about, <i>and that says quite a lot about my love for them.</i><br /><br />I can't wait to reread this series again - <i>and again and again and again.</i><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="15232737677593323609" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545139700" href="/book/show/4979435-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14698204-gazella?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1133195680" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16343677308196172551">Extraordinary. Absolutely extraordinary. A brilliant conclusion to one of the most epic magical series I have ever read. So many incredibly memorable moments in the book. All the ends were tied together. The best book of the series in my opinion. An absolute tour de force. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1784353368" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1784353368" />    <a title="Shahad takleef" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef"><img alt="Shahad takleef" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453881901p2/35406752.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1784353368?book_show_action=false">Oct 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Shahad takleef" class="user" name="Shahad takleef" href="/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef">Shahad takleef</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1784353368" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11253747006280045593"><blockquote> <b>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all, those who live without love.U+201D </b> </blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1477056028i/20911928._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>The seventh book of the Harry Potter series, what else can I say, in my this state of bewilderment , other than <b> is a Masterpiece of the ages.</b><br>The innate theme of tragedy rears itU+2019s head here . the loss of characters too dear to our hearts and the continuous hum in the background of <i>"it all ends here"</i> , our journey that lasted too long and has had the best of our hearts would actually end here . you sho</span>  <span id="freeText11253747006280045593" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all, those who live without love.U+201D </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1477056028i/20911928._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>The seventh book of the Harry Potter series, what else can I say, in my this state of bewilderment , other than <b> is a Masterpiece of the ages.</b><br>The innate theme of tragedy rears itU+2019s head here . the loss of characters too dear to our hearts and the continuous hum in the background of <i>"it all ends here"</i> , our journey that lasted too long and has had the best of our hearts would actually end here . you should expect tears , a great deal of heart ache ,emotional breakdown moments , life threatening events with danger breathing down our character's necks. action packed ,violent and deathly battles and a few days sleepwalking hangover in the least of chances, in this incredible groundbreaking finale of the Harry Potter saga .<br>the Deathly Hallows is one of the greatest fantasy books I have ever read, the characters shine the brightest in this book , it is magnificent to follow the huge character development undergoing, leaving no doubt as to the value of nobility and morality. it pulses with the sense of maturity as much as of bravery inspite of the characters youth and lack of experience , i may quote from <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25558608.A_Torch_Against_the_Night__An_Ember_in_the_Ashes___2_" title="A Torch Against the Night (An Ember in the Ashes, #2) by Sabaa Tahir">A Torch Against the Night</a> that i finished not long ago<i> U+201CCallow is the hope of our youth" .</i><br><br>I am not in the realm of discussing events or writing about what actually happens in the plot , because either you know every moment by heart or you most definitely should discover them yourself , but i am to talk about the wonders and the awes the book offers , about the prodigiousness of this saga , about J. K. Rowling casting a Confundus Charm on every reader of hers to end this book, then to close it whispering to themselves <b>  <i>" Woah " .</i></b><br>The themes of true friendship , genuine love and self-sacrifice are so touching , it portrays how false pride ,hunger for power and selfishness always go hand in hand with evil , even in the noblest of characters . i love that Kreacher was the one who led the house elves in their fight in the Hogwarts battle , isn't it one more powerful message of Rowling's books ? that people change if we change our attitude toward them , this series believes in second chances , in true everlasting love , believes that people are actually good at heart .<br>And even with the final book in the series ,the one where Rowling was unlikely to surprise us, she pulls up her sleeves and writes a most incredible sequel to her previous 6 books , the awaited moment when Harry is expected to step out at forefront of the battle , to kill the Lord Voldmort and survive as he always did with a most unexpected skill, Rowling chooses not to walk down that tried and predictable path . Instead, harry's survival is to be seized this time by the acceptance of his own death , from the bravery not in fighting his way through battles but in the self-sacrifice. she shows again that the power of love is to overcome any other .<br>It breaks my heart that no sock is efficient to free <b>Dobby</b> from the grasps of death , it breaks my heart that <b>Sirius, Lupin , Tonks </b>and <b>Dumbledore</b> are no more , it breaks my heart that <b>Snape</b> had never showed the best of him , his winningly helplessly genuinely beating heart , it breaks my heart that for <b>George</b> every mirror would ever be the mirror of Ersid .<br>But, yet, I am to borrow <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/14877790.Jhon_Green" title="Jhon Green">Jhon Green</a>'s words <i>" it would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you "</i> . oh,yes . most definitely.<br>This series means too much to me. maybe i feel like it took me too long to start reading the books , it doesn't even make sense , may be i even feel a little bit ashamed and confused about this fact , but since i was eleven , since that very year in which i watched the first harry potter movie for the first time ever and bought that schoolbag with Harry, Ron and Hermione faces on it , i loved it , I canU+2019t fully articulate it. It just is so special and it feels weird that all these people around the world share my very same passion . I've always loved that world ,but now i do more profoundly , from a place much deeper much more sincere in my heart , i love it still and i will always do .<br><br><b>"After all this time?<br><br>Always."</b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1477056811i/20912089._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></span>  <a data-text-id="11253747006280045593" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer28993334" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17564568572860285015">I thought that this was a fitting end to the series, though two major weaknesses persist. 1)That most of the book concerns Harry, Ron, and Hermione whining in the forest while the wizarding world burns around them, and 2) Many of the deaths were poorly executed. I don't mind when authors kill off popular characters (I prefer the realism of bittersweet endings), as long as they do it right, and so in that spirit I bring you Harry Potter and the Respectable Body Count:<br><br><br><br>1. Charity Burbage, page twel</span>  <span id="freeText17564568572860285015" style="display:none">I thought that this was a fitting end to the series, though two major weaknesses persist. 1)That most of the book concerns Harry, Ron, and Hermione whining in the forest while the wizarding world burns around them, and 2) Many of the deaths were poorly executed. I don't mind when authors kill off popular characters (I prefer the realism of bittersweet endings), as long as they do it right, and so in that spirit I bring you Harry Potter and the Respectable Body Count:<br><br><br><br>1. Charity Burbage, page twelve.<br><br>If you donU+2019t recognize her swinging from her heels, naked, over the MalfoyU+2019s dinner table, itU+2019s probably because you skipped over all those muggle studies chapters. Because they werenU+2019t important enough to exist. Not only is the first direct kill of It Who Shall be Last not VoldemortsU+2019 personally, I canU+2019t come up with an appropriate snakes on a plane reference.<br><br>2. Hedwig, page fifty-six.<br><br>Flies engulfed in the eerie glow of a bug zapper are accorded more respect in death U+2013 at least thereU+2019s a glimmer of will in that tiny brain. But as bad as being locked in a cage that also just happens to be in the way of Random Green Curse #1, there are lamer deaths to come.<br><br>3. Mad-Eye Moody, page fifty-five (or seventy-eight, whatever).<br><br>Speak of the devil; the most justifiably paranoid survivalist in the Potterverse isnU+2019t ready for a surprise attack? After swallowing whole someone elseU+2019s battle plan? From the one guy he had to physically drag along? Why not bring him back during the final charge as a cybernetic half-centaur/house elf, his stolen eye replaced with a gatling plasma cannon? Better or worse than carving a cute little cross over his buried crazy eye?<br><br><br>4. Death Eater #1, page fifty-nine.<br><br>Exploding owl-cage sidecar!!! Note to Chris Columbus: DonU+2019t cut HedwigsU+2019 Fawkes impression out of the movie.<br><br>5. Death Eater #2, page sixty-one.<br><br>Again, Hagrid tackling the guy trying to run him off the sky is cinematic gold, even if the death is merely implied.<br><br>6. Rufus Scrimgeour etc, page 159.<br><br>Finally! One of the few U+2018good-guysU+2019 weU+2019ve been made to want dead since his first line, dies. Kind of like how Gorman died in Aliens, only without the selfless, redeeming act of heroism slash Alien disposal. Oh, but he didnU+2019t give away HarryU+2019s location while they tortured him. Whoop-de-friggin-do.<br><br>There were some other ministry blokes there too; I would have enjoyed reading more than one line about it, but I can understand why JK didnU+2019t want to sacrifice a moment of angsty bickering for yet another dreary battle scene.<br><br>7. Random Muggle Family #1, page 232.<br>A one-dimensional villain canU+2019t go too many pages without slaughtering innocents; the underlings begin to lose respect.<br><br>8. Gregorovich, page 280.<br>Again, nice that Harry gets to see Voldemort at his most cruel. As opposed to buying groceries, haggling with his insurance adjustor, etc.<br><br>9. Bathilda Bagshot, page 340.<br>While technically not a U+2018deathU+2019 she died during the months HHR were wandering in the snow.<br><br>10. James and Lily Potter, page 344.<br>11. Voldemort, page 345.<br>The first rule of retconning is, you do not talk about retconning. The second rule of retconning is, you do NOT TALK about retconning. To maintain any sense of plausibility you have to bury the groundwork for the end in something the reader already thinks they understand, such as what happened the night Harry got his scar.<br><br>Michael FraynU+2019s Copenhagen explores the uncertainty of memory in great detail. How a larger context (WWII) can warp it with equal direction, how difficult it can be for two people to reconstruct the simplest details such as where they walked and for how long. At a minimum the play leaves you with the idea that you can never know something with absolute precision, and that knowing isnU+2019t as important as keeping that awareness in the back of your mind. Worst case, it means I can write whatever I want to fit whatever ending IU+2019ve concocted, and nobody can say IU+2019ve contradicted myself or that IU+2019m just making this nonsense up on the fly, because the facts are in a constant state of distortion.<br><br>So now Voldemort is Harry, Harry is Voldemort. Whatever. Although itU+2019s one a them ironical sitchialations that James and LilysU+2019 final moments have been preserved by Voldemort in ways he isnU+2019t aware of.<br><br><br>12. Ted Tonks, Dirk Cresswell, Gornuk, page 439.<br><br>This was pointless. Not pointless in the sense that death is very real and pointless sometimes, but in the sense that if youU+2019re only going to give these people a few insignificant lines (We can wander through the woods too! Yay!), IU+2019m not going to care when they die over the radio. Death should, you know, impact the reader in possibly a different way. <br><br>13. Peter U+201CWormtailU+201D Pettigrew, page 471.<br><br>Draco, is this Harry Potter? Draco, fetch the goblin! What was that noise? Draco! Go check it out, oh, wait, no, weU+2019ll send Wormtail instead. He hasnU+2019t been in the book yet, why not? Yeah, thatU+2019s it, Wormtail. <br><br>Bumbling villians aside though, Wormtail needed to redeem himself in a small way, and then he needed to understand that it was too little, too late. Good job, enjoy your cookie.<br><br>14. Dobby, page 476.<br><br>Seriously, JK, this was the best you could come up with? Bellatrix flinging her knife to kill a disapparating house elf, after letting Harry and Co walk all over her and all her lame henchmen, is bullshit.<br><br>But beyond that, although I can understand how you donU+2019t want Harry or the reader to know that the elder Dumbledore is involved, killing Dobby to safeguard your plot contrivance for less than one hundred more pages is a savage weakness. Dobby and your readership deserved better.<br><br>15. Nameless goblin # 47, etc, etc. page 549.<br><br>Sometimes it sucks to be the messenger. Or within the blast radius.<br><br>16. Crabbe, page #633-ish.<br><br>Fiendfyre, like exploding owl-cages, will look epic on screen. <br><br>17. Fred Weasley, page 637.<br><br>The Weasleys have too many family members for all of them to survive, but I'm still trying to figure out which twin was which and why I should care.<br><br>18. Severus Snape, page 658.<br><br>Finally, the truth. Although IU+2019m not surprised Dumbledore had a plan all along, the extent to which Snape pined for Lily is a bit disturbing. Sweet, but a little stalkerish. Still, you canU+2019t question his devotion or valor. People say thereU+2019s no greater love than to lay down your life for your friends, but I say dying is the easy way out. Snape gave up his soul, his bloodline, and his reputation, even after she became Lily Potter, and though itU+2019s sad he had to die, he doesnU+2019t strike me as a person who could ever have been happy with life afterwards. Again, a little twisted, a little predictable, and he didnU+2019t take anyone with him, but still a good death.<br><br>19. Colin Creevy, page 694.<br><br>This did surprise me, and thinking about it later made me realize that Rowling really isnU+2019t going to write any more Potter books, as Colin was one of the characters she seemed to be seeding for the future. Though there was a lot for me to hate about HP7 I still enjoyed it immensely, so hereU+2019s to going out on top rather than wringing every last drop of blood from your fantasy series until each book is more withered than the last (*cough* Wheel of Time *cough*).<br><br>20. Harry, page 704.<br><br>WeU+2019ve been wondering about this for years; Will Harry die? Will Voldemort die? Or both? Having it both ways is an old literary cop-out. Meh.<br><br>21. Nagini, page 733.<br><br>Enough is Enough!<br><br>22. Bellatrix Lestrange, page 737.<br><br>23. Voldemort, page 744.<br><br>This was a bit overdone.<br><br>24. Tonks and Lupin, page 745.<br><br>Worst Deaths ever.</span>  <a data-text-id="17564568572860285015" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review28993334">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_114821071" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/114821071" />    <a title="Tintin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4097024-tintin"><img alt="Tintin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1281003287p2/4097024.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/114821071?book_show_action=false">Jul 29, 2011</a>      <a title="Tintin" class="user" name="Tintin" href="/user/show/4097024-tintin">Tintin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer114821071" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5016749493699492664"><b>STORY:</b><br>Harry finally realizes what it takes to defeat Voldemort U+2013 but it is no easy solution. What choice will he make?<br><br><b>ENJOYMENT FACTOR:</b><br>I started this over a year and a half ago and hated it so much I left it unfinished 1/3 of the way. I finally coerced myself to finish it before seeing the final HP movie. I didnU+2019t hate it as much the 2nd time around (I think the loathing may have been partly due to the bad taste that Book 6 left in my mouth) and despite myself I enjoyed the story (for the most p</span>  <span id="freeText5016749493699492664" style="display:none"><b>STORY:</b><br>Harry finally realizes what it takes to defeat Voldemort U+2013 but it is no easy solution. What choice will he make?<br><br><b>ENJOYMENT FACTOR:</b><br>I started this over a year and a half ago and hated it so much I left it unfinished 1/3 of the way. I finally coerced myself to finish it before seeing the final HP movie. I didnU+2019t hate it as much the 2nd time around (I think the loathing may have been partly due to the bad taste that Book 6 left in my mouth) and despite myself I enjoyed the story (for the most part). Rowling fleshes out her characters, showing the good and bad in them (prime example: Dumbledore). Rowling also aces at raising the stakes, shrouding the plot in mystery, getting her characters in trouble and out again. The plotline is convoluted and it sags heavily in the middle but the secrets kept this reader plodding along.<br><br><b>WRITING STYLE:</b><br>RowlingU+2019s love of adverbs borders on the obscene. The greatest affront is in the last chapter:<br><br><i>Harry to his son: U+201CAlbus Severus, you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was <b>probably</b> the bravest man I have ever known.U+201D</i><br><br>Really, Rowling? Snape worked as a double-agent to the two most powerful wizards at great personal cost, duped Death Eaters and Order members alike, endured the hate and distrust of all, sacrificed his life for love, and HARRY CANU+2019T EVEN BE FREAKING SURE that he was the bravest!??!<br><br>Fortunately the movieU+2019s scriptwriters promptly fixed this oversight.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380337981i/695259.jpg" alt="(;_;)" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>OTHER OBSERVATIONS</b> (The X Factor):<br>As I watched the movie soon after finishing the book, itU+2019s difficult for me to divorce the two. I LOVED the movie. If only for those 5 minutes of SnapeU+2019s memories in the pensieve, the most moving performance I have seen in recent years. (All hail Alan Rickman!) I know people are complaining about all the revisions, but I actually appreciated most of the things they changed in the movie. They cut out the plodding (and unnecessary parts), focused on the meat and bones, and fixed all the inconsistencies and awkward plotting I noticed in the book. For example:<br><br>1)tRavenclawU+2019s diadem (a horcrux) was accidentally destroyed in the book by Fiendyre. The explanation being that the cursed fire was so potent it was one of the few things that could destroy a horcrux. Sorry but I donU+2019t buy that. If so, Harry and co. shouldnU+2019t have wasted their time and energy looking for a magical object (Sword of Gryffindor) to destroy the horcrux when they could have used their energies to learn the Fiendfyre curse instead. They fixed this in the movie by using a Basilisk fang to destroy the horcrux instead of Fiendfyre.<br><br>2)tIn the book I had no idea how Neville pulled the Sword of Gryffindor from the Sorting Hat U+2013 wasnU+2019t it stolen by Griphook? The movie makes this clearer. <br><br>3)tI liked the scene where Harry realizes what he MUST do to defeat Voldemort (I believe itU+2019s the climax of the entire series), but I found HarryU+2019s face-off with his archnemesis cheesy to the point of being ridiculous. He duels with the most murderous and evil Wizard in history in full view of the entire school because, as he tells Voldy: <i>U+2019I sacrificed my life for them so now theyU+2019re immune to you. You canU+2019t hurt them!U+2019</i> I understand the rationale (same principle as his motherU+2019s sacrifice) but that doesnU+2019t stop me from rolling my eyes. They fixed this in the movie by moving the duel in a private area with no spectators and not giving anyone U+2018magic immunityU+2019. (Although I doubt if the light saber rays shooting from the duelersU+2019 wands was an improvement).<br><br>4)tThe plot point of an Ultimate Elder Wand didnU+2019t sit well with me. I thought by this time Harry and Voldemort would face off in a true test of skill U+2013 I expected something along wandless magic. But why bother when you can win by technicality and have an Elder Wand to Rule Them All (a.k.a. <i>deus ex machina</i>). Unfortunately this plot hole was beyond the scope of the movie to fix.<br><br>That said, I think the book and movie complement each other perfectly. The movie highlights the best parts and improves on the story, while the book gives a thorough explanation of everything. <br><br><b>COMMENT ON THE HP SERIES AS A WHOLE:</b><br>RowlingU+2019s greatest achievement is in creating memorable, distinctive characters and a magical world readers would want to live in again and again. I remember being struck with awe when I read Book One nearly a decade ago. However, I found RowlingU+2019s stories increasingly diluted and un-enjoyable from Book 4. Not because of the dark tone, but because the convoluted plot lines made it harder to figure out the true story beneath. Coincidentally, this was also the time Rowling probably fired her editor and her books afflicted with elephantiasis syndrome.<br><br>My major disappointment with the series, however, is the <i>uselessness</i> of its main character. Harry Potter never improved in his abilitiesU+2014 his achievements are from pure luck and genetics. He doesnU+2019t study, he doesnU+2019t practice, he doesnU+2019t make the effort. Even his questionable talents in wizardry and Parseltongue could be directly attributed to Voldemort. Harry Potter is mediocre, and remained a mediocre pawn of Dumbledore all through out.<br></span>  <a data-text-id="5016749493699492664" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review114821071">  <td    <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1331672671?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Aline" class="user" name="Aline" amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" id="reviewTextContainer1331672671" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1353637404562460203">Now I have officially finished reading the Harry Potter series for the first time ever.<br /><br />I don't know why I've never read them as a child, considering that I'm a reader since I learned to read in school and I loved the HP movies as a child. (Maybe because the German covers of the HP books aren't looking that childfriendly?...) <br />Anyways I'm SO grateful I still got the chance to read them because, even if I already knew the plot, reading the story was still a different experience <3 <br />I love the wor</span>  <span id="freeText1353637404562460203" style="display:none">Now I have officially finished reading the Harry Potter series for the first time ever.<br /><br />I don't know why I've never read them as a child, considering that I'm a reader since I learned to read in school and I loved the HP movies as a child. (Maybe because the German covers of the HP books aren't looking that childfriendly?...) <br />Anyways I'm SO grateful I still got the chance to read them because, even if I already knew the plot, reading the story was still a different experience <3 <br />I love the world around Harry even more now.<br /><br /><br />Edit: Oh yeah and I've read the last half of the book today :D</span>  <a data-text-id="1353637404562460203" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1331672671" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1331672671" ref="like" false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1331672671?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1331672671' style='display: itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/223625075?book_show_action=false">Sep 21, 2015</a>      <a title="Victoria" class="user" name="Victoria" href="/user/show/5593888-victoria">Victoria</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar
