id="reviewTextContainer223625075" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17645583498367920677"><i>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D </i> (You're such a wise man, Dumbledore.)<br><br>A <b>million of stars</b> will never be enough to rate this book.<br><br><b>No Spoilers! (I promise!)</b><br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i> is by far, my favorite book of the entire series. Hands down. I'm very, VERY happy I come to the end of the series, but also sad since the series is over now. It was my 2012 summer goal and I have finally accomplished it! With help and support from m</span>  <span id="freeText17645583498367920677" style="display:none"><i>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D </i> (You're such a wise man, Dumbledore.)<br><br>A <b>million of stars</b> will never be enough to rate this book.<br><br><b>No Spoilers! (I promise!)</b><br><br><i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i> is by far, my favorite book of the entire series. Hands down. I'm very, VERY happy I come to the end of the series, but also sad since the series is over now. It was my 2012 summer goal and I have finally accomplished it! With help and support from my dear friends, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/7584700-keertana">Keertana</a>, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/5587526-jordyn-lost-in-zombieland">Jordyn</a>, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/6278820-inge-exams">Inge</a>, and <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/7421799-olivia-a-nerdy-girl">Olivia</a>, they all convinced me to keep reading the series and assured me that the series will keep getting better and it did! This book changed me...It had changed me in a postive way. It's one of those books that changed me and make a lasting impression upon your life. Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows suprised me, made me laugh, and made me weep silent tears for an hour. There's never a single book that can changed me and I'm proud to say this is the 1st life-changers book. Why didn't I read this sooner?! Everybody gave raving and positive reviews on it, but crazy me ignored it. I'm very happy that I read the entire series. It has been one hell of a ride! :D I predict in the future when I'm old and wrinkly, I will still read this series over again and again...<br><br>The characters again were smart, cunning, and well-developed from beginning to end. Lots of tragic deaths has occured in this book which will impacted lots of readers, but I'm not going to name names because it will spoiled the story for those who haven't read the series. My favorite character would have to be Snape besides Harry and his friends. I finally get to see his good/evil intentions present in the last installment. The word "Always" that Snape said had shown a new light in its name. This finale shows us that even the evil (bad) guys have good intentions as well and can be refer as the good guy in some cases. Snape is one of them. The ending to the book was spectacular and unforgettable to a remarkable series. The action was fast-paced and very addicting. You will find in no time you'll finish this book sooner than expected! Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is just so epic! :) Enough, said.<br><br>Overall, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is a phenomenal. It will always engages readers and give us a sense of belonging and emotions that follow with it. I will never forget this series because it had brought possiblities to a new light and changed me in a <i>very</i>, very good way. (I'm almost certain it will change others as well) And for that, I will always be eternally grateful. Thank you, J.K Rowling, for writing such a phenomenal series, one that readers all over the world will never forget and will treasure beyond all else....<br><br>P.S Plus, a box of tissues would be helpful to read this book....:(<br><br><b>I STRONGLY encourage reading this series if you HAVEN'T AlREADY! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!!</b><br><br>And last, my contribution to Snape...<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380361297i/712265._SX540_.jpg" width="500" height="400" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380361297i/712266._SX540_.jpg" width="500" height="400" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380298720ra/687296.gif" width="500" height="500" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>(Thanks Snape.)<br><br>______________________________________<br><br>If you want to read my previous reviews of 1st-6th books of Harry Potter, just click the link below.<br>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/367679519">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone's review</a> <br>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/175731871">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets's review</a><br>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/223624272">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban's review</a><br>-<a Phoenix's review</a><br>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/223624580">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince's review</a></span>  <a data-text-id="17645583498367920677" href="#"  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_3458624" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3458624" />    <a title="Ken-ichi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/216786-ken-ichi"><img alt="Ken-ichi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1288306941p2/216786.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3458624?book_show_action=false">Oct 22, 2010</a>      <a title="Ken-ichi" class="user" name="Ken-ichi" href="/user/show/216786-ken-ichi">Ken-ichi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">humans?</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/216786-ken-ichi?shelf=escape">escape</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/216786-ken-ichi?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/216786-ken-ichi?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/216786-ken-ichi?shelf=childrens-lit">childrens-lit</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer3458624&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer3458624" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14798126976378818722">When I first read this book, my only caveat was what I thought of as the protracted, sagging middle of the story, in which the trio travel around the country, trying to figure out what to do without really doing much. They break into the Ministry, they revisit Godric's Hollow, they obtain the sword of Gryffindor, but mostly they just relocate, camp in the woods, and try to interpret the intentions of the dead and departed, or deal with their legacies by interpreting the artifactual evidence they</span>  <span id="freeText14798126976378818722" style="display:none">When I first read this book, my only caveat was what I thought of as the protracted, sagging middle of the story, in which the trio travel around the country, trying to figure out what to do without really doing much. They break into the Ministry, they revisit Godric's Hollow, they obtain the sword of Gryffindor, but mostly they just relocate, camp in the woods, and try to interpret the intentions of the dead and departed, or deal with their legacies by interpreting the artifactual evidence they left behind. Regulus and the locket; Grindewald and Dumbledore and the fragments of their story indirectly derived from Belinda Bagshot; Lily's letter to Sirius; the deer patronus; the anonymous missives of support left at the grave of Harry's parents in Godric's Hollow; learning about the DA and the Order through the Potterwatch broadcasts, etc.<br /><br />One example of this was the scene at the Lovegood's, when Harry discovers Luna's private mural of himself, Ron, Hermione, Neville, and Ginny, intertwined with a golden ribbon of the word "friends" repeated over and over. There were some other important narrative elements introduced in this scene, and some action, but the description of this mural had me tearing up. As I read that passage, Luna transformed from an adorably oblivious but ultimately irrelevant side character to this formerly lonely, abandoned human being for whom the DA's friendship was as novel as it was profoundly essential. And I was actually filled with grief that Harry learned this too late, that this crisis was exposing the unbreakable strength underlying all Harry's friendships too late to acknowledge and cherish those bonds for what they were worth. <br /><br />Except... it wasn't too late, because Luna and many of the others were still alive, and still fighting. So why did I feel like they were dead? This brought to mind a passage from <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2615008.Netherland" title="Netherland by Joseph O'Neill">Netherland</a> (which I now feel more inclined to finish):<br /><br /><blockquote>An ancient discovery was now mine to make: to leave is to take nothing less than a mortal action. [...] after Mama's cremation I could not rid myself of the notion that she had been placed in the furnace of memory even when alive and, by extension, that one's dealings with others, ostensibly vital, at a certain point become dealings with the dead.</blockquote><br /><br />For me, this cast the middle section of the book in a completely new light. Now it became an examination of the way the departed, both dead and alive, continue to touch us and affect our lives through the memories and thoughts they leave behind. In Netherland, O'Neil was pointing out the tragedy of this, how even the living can become as distant from us as the dead, but I think Rowling wants the reader to see this as a profoundly important part of being alive, that seeking out and understanding these kinds of evidence makes bearable the void left by the absent. The influence of the dead is important throughout this book and throughout this series, but in this seemingly humdrum plateau of the novel, I think it becomes paramount.<br /><br />There are lots of other incoherent things I could blather on about, mostly the difference between self-sacrifice and martyrdom and the merits of happy endings, but this review is approaching the edge of "long" with "pointlessly long" well in sight, so I'll finish. I loved this book as I love the whole series, and its existence has made my life better.</span>  <a data-text-id="14798126976378818722" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review3458624">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link3458624" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=3458624&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_3458624'><a id="like_count_review_3458624" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/3458624?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">13 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3458624" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3458624" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=13&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=3458624&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_3458624" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 3458624, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/3458624?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_3458624' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_3458624' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 3458624, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div></div><div class="uitext" style="float: right; class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1349912217" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1349912217" />    <a title="Coos Burton" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21766870-coos-burton"><img alt="Coos Burton" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434917460p2/21766870.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1349912217?book_show_action=false">Aug 12, 2015</a>      <a title="Coos Burton" class="user" name="Coos Burton" href="/user/show/21766870-coos-burton">Coos Burton</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788498381450" href="/book/show/2366001.Harry_Potter_y_las_Reliquias_de_la_Muerte">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21766870-coos-burton?shelf=juveniles">juveniles</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21766870-coos-burton?shelf=fantasia">fantasia</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1349912217" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7132616163372583633"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439441807ra/15838455.gif" width="350" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Pocas veces sufrU+00ED tanto como en U+00E9ste U+00FAltimo libro, no se dan una idea de lo que me costU+00F3 terminarlo. IntentU+00E9 retrasarlo, pero adentro mU+00EDo sabU+00EDa que por mU+00E1s doloroso que fuera, tenU+00EDa que darle fin a una hermosa saga. Usualmente, la gente me decU+00EDa cosas como "vas a llorarte la vida cuando lo termines, vas a ver", e incluso antes de iniciar la saga, con ojos como platos "U+00BFNunca leU+00EDste Harry Potter? Te los presto, pero leelos, lo vas a amar" y cosas de esa U+00EDndole, y yo decU+00EDa "no creo, dudo que vaya</span>  <span id="freeText7132616163372583633" style="display:none"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439441807ra/15838455.gif" width="350" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Pocas veces sufrU+00ED tanto como en U+00E9ste U+00FAltimo libro, no se dan una idea de lo que me costU+00F3 terminarlo. IntentU+00E9 retrasarlo, pero adentro mU+00EDo sabU+00EDa que por mU+00E1s doloroso que fuera, tenU+00EDa que darle fin a una hermosa saga. Usualmente, la gente me decU+00EDa cosas como "vas a llorarte la vida cuando lo termines, vas a ver", e incluso antes de iniciar la saga, con ojos como platos "U+00BFNunca leU+00EDste Harry Potter? Te los presto, pero leelos, lo vas a amar" y cosas de esa U+00EDndole, y yo decU+00EDa "no creo, dudo que vaya a ponerme tan sentimental". Nunca pensU+00E9 que el asunto fuera tan literal, ni tampoco imaginU+00E9 que iba a pasar todo lo que pasU+00F3, no solo en el libro, sino en mi vida en general durante los momentos en los que me sumergU+00EDa en la lectura. Y a medida que leU+00EDa, mU+00E1s cuenta me daba de que me habU+00EDa encariU+00F1ado con absolutamente todos los personajes, y que por consiguiente, mU+00E1s duro iba a ser el final.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439441259ra/15838378.gif" width="350" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Es increU+00EDble lo que un buen libro le puede hacer al corazU+00F3n, y me resulta casi inconcebible pensar que en algU+00FAn momento de mi vida me prohibU+00ED la saga simplemente por haberme dejado abrumar por el fanatismo ajeno. Ahora veo con claridad por quU+00E9 ese fanatismo, ahora veo por quU+00E9 la gente siente fascinaciU+00F3n por el mundo mU+00E1gico de J.K. Rowling, y hasta me atrevo a decir que me siento parte de esa pasiU+00F3n. Sin embargo, siempre apreciU+00E9 que fuera una autora que dio vida a la lectura en una generaciU+00F3n que quizU+00E1 no estaba tanto en la literatura. Eso es algo que te guste o no la idea de sus libros, se valora enormemente, al menos todo aquU+00E9l que ame la lectura y tenga deseos de compartir U+00E9ste buen hU+00E1bito. TrascendiU+00F3, rompiU+00F3 con todo, y ahora acU+00E1 estoy, todavU+00EDa conmocionada. Lo U+00FAnico que sU+00E9 con certeza es que voy a volver a leerla en algU+00FAn momento, porque quiero volver a sentir todo lo que sentU+00ED cuando recurrU+00ED a la saga por primera vez. Estoy gratamente sorprendida de que nadie me haya spoileado nada (las U+00FAnicas veces que leU+00ED spoilers fue porque me tentU+00E9 de leer artU+00EDculos sobre HP, mala, muy mala mU+00EDa), porque es asU+00ED como mejor se vive la experiencia. Estoy triste porque no puedo creer que todo haya terminado, pero contenta de ser ahora otra afortunada que conoce U+00E9ste maravilloso mundo, es una historia que quedarU+00E1 por siempre en mi corazU+00F3n.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439441880ra/15838456.gif" width="350" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="7132616163372583633" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1353344635?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Jesica" class="user" name="Jesica" href="/user/show/44637869-jesica">Jesica</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44637869-jesica?shelf=worth-re-read">worth-re-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1353344635" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12179563827506095442"><blockquote>Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all, those who live without love.</blockquote><br />5/5 stars<br /><br />And it all comes to an end. This book is the fantastic finale of Harry Potter series. I canU+2019t be more satisfied. From the beginning, itU+2019s full of breathtaking actions. Finally itU+2019s an all out war for both sides. And IU+2019m glad even though the story mostly set in various places, they still went back to Hogwarts in the end because I love the school. The final battle was just epic. Everyone involved. Th</span>  <span id="freeText12179563827506095442" style="display:none"><blockquote>Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all, those who live without love.</blockquote><br />5/5 stars<br /><br />And it all comes to an end. This book is the fantastic finale of Harry Potter series. I canU+2019t be more satisfied. From the beginning, itU+2019s full of breathtaking actions. Finally itU+2019s an all out war for both sides. And IU+2019m glad even though the story mostly set in various places, they still went back to Hogwarts in the end because I love the school. The final battle was just epic. Everyone involved. The students, Order of Phoenix, DumbledoreU+2019s Army, graduated students , the statues, the ghosts, even Peeves the poltergeist. ItU+2019s like a horrible reunion. Sure thereU+2019re deaths, and there were some characters I like among them T.T but there were also surprises, things that I didnU+2019t expect. Malfoy became kind heroic for a brief moment when he saved GoyleU+2019s life. Neville Longbottom became awesome. HeU+2019s not only lead HogwartsU+2019 resistance against the Carrows but he fought fearlessly that even Voldemort was impressed with him. And remember NevilleU+2019s boggart? ItU+2019s seemed that he was scared if his grandmother with a good reason. The old lady was truly scary when sheU+2019s angry. The twist is just cruel. I canU+2019t say much without spoil it but.. well, itU+2019s cruel. I canU+2019t find other words for it. I love how Harry turned to be the big hero here. I admit that there were times in previous books where I was a bit disappointed on HarryU+2019s character development but at the end, heU+2019s wonderful in this book. Usually Hermione was the one played big roles in solving mysteries but Harry did it by himself here. I donU+2019t know how to express what I think about this book but that itU+2019s exceed my expectations. A wonderful book. Really recommended for all fantasy reader. :D</span>  <a data-text-id="12179563827506095442" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> id="reviewTextContainer697304521" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16836562473774816618"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> This was a really full book!!! Lots of different emotions. Lots of action. Lots of tidying up various plot pieces. I'm sad to see the story end, but I approve of the ending. Review to come. <br><br><b>Review:<br><br>Actual rating: 5 I-Wish-It-Wasn't-Over stars. No spoilers. </b><br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Sad it's over" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439945182ra/15908661.gif" alt="Sad it's over photo: cryinggirl.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>It's over. I can't believe it's over. I put off finishing the last few in the series because I didn't want to see it end. I hate watching a world I've loved with characters I've bonded to end. <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Chin up" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439945182ra/15908662.gif" alt="Chin up photo: hold your chin up tumblr_lih49y7BO81qi3s0qo1_500.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>But alas, I'm going to keep my</span>  <span id="freeText16836562473774816618" style="display:none"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> This was a really full book!!! Lots of different emotions. Lots of action. Lots of tidying up various plot pieces. I'm sad to see the story end, but I approve of the ending. Review to come. <br><br><b>Review:<br><br>Actual rating: 5 I-Wish-It-Wasn't-Over stars. No spoilers. </b><br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Sad it's over" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439945182ra/15908661.gif" alt="Sad it's over photo: cryinggirl.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>It's over. I can't believe it's over. I put off finishing the last few in the series because I didn't want to see it end. I hate watching a world I've loved with characters I've bonded to end. <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Chin up" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1439945182ra/15908662.gif" alt="Chin up photo: hold your chin up tumblr_lih49y7BO81qi3s0qo1_500.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>But alas, I'm going to keep my chin up on this one because I can always reread the series if I miss them too much. :0)<br><br>There's a million reviews out there on this book/series. Nothing I say will be new or enlightening. I'm keeping this short and sweet. I felt a whole gamut of emotions in this final installment. Lots of puzzle pieces fell into place. Rowling tidied up everything really well. I'm happy with the way it ended. She redeemed herself from the rage she made me feel in the previous installment. </span>  <a data-text-id="16836562473774816618" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_26033301" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/26033301" />    <a title="Jessika" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1166992-jessika"><img alt="Jessika" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445122165p2/1166992.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/26033301?book_show_action=false">Nov 28, 2009</a>      <a title="Jessika" class="user" name="Jessika" href="/user/show/1166992-jessika">Jessika</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer26033301" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17918021561394352873">Honestly, if I could give this more stars--I totally would. I literally JUST finished this. I'm crying. And I'm laughing. And as much as I "hated" JKR (I mean, c'mon, who could really hate her?!) at times throughout this series, I love her so much right now! Not to sound completely clichU+00E9, but this is seriously THE BEST BOOK I HAVE EVER READ. Like I said...I laughed. I <s>cried</s>. I <b>sobbed</b>. I gasped. I hated. I screamed. I yelled. In other words, I have NEVER <i>felt</i> so much as I did while I read this b</span>  <span id="freeText17918021561394352873" style="display:none">Honestly, if I could give this more stars--I totally would. I literally JUST finished this. I'm crying. And I'm laughing. And as much as I "hated" JKR (I mean, c'mon, who could really hate her?!) at times throughout this series, I love her so much right now! Not to sound completely clichU+00E9, but this is seriously THE BEST BOOK I HAVE EVER READ. Like I said...I laughed. I <s>cried</s>. I <b>sobbed</b>. I gasped. I hated. I screamed. I yelled. In other words, I have NEVER <i>felt</i> so much as I did while I read this book. It takes an amazing author to move me the way that JKR did with not only this book, but this entire series. J.K. Rowling, I must say you have done a fantastic job. I flew through this book. I couldn't put it down. There were times that I honestly doubted JKR throughout this book--I remember thinking: "Seriously? You're really gonna do this? Do you KNOW what you're doing?" Well, it wasn't until the ending that I realized she knew (more than any of us could ever have) exactly what she was doing--with amazing results. <br /><br />As a whole, with this series, JKR has created a cast of characters and a world that I know I won't forget anytime soon. Fortunately, I was able to grow up with Harry Potter, so this entire phenomenon that she has created is like home to me, in much the same way that Hogwarts was like a home to Harry. <br /><br />I cannot wait to see what J.K. Rowling comes out with next...I will be eagerly waiting and anticipating...</span>  <a data-text-id="17918021561394352873" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=world-building-goals">world-building-goals</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=these-mentor-dynamics">these-mentor-dynamics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=characters-who-are-everything-to-me">characters-who-are-everything-to-me</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1493512030" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10816804343406225554">This reread have left me feeling quite content for now and at least for the next half decade. Fucking ingenuity all around.<br /><br />Before this reread, Godric's Hollow was my favorite chapter but wow, The Forest Again changed that and of course, King's Cross is one of the most brilliant chapters of the series. Mentor goals: Dumbledore.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[However, the name Albus <i>Severes</i> Potter will always bother me because he was not the bravest man Harry knew. Sure, he had the skills to fool Voldemort, but th</span></span>  <span id="freeText10816804343406225554" style="display:none">This reread have left me feeling quite content for now and at least for the next half decade. Fucking ingenuity all around.<br /><br />Before this reread, Godric's Hollow was my favorite chapter but wow, The Forest Again changed that and of course, King's Cross is one of the most brilliant chapters of the series. Mentor goals: Dumbledore.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[However, the name Albus <i>Severes</i> Potter will always bother me because he was not the bravest man Harry knew. Sure, he had the skills to fool Voldemort, but that doesn't discount his actions towards Harry because he expected him to be like is father when he was so much like his mother. Wouldn't Snape have spotted that at once if he was so in love with Lily. Guess his sole redeeming point failed him there. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="10816804343406225554" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_4461540" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/4461540" />    <a title="Amber" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/139082-amber"><img alt="Amber" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1182257946p2/139082.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/4461540?book_show_action=false">Aug 13, 2007</a>      <a title="Amber" class="user" name="Amber" href="/user/show/139082-amber">Amber</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">everyone who's read the previous books</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/139082-amber?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer4461540" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9548034473970015388">[THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS, SO PLEASE DON'T READ IF YOU STILL HAVEN'T READ THE BOOK!]<br /><br />I must say that the time waiting for the book was a lot more torturous than the actual read. there were all those forums and newsletters wondering 'would harry live or die?' 'is snape good or bad?' 'what if hogwarts burns to the ground and everyone dies?!' and furthermore, 'how long would it take for spoilers to come out in the media and from random mean people?'<br /><br />The book didn't arrive on my doorstep till the</span>  <span id="freeText9548034473970015388" style="display:none">[THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS, SO PLEASE DON'T READ IF YOU STILL HAVEN'T READ THE BOOK!]<br /><br />I must say that the time waiting for the book was a lot more torturous than the actual read. there were all those forums and newsletters wondering 'would harry live or die?' 'is snape good or bad?' 'what if hogwarts burns to the ground and everyone dies?!' and furthermore, 'how long would it take for spoilers to come out in the media and from random mean people?'<br /><br />The book didn't arrive on my doorstep till the following week 'cause I chose free shipping at amazon, but miraculously enough I avoided all spoilers. the ones on my newsletter were easy enough by just scrolling real fast with my hand on the monitor as the thread appeared and disappeared. this easy avoidance of spoilers had me worried the book had no thrills whatsoever. especially reading enough at first to know people liked the book. no one would like if Harry were dead.<br /><br />I was not one of those fast readers who finished it in about one second. no, it took me about four days which is a miracle to me. I fell asleep a lot during the camping phase of the story... well, at least till Harry had to jump in and get the sword and Ron showed back up. that made me loosen up a bit.. become one with the characters again. for awhile, it was just a surface read. see, I also wasn't one of the ones who reread the old books before starting, so I really needed a refresher on some of the lesser characters thus stopped in the midst of reading several times to google this info. at least I read enough threads from those who did read the other books over again, to keep certain clues in mind for the big finale.<br /><br />Towards the end, when things heated up, I got a tad worried for Harry 'cause his death would seem courageous and the whole walking ghosts beside him through the woods bit really brought a tear to my eye.. this would be acceptable to all who read if he died this way, right? I thought about having to walk in (since it was around 6am by this time) with a tear in my eye to say Harry died. this idea sounded pathetic, but c'mon, climatic bit! too early to still be awake and reading! the Dumbledore appearance in 'his head'! (I liked this line most of all: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" mom constantly tries to tell me that there isn't a difference between your inner world and your outer world.. what's the difference? what difference would it make if all life were just one big dream? anyway, I won't get too philosophical with this, but beyond what certain people may've thought about how Dumbledore was brought back to talk to Harry -- I had read this wasn't necessary -- I really enjoyed it)<br /><br />So yes, it may've been a bit weak to bring Harry back from possible death, but I'd rather Harry live and get his happy ending than naught. I mean, who would've defeated Voldemort otherwise?<br /><br />One small issue I had--though I am happy I got the Trust Snape sticker at Borders.. I knew better!-- was that Snape wasn't brought to rest at the end. he was just left apparently at Whomping Willow. does this mean he could possibly still be alive? ..the epilogue kind've proves otherwise though. I felt after all he did, he deserves more respect than just to have a namesake. I felt the most compassion for him during 'The Prince's Tale' chapter especially.<br /><br />Beyond that, I didn't regret reading it (since I didn't really have any real wants and needs beyond the quality of the writing) or throw it across the room as apparently some people did (wtf?). one day I'll reread all the books again since I hear it's fun to see how connected they all really are. I think that's brilliant. this is the best children's / YA series I've ever had the chance of reading and am glad I picked it up when I did even if I didn't grow up with Harry.</span>  <a data-text-id="9548034473970015388" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_4461540" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_4461540" ref="like" class="jsLike href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1679550529" />    <a title="Bec" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4619726-bec"><img alt="Bec" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464308147p2/4619726.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1679550529?book_show_action=false">Aug 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Bec" class="user" name="Bec" href="/user/show/4619726-bec">Bec</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Audiobook 9781781102695" href="/book/show/29917370-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=library">library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1679550529" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3423503715555552906">This review first appeared on <a href="http://readerswonderland.com/5-things-harry-potter-deathly-hallows-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION:</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444012540ra/16441331.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS</b><br><i> <u>I wasnU+2019t prepared</u> </i><br>IU+2019ve known for a long time which characters die (Tumblr has spoilers everywhere when your a billion years behind everyone else). I thought I would be braced for the emotional turmoil. HAHAHAHAHAHA WHO WAS I KIDDING! In some ways I think knowing who died but not when or how made it worse. There were so many feels and deaths and intense fights.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470131274ra/19890985.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i> <u>Everyone is grey</u></i></span>  <span id="freeText3423503715555552906" style="display:none">This review first appeared on <a href="http://readerswonderland.com/5-things-harry-potter-deathly-hallows-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION:</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444012540ra/16441331.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS</b><br><i>  <u>I wasnU+2019t prepared</u></i><br>IU+2019ve known for a long time which characters die (Tumblr has spoilers everywhere when your a billion years behind everyone else). I thought I would be braced for the emotional turmoil. HAHAHAHAHAHA WHO WAS I KIDDING! In some ways I think knowing who died but not when or how made it worse. There were so many feels and deaths and intense fights.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470131274ra/19890985.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>  <u>Everyone is grey</u></i><br>One of my favourite parts of DEATHLY HALLOWS was learning more about Dumbledore and Snape and their pasts. I love how it made them more grey, not simply good and evil. It made them more real, more complex, more questionable and admirable.<br><br><i>  <u>My favourite book of the series</u></i><br>This book had everything IU+2019ve been waiting for since book one. Minimal romantic angst, intensity and fast pacing from the first chapter. I could barely put it down, especially once the Battle of Hogwarts began. There was so much plot, so many answers, so many epic fight scenes and feels.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1466848367ra/19524934.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><u>  <i>What do I do now?</i></u><br>IU+2019m kind of lost. I canU+2019t believe IU+2019ve finished this series, and I only started it in January this year. ItU+2019s weird that itU+2019s over. If I feel like this after only six months, how did those of you who grew up with Harry and the gang ever recover?<br><br><i>  <u>I cannot wait to reread them</u></i><br>This is a series I will revisit again one day. I want to read them in physical form and find all the little clues and foreshadowing I missed this first time round. And I expect it will be just as magical the next time round.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470131274ra/19890986.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>  <u>In Summary</u></b><br>HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS was my favourite Harry Potter book. So much plot, so much action, so little romantic angst. I loved it. </span>  <a data-text-id="3423503715555552906" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1299951540" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1299951540" />    <a title="julieta  " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22438184-julieta"><img alt="julieta  " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474827647p2/22438184.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1299951540?book_show_action=false">Aug 29, 2015</a>      <a title="julieta  " class="user" name="julieta  " href="/user/show/22438184-julieta">julieta  </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=female-authors">female-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=1-ya">1-ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=with-movies">with-movies</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=favorite-characters">favorite-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=2015">2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22438184-julieta?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1299951540" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16211021682630754025"><b><s>Entire</s> series review.</b><br /><br />I never intended to write a book per book review. Why bother? There's nothing I could have said that almost everybody doesn't know. But also, I was part of that almost up until now.<br />Anyway, I started reading this series for a bunch of reasons, most of them obvious but also there was this sort of question on the back of my head: Can somebody be 17 and still like a middle-grade intended book series? It's tied with a lot of people's childhood or first read series and I have read</span>  <span id="freeText16211021682630754025" style="display:none"><b><s>Entire</s> series review.</b><br /><br />I never intended to write a book per book review. Why bother? There's nothing I could have said that almost everybody doesn't know. But also, I was part of that almost up until now.<br />Anyway, I started reading this series for a bunch of reasons, most of them obvious but also there was this sort of question on the back of my head: Can somebody be 17 and still like a middle-grade intended book series? It's tied with a lot of people's childhood or first read series and I have read a bunch of series by now and yeah, <b>I loved it</b> but I'm not gonna be like "I misss it so much" because I just read it.<br /><br />Because also I read <i>Chronicles of Narnia</i> last year and <b> I hated it</b>. It's older and it has many different things with HP but it's like one of those series. The characters were so stupid, seriously but instead in this series I found flawed, heart-warming, <i>hard-not-to-love</i> characters. That's probably why I loved it the most because <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K rowling</a> really gave some reality to her characters and understood them.<br /><br />It was better than I expected-- even though my expectations were high--- but one thing I didn't expect was 1) That I wouldn't like the movies as much after it. It just never went through my head.<br />2) That I'd be shipping Ron and Hermione and Harry and Ginny. When I saw the last movie and saw that Ron and Hermione kiss it was a big WTF for me, it was like out of nowhere in my head. it makes more sense when you read the books but you didn't see it that much on the movies. I was like: But Harry and Hermione...? (There's like <i>nothing</i> between them in the books.) I didn't mind Harry and Ginny that much but now I just really ship them.<br /><br />There are probably more things I'd like to say about it but I just can't think of anything right now but <u>it was as good as promised.</u></span>  <a data-text-id="16211021682630754025" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter id="reviewTextContainer464048599" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1924050050226395341"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1379789155i/519143.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>This is the Series of our time.</b><br>These seven books changed lifes. I am sure they did. They thaught us (the ones who read it) a lot. About life. About people. About the world in general. <br>All the seven books have incredible messages waiting for us. They contain a whole new world to discover and still it is one that is similar to ours. <br><br>J.K. Rowling shows in these books how to live. How to change the world and oneself. She shows all the types of persons. Really all of them. <br>In each and every you disco</span>  <span id="freeText1924050050226395341" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1379789155i/519143.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>This is the Series of our time.</b><br>These seven books changed lifes. I am sure they did. They thaught us (the ones who read it) a lot. About life. About people. About the world in general. <br>All the seven books have incredible messages waiting for us. They contain a whole new world to discover and still it is one that is similar to ours. <br><br>J.K. Rowling shows in these books how to live. How to change the world and oneself. She shows all the types of persons. Really all of them. <br>In each and every you discover similarities with yourself. Everyone in these books is real, is living. <br><b>And Hogwarts will indeed be always there to welcome you home.</b> It simply is like a home. Always there, always waiting for you...<br>I mean... <br>Honestly, I cannot even write a proper review. <br>You cannot comment on a legend. On something magnificient and magical. <br>At least I cannot. <br><br>The books left me damaged that it ended and still happy that I could experience it. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380398856ra/771169.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="1924050050226395341" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return  <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/983368172?book_show_action=false">Jun 25, 2015</a>      <a title="Sara" class="user" name="Sara" href="/user/show/32014561-sara">Sara</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591061" href="/book/show/820344.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=in-a-series">in-a-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=book-to-movie">book-to-movie</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=clean-romance">clean-romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32014561-sara?shelf=unputdownable">unputdownable</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer983368172" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9777274404250826003">The first time I read this book I did it in one take, in an 18 hours frenzy or so. Just because I needed to know what happened. Then after a month or so, I re-read it and got more of the book in, something I wasnU+2019t able to do the first time because of my super quick pace.<br />Well I loved it, and I still love it every time I read it. I read the Harry Potters every three of four years, when I feel IU+2019ve forgotten enough about them to enjoy them once more. The only bad thing I can say about this book is</span>  <span id="freeText9777274404250826003" style="display:none">The first time I read this book I did it in one take, in an 18 hours frenzy or so. Just because I needed to know what happened. Then after a month or so, I re-read it and got more of the book in, something I wasnU+2019t able to do the first time because of my super quick pace.<br />Well I loved it, and I still love it every time I read it. I read the Harry Potters every three of four years, when I feel IU+2019ve forgotten enough about them to enjoy them once more. The only bad thing I can say about this book is that, being it the last in the saga, when I finish it, I feel a bitter disappointment at not having more. It is so good every time that after it, I just need to stay away from every other book for a while because well, nothing is like Harry Potter. <br />If it is your first time reading it, lucky you, my advice to you is take it slow, I know it is impossible, but try to relish every page because at the end of it you wonU+2019t get more, sigh. <br />The book has everything: suspense, adventure, struggle, deceit, loss, and most of all retribution! It is spectacular, breath taking, finger twisting, moving, and well, itU+2019s just a masterpiece.<br />The chapter about Snape makes me cry every time!<br /></span>  <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/57105725" />    <a title="Spider the Doof Warrior" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior"><img alt="Spider the Doof Warrior" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/57105725?book_show_action=false">May 25, 2015</a>      <a title="Spider the Doof Warrior" class="user" name="Spider the Doof Warrior" href="/user/show/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior">Spider the Doof Warrior</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer57105725" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16494304494923877143">I seriously love this book. It has its flaws though. Harry Potter was probably one of the best things about the 2000s along with Dir en grey and other assorted good music. It brings back good memories of happily reading to awesome music and getting drawn into the lives of these fascinating characters.<br /><br />JK Rowling does an excellent job with characters. She makes you feel for them. She makes you love Snape even though he's really a jerk. (You can't tell me he didn't put that sword in ice on purpose</span>  <span id="freeText16494304494923877143" style="display:none">I seriously love this book. It has its flaws though. Harry Potter was probably one of the best things about the 2000s along with Dir en grey and other assorted good music. It brings back good memories of happily reading to awesome music and getting drawn into the lives of these fascinating characters.<br /><br />JK Rowling does an excellent job with characters. She makes you feel for them. She makes you love Snape even though he's really a jerk. (You can't tell me he didn't put that sword in ice on purpose just to make Harry extra miserable.) She redeems the Malfoys. <br />Unfortunately she makes you love so many characters and then cruelly kills them. No one is safe. It is a war of love vs fear of fearing death vs. accepting it and love and its risk of loss and pain.<br /><br />Also, I did not hate the epilogue, but I did want more details about what happened afterwards. <br /><br /><br /><br />Harry Potter. Folks can ask me, you're STILL in love with this series? After all this time?<br /><br /><br />Always.<br /><br />Yes. I still love this series. </span>  <a data-text-id="16494304494923877143" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545583008" href="/book/show/17347379-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18148278-stephanie?shelf=owned">owned</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1585710108" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4389425019846114372">It ended in a bittersweet "All was well". I cannot fathom so many emotions. I loved the hole series. It had its up and downs (not too down though). I loved the characters. I think you can really learn and relate to them all. <br /><br />I felt like I had to finished this book, in the middle of the night, instead of sleeping, but, at the same time, I felt like I did want to. This series makes it so real and makes me feel sad that I am a Muggle and did not get my letter (no problem, I can always go to Orlando</span>  <span id="freeText4389425019846114372" style="display:none">It ended in a bittersweet "All was well". I cannot fathom so many emotions. I loved the hole series. It had its up and downs (not too down though). I loved the characters. I think you can really learn and relate to them all. <br /><br />I felt like I had to finished this book, in the middle of the night, instead of sleeping, but, at the same time, I felt like I did want to. This series makes it so real and makes me feel sad that I am a Muggle and did not get my letter (no problem, I can always go to Orlando, right?). <br /><br />I always knew I would like this series. Always. I always had high expectations. This book did not meet them. But he broke them. It was what I expected in the end with different means. Do I make myself clear?<br /><br />Well, the main thing is: I loved it as everyone else and I am happy I did.</span>  <a data-text-id="4389425019846114372" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1585710108"> p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788884518781" href="/book/show/3304459-harry-potter-e-i-doni-della-morte">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=miei">miei</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1018370167" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4741457009365027641">SERIE HARRY POTTER N. 7<br />"DOPO TUTTO QUESTO TEMPO SEVERUS? SEMPRE"<br /><br />Non so se riuscirU+00F2 a fare una recensione decente. <br />L'ho finito ieri sera alle due di notte.<br />Ho pianto ho gioito ho riso.<br />Non sono piU+00F9 la stessa dopo ieri.<br />Non so che dire. Ho il cuore spezzato. Tutto quello che credevo e che pensavo fosse certo dei primi 6 libri viene stravolto.<br />Ora si che capisco tante cose.<br />PerchU+00E8 non ho letto prima questi libri? <br />Semplicemente meravigliosi, da rileggere sicuramente. <br />Sento giU+00E0 la loro mancanza.<br />Sono davve</span>  <span id="freeText4741457009365027641" style="display:none">SERIE HARRY POTTER N. 7<br />"DOPO TUTTO QUESTO TEMPO SEVERUS? SEMPRE"<br /><br />Non so se riuscirU+00F2 a fare una recensione decente. <br />L'ho finito ieri sera alle due di notte.<br />Ho pianto ho gioito ho riso.<br />Non sono piU+00F9 la stessa dopo ieri.<br />Non so che dire. Ho il cuore spezzato. Tutto quello che credevo e che pensavo fosse certo dei primi 6 libri viene stravolto.<br />Ora si che capisco tante cose.<br />PerchU+00E8 non ho letto prima questi libri? <br />Semplicemente meravigliosi, da rileggere sicuramente. <br />Sento giU+00E0 la loro mancanza.<br />Sono davvero, davvero contenta di come sia finito. Di cosa sia successo. Di tutto. BU+00E8 ovvio a parte i punti in cui avrei preferito diversamente e ho pianto come una fontana, ma doveva andare cosU+00EC e rimarranno tutti nel mio cuore. Sempre.<br /><br />Se non avete ancora letto la saga come me, cosa aspettate? Leggetela immediatamente!!!! <br />Non ve ne pentirete ;)</span>  <a data-text-id="4741457009365027641" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=fantasy-misc">fantasy-misc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=book-hangover-like-whoa">book-hangover-like-whoa</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer885819998" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5113094192004349531">01.18.15<br />GAWD. The catharsis. Also, I stand by my note from new year's. <br /><br />01.01.15<br />Regarding the epilogue: I was watching DH1 last night and was completely enraptured, as always, when Hermione read the Tale of the Three Brothers. And then it hit me: the perfect name that should have been. I have to say, I much prefer the name Remus Ignotus over Albus Severus. It combines one of the best mentors Harry ever had with his heritage and doesn't glorify abusive people.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer989844600" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9176144886812649465">I can't believe I've read this book in only two days. I definitely can't believe I've finished the Harry Potter series. What?!! This might even be my favorite one, together with the fifth one probably. Followed closely by the third and fourth book. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review989844600">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link989844600" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=989844600&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_989844600'><a id="like_count_review_989844600" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/989844600?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">12 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_989844600" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_989844600" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=12&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=989844600&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_989844600" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 989844600, true, &#39;&#39;);      >            <span id="freeTextContainer7345661028905006725">'All was well'. id="reviewTextContainer1453033261" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5929675112090538866">As usual this book was an automatic 5 stars. Great ending to the series !!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1453033261">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1453033261" title="Flag this review as
