            >            <span id="freeTextContainer3003188230145735962">PERFECCIU+00D3N.<br /> Esta U+00EDncreible saga no podrU+00EDa haber tenido un final mU+00E1s perfecto. SU+00ED, llorU+00E9 a moco tendido con muchas de las muertes, pero tambiU+00E9n amU+00E9 ver las facetas de muchos personajes que no nos habU+00EDan mostrado; la verdadera historia de ellos (como Snape, Dumbledore e incluso de Tom Ryddle, aka Lord Voldemort). Si bien durante los primeros seis libros vemos desarrollar sus personalidades y cU+00F3mo crecen como personas, en este libro rescato mucho a Neville.<br /><br />Esta es una saga que todos deberU+00EDan leer,</span>  <span id="freeText3003188230145735962" style="display:none">PERFECCIU+00D3N.<br /> Esta U+00EDncreible saga no podrU+00EDa haber tenido un final mU+00E1s perfecto. SU+00ED, llorU+00E9 a moco tendido con muchas de las muertes, pero tambiU+00E9n amU+00E9 ver las facetas de muchos personajes que no nos habU+00EDan mostrado; la verdadera historia de ellos (como Snape, Dumbledore e incluso de Tom Ryddle, aka Lord Voldemort). Si bien durante los primeros seis libros vemos desarrollar sus personalidades y cU+00F3mo crecen como personas, en este libro rescato mucho a Neville.<br /><br />Esta es una saga que todos deberU+00EDan leer, una saga que el dU+00EDa de maU+00F1ana les leerU+00E9 a mis hijos; porque sU+00ED, es una historia ficticia, pero cargada de valores y significados: amistad, valentU+00EDa, sacrificio, inocencia, magia, honestidad, y por sobre todo, amor.</span>  <a data-text-id="3003188230145735962" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> <span id="reviewTextContainer1209374262" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13608190092611402731">Agora que dei por terminada a saga Harry Potter, posso finalmente viver em paz e participar das conversas sobre o tema, e inclusive fazer referU+00EAncias ao mesmo! Sinto, no entanto, U+00E9 que cheguei um bocado atrasada, mas como dizia o outro: "Mais vale tarde, que nunca".<br /><br />NU+00E3o vou prolongar isto muito mais, atU+00E9 porque nU+00E3o hU+00E1 muito a acrescentar U+00E0s imensas reviews feitas deste livro e desta saga. HU+00E1 sU+00F3 que dizer que nU+00E3o U+00E9 por acaso que a mesma U+00E9 tU+00E3o famosa.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/117462800" />    <a title="Mlpmom (Book Reviewer)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3829694-mlpmom-book-reviewer"><img alt="Mlpmom (Book Reviewer)" Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3829694-mlpmom-book-reviewer?shelf=dtb-book">dtb-book</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer117462800" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17628118342876223399">I adore this series. In fact, I think I have re-read these books over seven times, so much in fact that the bindings are starting to give and they look very well loved. <br />While a part of me is so sad to see it end I am so happy with the way it ended. I am so happy that we got a glimpse into all their lives years later.<br />While I was sad about who didn't make it through this amazing journey I think it was carried out brilliantly. </span>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1253005791" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1253005791" />    <a title="Amy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34248255-amy"><img alt="Amy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477196222p2/34248255.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1253005791?book_show_action=false">May 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Amy" class="user" name="Amy" href="/user/show/34248255-amy">Amy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1253005791" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8658424909892987092">Is there any series quite as satisfying to read from beginning to end as this one? There's simply nowhere I'd rather escape to. Now, all I need is a stroll through Diagon Alley and a mug of butterbeer. <br /><br />Thank you, J. K. Rowling, for this story. From the bottom of my lifelong-book-loving, literature-teaching, truth-seeking heart, I thank you. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17014305671052053462">4.5 stars. An excellent end to arguably the best YA fantasy series ever. Easily the darkest of all the books but just as much fun. Loved the ending, especially the epilogue which really leaves you smiling. Highly Recommended. <br /><br />Winner: Andre Norton Award (Nebula) for Best YA Novel (2008)<br />Winner: Mythopoeic Fantasy Award for Best YA Novel (2008)<br />Nominee: Locus Award for Best YA Novel class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_178168261" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/178168261" />    <a title="Kirsti (Melbourne on my mind)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind"><img alt="Kirsti (Melbourne on my mind)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1309259410p2/5663034.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/178168261?book_show_action=false">Aug 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Kirsti (Melbourne on my mind)" class="user" name="Kirsti (Melbourne on my mind)" href="/user/show/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind">Kirsti (Melbourne on my mind)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747595830" href="/book/show/2352137.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=things-i-can-read-a-million-times">things-i-can-read-a-million-times</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=audience-young-adult">audience-young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=2013">2013</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=5-star">5-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=2014">2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=2015">2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=own-it-hard-copy">own-it-hard-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=oh-god-my-feels">oh-god-my-feels</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5663034-kirsti-melbourne-on-my-mind?shelf=setting-uk">setting-uk</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer178168261" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3946448865925911487">31/12/2015<br />Frankly, I'm impressed that I managed to cram this one into the last three days of the year, because I desperately wanted to finish the series this year. And I did - with four hours to spare. *high fives self*<br /><br />For some reason, this reread brought a hell of a lot of emotions with it. The developing relationship between Ron and Hermione gave me feels. Harry's reaction to Lupin turning up gave me feels. All the deaths gave me feels, obviously. Neville proving himself to be a true Gryffindo</span>  <span id="freeText3946448865925911487" style="display:none">31/12/2015<br />Frankly, I'm impressed that I managed to cram this one into the last three days of the year, because I desperately wanted to finish the series this year. And I did - with four hours to spare. *high fives self*<br /><br />For some reason, this reread brought a hell of a lot of emotions with it. The developing relationship between Ron and Hermione gave me feels. Harry's reaction to Lupin turning up gave me feels. All the deaths gave me feels, obviously. Neville proving himself to be a true Gryffindor and his grandmother's pride in him gave me feels. McGonagall's pride and heartbreak over Harry gave me feels. Dumbledore's backstory gave me feels. And I may have broken down and sobbed during the scene between Ron and Harry that I mentioned below. <br /><br />Basically, this book is perfection, and it's hands down my favourite of the series. Now let's just go ahead and pretend that Snape redemption plot never happened... <br /><br />29/6/2014<br />Everything I said last time around still stands. But one of the things I find most interesting about Deathly Hallows is getting to see the other side of Dumbledore. In the other six books, he's basically presented as this massive force for good, who would never make dubious decisions or do the wrong thing or endanger his students. But here? Here we see that Dumbledore operated in the grey areas of morality as much as anyone. Which is one of those interesting things that comes with age - realising that your teachers and your heroes aren't infallible. They're human. <br /><br />18/3/2013<br />There are literally no words for how much I adore this book. It takes a lot in a book to make me cry (almost nothing, however, when it comes to movies and TV shows...), and yet Deathly Hallows reduces me to a weeping mess every time I read it. That said, the epilogue grates a little more every time - it just feels slightly sloppy or a little too neat and tidy or SOMETHING.<br /><br />That said, I love how there are so many tendrils to the story that have been gradually developed over the previous six books, and how expertly they're all pulled together here. Neville becomes more of a BAMF with every reading, and I will never not cheer for Molly Weasley screaming "NOT MY DAUGHTER, YOU BITCH" at Bellatrix. <br /><br />While I know a lot of people get all "Harry Potter and the Prolonged Camping Trip" about the central portion of the book, those same people likely would have been upset or annoyed if they had, as Harry yells at Ron, been finding a Horcrux a week and home safe and sound by Christmas. Besides, the prolonged camping trip leads to what is arguably my favourite moment in the entire series - Ron destroying the locket, then breaking down in tears, and Harry saying "She's like my sister. I love her like a sister and I reckon she feels the same way about me. It's always been like that. I thought you knew." It's such a simple moment, such a small thing. But for me, it says so much about Ron, about Harry, and about the honesty that underpins their friendship. <br /><br />In summary, twenty years from now, people will say to me "After all this time?". And my reply will be "Always."</span>  <a data-text-id="3946448865925911487" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_72484501" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/72484501" />    <a title="Mike (the Paladin)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin"><img alt="Mike (the Paladin)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473374585p2/2187043.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/72484501?book_show_action=false">Jan 08, 2014</a>      <a title="Mike (the Paladin)" class="user" name="Mike (the Paladin)" href="/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin">Mike (the Paladin)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer72484501" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11913396886161871837">A fantastic wrap up to a fantastic series. I can picture (as I noted in the review of the last book) young people who have read these books coming across them when they are in their later decades of life, smiling and sitting down to re-read them again.<br /><br />While these books are what I would call young adult rather than youth they are among the best written I've come across. They are among the best written books of whatever level I've come across...<br /><br />They are an absorbing story of believable characters</span>  <span id="freeText11913396886161871837" style="display:none">A fantastic wrap up to a fantastic series. I can picture (as I noted in the review of the last book) young people who have read these books coming across them when they are in their later decades of life, smiling and sitting down to re-read them again.<br /><br />While these books are what I would call young adult rather than youth they are among the best written I've come across. They are among the best written books of whatever level I've come across...<br /><br />They are an absorbing story of believable characters in a well constructed story world. It has it's light and it has it's dark. I come in every case very close to giving them 5 star ratings. I wish we had half stars or possibly a 10 star system as there are 5 star books I like much better, but 4 star books I don't like as well. It's a compromise. So, let's call it 4 stars and highly recommended. <br /><br /><br />Review to be expanded.<br /><br />As you can see I upped the rating to 5 stars. the underlying story comes to a conclusion that also carries a nice allegorical turn. Harry has not only gotten older he has (if slowly) grown. This and these novels do something that the best novels should do.<br /><br />They leave you wanting more about the characters and more about the story, because they have become real to you and you care about them.<br /><br />Highly recommended. Start from the first book, which is much younger in feel and follow the characters as they grow up. Do it many times as it's like revisiting old friends and favorite places. Don't miss it/them.<br /><br />Really. </span>  <a data-text-id="11913396886161871837" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30396515-anna?shelf=magicians-witches-wizards-warlocks">magicians-witches-wizards-warlocks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer905339211" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6804314356752600833">IT'S OVER.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1387214957ra/7552408.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The feels, man. The feels.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1457104245ra/18320466.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/541120.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1457104245ra/18320467.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>What's left to say?<br>I will propably always be in denial about my favorite book series ever really coming to an end.<br>But I loved everything about this book. <br>It was... perfect. It was pretty sad, yes. I hated that J.K. killed off some of the characters, but I still think it was nessecary and it needed to be done for the book to stay believable - I mean, come on! It just wouldn't make the whole good guys vs. bad guys work if NONE of the good ones died (looking at y</span>  <span id="freeText6804314356752600833" style="display:none">IT'S OVER.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1387214957ra/7552408.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The feels, man. The feels.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1457104245ra/18320466.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/541120.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1457104245ra/18320467.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>What's left to say?<br>I will propably always be in denial about my favorite book series ever really coming to an end.<br>But I loved everything about this book. <br>It was... perfect. It was pretty sad, yes. I hated that J.K. killed off some of the characters, but I still think it was nessecary and it needed to be done for the book to stay believable - I mean, come on! It just wouldn't make the whole good guys vs. bad guys work if NONE of the good ones died (looking at you, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/150038.Cassandra_Clare" title="Cassandra Clare">Cassandra Clare</a> and your book <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/8755785.City_of_Heavenly_Fire__The_Mortal_Instruments___6_" title="City of Heavenly Fire (The Mortal Instruments, #6) by Cassandra Clare">City of Heavenly Fire</a>).<br><br>So, will I reread this book thousands and thousands of times ?<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1457090294ra/18317642.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="6804314356752600833" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/439846979?book_show_action=false">Oct 22, 2012</a>      <a title="Moira Russell" class="user" name="Moira Russell" href="/user/show/1630617-moira-russell">Moira Russell</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer439846979" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5607274372586441576">I <i>detest</i> Harry Potter. I was working <i>in a bookstore</i> when this book came out -- a tiny independent bookstore with floor displays of Cormac McCarthy and Jung. I don't even want to tell you how many boxes my boss ordered of this.* (He had to sign a nondisclosure agreement that was about ten pages long.) And then I had to sell them to people all day long, and I had to <i>giftwrap</i> them. Nobody had said anything about giftwrapping being part of selling books! I can sell books all day long! I could recomm</span>  <span id="freeText5607274372586441576" style="display:none">I <i>detest</i> Harry Potter. I was working <i>in a bookstore</i> when this book came out -- a tiny independent bookstore with floor displays of Cormac McCarthy and Jung. I don't even want to tell you how many boxes my boss ordered of this.* (He had to sign a nondisclosure agreement that was about ten pages long.) And then I had to sell them to people all day long, and I had to <i>giftwrap</i> them. Nobody had said anything about giftwrapping being part of selling books! I can sell books all day long! I could recommend books til your ears fall off! Giftwrapping?.....yeah no. I still remember one elderly couple, obviously buying a present for a young relative, whose annoyance turned to visible pity as they watched, who then murmured, "That's all right, we'll just do that at home, dear."<br /><br />My friends (that should be "friends") still think this is funny.<br /><br /><br />*And then I had to listen to him complain about how Costco et al selling it as a loss leader meant he wouldn't be able to rake in a ton of money selling thousands of copies like he'd done up until Vol 5, or whatever.</span>  <a data-text-id="5607274372586441576" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1338717791" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15468036409791621036">I CAN'T BELIEVE IT'S OVER!11!!!11!<br /><br />I'll be uploading a sort of Harry Potter thoughts video on my youtube channel (<a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAVsGdX11bChc1y9K7nQlyQ" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAVs...</a>) but I gotta stay true to my goodreads and spill some beans. Some UNSPOILERY beans. <br /><br />This book was so explanatory, it was gratifying! I loved loved that nothing was left for imagination (unless you don't go with Dumbledore's guesses). I CRIED SO BAD but it was only in one part not the whole thing, as I thought it would be. I loved Dumbledore's p</span>  <span id="freeText15468036409791621036" style="display:none">I CAN'T BELIEVE IT'S OVER!11!!!11!<br /><br />I'll be uploading a sort of Harry Potter thoughts video on my youtube channel (<a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAVsGdX11bChc1y9K7nQlyQ" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAVs...</a>) but I gotta stay true to my goodreads and spill some beans. Some UNSPOILERY beans. <br /><br />This book was so explanatory, it was gratifying! I loved loved that nothing was left for imagination (unless you don't go with Dumbledore's guesses). I CRIED SO BAD but it was only in one part not the whole thing, as I thought it would be. I loved Dumbledore's plan and also how we discovered things about Dumbledore that exposed him as a human, who'd made mistakes and was full of regret. I cry. I cry at you know what. <br /><br />I was SO SURPRISED BY A SPECIAL LITTLE BOY PEOPLE UNDERESTIMATED FOR HIS WHOLE LIFE AND HE WAS SO BRAVE AND CUTE AND YOU KNOW WHO IM TALKING ABOUT. YOU DO. <br /><br />And the THROWBACKS in this book!11!!!1!<br /><br />I HAVE A 100000000 MORE THOUGHTS TO SHARE, so make sure to check out the video I'm making for it!</span>  <a class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7752871457411561004">This series is one I could easily pick up again and again and find the same delight I felt the first time. I loved the ending. I was really kind of hoping that Dumbledore's withered hand meant he had a horcrux too and would live again but it was not meant to be. I wish all the world could stand up at the same time and give JK Rowling a standing ovation. She was insprired and remains inspiring.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_91591680" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/91591680" />    <a title="Apokripos" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1662951-apokripos"><img alt="Apokripos" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441699987p2/1662951.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/91591680?book_show_action=false">Jul 05, 2010</a>      <a title="Apokripos" class="user" name="Apokripos" href="/user/show/1662951-apokripos">Apokripos</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Potter Fans, who else?! </span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Apokripos by: </span>      the "Voice"  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=fiction-contemporary">fiction-contemporary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=award-winning-books">award-winning-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=from-book-to-film">from-book-to-film</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer91591680" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14404840018471011262"><blockquote> <b>The Magic of the Boy Who Lives<br />(A Book Review of <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i> by J.K. Rowling)</b> </blockquote><br /><br /><br />It all started on an ordinary train ride from Manchester to London. <br /><br />What follows two decades after is nothing short of magical: million copies of the book in 64 languages have been sold (some in matter of minutes), spawning movie franchise, toys and other merchandise with an upcoming theme park to open some time soon. It has also catapulted its celebrated author from being a struggling single m</span>  <span id="freeText14404840018471011262" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>The Magic of the Boy Who Lives<br />(A Book Review of <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i> by J.K. Rowling)</b></blockquote><br /><br /><br />It all started on an ordinary train ride from Manchester to London. <br /><br />What follows two decades after is nothing short of magical: million copies of the book in 64 languages have been sold (some in matter of minutes), spawning movie franchise, toys and other merchandise with an upcoming theme park to open some time soon. It has also catapulted its celebrated author from being a struggling single mom to becoming BritainU+2019s richest woman. Then come November this year a renewed U+201CHarrysteriaU+201D will grip the world over as devoted fans flock to the cinemas for the first of the highly-anticipated two-part final movie installment. This, my friends, is the cultural phenomena wrought by the Harry Potter book series which in its wake energized a generation of readers young and old alike.<br /><br /><i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i>, the final volume in the series (touted as the most anticipated novel in history) is from beginning to end a thrillsome chase between Harry and his arch nemesis, Lord Voldemort. Fully restored to his former self, the Dark Lord with the Death Eaters discusses a new plot to kill the boy wizard at Malfoy Manor. In a deadly broomstick pursuit just a few pages later, where Harry is about to be spirited off into hiding by remaining members of the Order of the Phoenix, may make readers cry out that the cost this early are dear. The Dark Lord no longer lurks in the shadows; his diabolical influence along with the palpable fear on his persona resurges and with his forces mounts a successful takeover and infiltration of the Ministry of Magic itself and Hogwarts. A Nazi-like racial campaign to U+201CregisterU+201D and control Muggle-born and U+201Cblood traitorU+201D wizards burgeons. Harry meanwhile finds himself both a fugitive and a combatant, trying to elude the clutches of Lord Voldemort even as he tries to locate and destroy the Horcruxes. As with other earlier novels, there is a magical puzzle at the heart of Hallows that of the artifacts called the Deathly Hallows the possessor of which enables one to conquer Death.<br /><br />When I picked up the book and felt its sheer heft, fascinated by the exquisite jacket illustration by Mary Grandpre, I felt an odd combination of excitement and regret. IU+2019d been waiting for this moment for so long U+2014 years in fact since reading book one and two in high school; three, four and five in college; then the sixth this year U+2014 and yet I almost didnU+2019t want the experience to be over, didnU+2019t want to know that goods times has reached its end. However, once I opened the book, the feeling was comparable to a well intended Portkey, sucking me once more in a world IU+2019ve grown to love and familiar with, yet with a pang of sadness and awareness that itU+2019s the last leg of the journey this time around.<br /><br /><i>Hallows</i> clearly has the feel of a series finale, as virtually everybody who had figured somewhat prominently in the previous books shows up and most of the settings are revisited. Coming into the seventh book, Rowling had quite a task as she must now answer all the questions and subplot threads she had buried in the preceding six books. In hindsight, I just canU+2019t help but be amazed at the sheer, immensely complicated arc the story has turned and I now realize how clues were strewn throughout the books (with some I readily picked up and some so sneaky with utter obviousness Rowling never truly ceases to astound me).<br /><br />Perhaps the most engaging part of <i>Hallows</i> is RowlingU+2019s character work particularly with Harry in a continuing progression as he completes the painful journey to adulthood struggling with necessary sacrifices even as he reflects on all that heU+2019s been through. He must also deal with the aggressive influence of his link to Lord Voldemort, which tortures him and also enables him to keep track of what the Dark Lord is up to. Rowling also takes the time to bring HarryU+2019s friendship with Ron and Hermione into full focus. She even manages to give remarkable moments to characters such as Neville Longbottom and Luna Lovegood, among others. Rowling do prove that she can still intrigue as we are made to see that kindly Dumblerdore, sinister Severus Snape and even Dudley Dursley might be more complicated than what we earlier imagined them to be and that they might have hidden aspects to their personalities.<br /><br /><i>Hallows</i> is, indeed, darker, still creepy in some parts and packed with an emotional wallop as entire platoon of characters, both beloved and wicked, are mowed down, the casualties coming so suddenly and furiously, it will disconcert the hardiest of readers; in all sense itU+2019s a very much grown up read. With this final volume, Rowling does some of her best writing yet keeping the prose consistently reader-friendly (well almost, until you see MollyU+2019s cursing) and accessible, with none of the divergence that bogged down the sixth book. I tried to disengage a few times, forcing myself to read more slowly, wanting to savor the plot, but before long I was turning the pages in a blur.<br /><br />At journeyU+2019s end, J.K. Rowling leaves readers with a gift of a whimsical world of magic and imagination that rivals Middle-Earth, Oz and Narnia. Hallows bears the strength and weaknesses of the entire series in concentrated form, like a potion produced pure. It is a satisfying, lovingly crafted final gift from Rowling to her readers and a fitting sendoff to Harry Potter, the boy wizard whose adventures enchanted an entire generation of dreamers thought untouched by a charm of reading, perhaps the most impressive magic trick of all.<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />_______________<br />Published by Arthur A. Levine Books (Hardcover First Edition, July 2007)<br />759 pages<br />Started: June 23, 2010<br />Finished: June 30, 2010<br />My rating: U+2666 U+2666 U+2666 U+2666 U+2666<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14404840018471011262" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review91591680">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37026645-matt-smith?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37026645-matt-smith?shelf=read-in-2014">read-in-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37026645-matt-smith?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1111198255" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6565008681476437233">There's a line in <i>Firefly</i>. The crew is going to rescue Mal from Niska. Wash is piloting <i>Serenity</i> into Niska's space station. Zoe describes it as "hitting a bullseye six thousand miles away."<br /><br />More than not, this is how I always think about endings. When you begin, you fire the shot, and when it ends you hope that it lands exactly where you want it to. The more complex the story, the more complex it becomes to hitting a bullseye. And ending a single novel is hard. Giving it a suitable ending and a</span>  <span id="freeText6565008681476437233" style="display:none">There's a line in <i>Firefly</i>. The crew is going to rescue Mal from Niska. Wash is piloting <i>Serenity</i> into Niska's space station. Zoe describes it as "hitting a bullseye six thousand miles away."<br /><br />More than not, this is how I always think about endings. When you begin, you fire the shot, and when it ends you hope that it lands exactly where you want it to. The more complex the story, the more complex it becomes to hitting a bullseye. And ending a single novel is hard. Giving it a suitable ending and a fantastic climax is really, really difficult. Now add two novels to that. Now you need four endings, a suitable ending for each novel and an ending for all three collectively. And doing that is really hard. Suzanne Collins couldn't do it. Veronica Roth sure as shit couldn't do it.<br /><br />And it's hard for a TV show. I'm a massive <i>LOST</i> fan, and I think hitting that ending as hard as they did, from as far away as they did, is next level writing. They had entire elements of the show they couldn't use (Mr. Eko is the best example), things that couldn't happen, plans that 100% changed and meant guessing at a different version of their already guessed ending.<br /><br />And it's hard for this, the final(ish) installment of the <i>Harry Potter</i> series. Seven books. Minimum eight endings (I'd argue it's nine ...). Tons of characters to say goodbye to... a gigantic mythology to wrap up.... <br /><br />And Rowling, being the insanely ambitious, amazing writer that she is, basically goes completely off the reservation here. Hogwarts doesn't show up until the third act. The entire middle of the book is essentially a camping trip around England. The first act (even from page one) shifts the entire book into a status quo none of us really, actually, truly anticipated. AND THEN halfway through the she goes and introduces a completely new branch of the mythology around which the whole climax of the novel pivots.<br /><br />It is, to say, the sort of thing that probably shouldn't work. I love how much the last installment is the "light-it-on-fire, go-for-broke" installment, but this is literally the stuff of absolute legend. And Rowling pulls it off. She pulls it off she pulls it off she pulls it off with finesse and grace, giving the ultimate capstone to what is probably the single most influential storytelling event in western pop culture since Star Wars.<br /><br />It is, to put it simply, basically perfect.<br /><br />It's hard to describe how much I love this book. I adore this book. If I had to pick a <i>Harry Potter</i> book that best shows off why I love the series, this would be it. It's a fucking masterpiece. Watching all of the elements come back once again (noticing every single nostalgia reference is easier once you've had time to absorb it for a while), seeing her weave and out in a victory lap tour of the series, seeing how well she treats every single character who she could possibly squeeze into this book, the continued awfulness of Umbridge, the redemption of Percy, the delicateness with which she treats Severus Snape, the coming-around of Dudley, the hubris of Voldemort.... It is.... so perfect.<br /><br />Truly, this is the book that has everything, only let down by the fact that Harry and his friends don't go to Hogwarts for another year. But after <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> what is there left to do at Hogwarts? How would they be expected to defeat a fully empowered adult wizard without acting like fully empowered and independent adults? It has two massive heist sequences, a thrilling as all hell chase scene, a chapter that's basically as taut a thriller as I've ever seen her write (Malfoy Manor), one of the best extended flashback sequences I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing, a brand new mythology that it's easy to forget SHE MADE UP FROM SCRATCH (Three Brothers), a massive war story on the Hogwarts grounds.... It has the origin story of Albus Dumbledore (providing the layers to his character that make him my favorite character in the series)... It has the best thing J.K. Rowling has ever written (<i>The Forest Again</i>).<br /><br />It is a novel about generational divides, a beacon of progress and humanity, a statement that the old must pass that the new might inherit the earth, because whatever current generation is on top can't save the world. All things change and evolve. The world can only be saved and shaped by those who will inherit it. The last image is of even the next generation who will take over once Harry and his friends are done and dusted.<br /><br /><i>Deathly Hallows</i> is about the best thing you could hope for at the end of a series. It has heartbreak, it has laughs, it has moments of sheer badassery, it has entire chapters that makes us all weep. It is devastating, it is empowering, it sees Harry torn to his utter lowest point and then built up into the hero we all knew he would eventually become. It is massive and epic and yet impossibly small and understated, with gigantic moments flying by as personal and quick in the blink of an eye and feeling impossibly mythic just a few pages later. It ends with a magic trick and its ultimate victory is unabashedly a celebration (and bittersweet) but undeniable in its euphoria.<br /><br />It is perfect children's literature. It is everything I could possibly want from an ending or final installment. And it only gets better every single time, which, in a final installment, shouldn't happen.<br /><br /><b>  <u>Harry Potter Rankings</u></b><br />1) Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows<br />2) Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix<br />3) Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince<br />4) Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban<br />5) Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire<br />6) Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets<br />7) Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.</span>  <a data-text-id="6565008681476437233" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1111198255">  <td colspan="2">    <div href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1111198255&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1111198255'><a id="like_count_review_1111198255" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1111198255?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1111198255" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1111198255" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1111198255" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1111198255, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1111198255?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1111198255' style='display: </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_271793690" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/271793690" />    <a title="Mel" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7609088-mel"><img alt="Mel" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471808177p2/7609088.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/271793690?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Mel" class="user" name="Mel" href="/user/show/7609088-mel">Mel</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7609088-mel?shelf=own">own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer271793690" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5743179346934455765"><blockquote> <b> <i>U+201C U+00BFDespuU+00E9s de todo este tiempo?<br /><br />Siempre.U+201D</i> </b> </blockquote><br /><b>Spoilers</b>. Si no leU+00EDste el libro, no quiero arruinarte nada.<br /><br />Primero quiero aclarar que Harry Potter y J.K. Rowling fueron quienes me U+201CinvitaronU+201D (me gusta decirlo de esa forma) al mundo de la lectura. De chiquita siempre leU+00EDa libros, pero no tenU+00EDa esa motivaciU+00F3n como la actual de querer leer muchos libros y conocer nuevos mundos. La pluma de Joanne fue la que me convenciU+00F3 de que la lectura es algo divino, no sU+00F3lo un entretenimiento o U+201Cno tengo nada para</span>  <span id="freeText5743179346934455765" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201C U+00BFDespuU+00E9s de todo este tiempo?<br /><br />Siempre.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br /><b>Spoilers</b>. Si no leU+00EDste el libro, no quiero arruinarte nada.<br /><br />Primero quiero aclarar que Harry Potter y J.K. Rowling fueron quienes me U+201CinvitaronU+201D (me gusta decirlo de esa forma) al mundo de la lectura. De chiquita siempre leU+00EDa libros, pero no tenU+00EDa esa motivaciU+00F3n como la actual de querer leer muchos libros y conocer nuevos mundos. La pluma de Joanne fue la que me convenciU+00F3 de que la lectura es algo divino, no sU+00F3lo un entretenimiento o U+201Cno tengo nada para hacer, asU+00ED que voy a leer algoU+201D. Siempre amU+00E9 los fanfics y leo de ellos desde el 2008, asU+00ED que fui tirando la lectura en mi infancia a otro mundo, la creaciU+00F3n de nuevos escenarios y la imaginaciU+00F3n de otras personas. Pero no me quiero ir a otra parte. Quiero volver a que Harry Potter fue la saga que me cambiU+00F3, mi manera de pensar y mis gustos. Mis amigos me miran y me dicen U+201Cno puede ser que te guste eso siendo tan grandeU+201D (y, ahora estoy escribiendo esta reseU+00F1a teniendo diecinueve aU+00F1os, pero eso me lo decU+00EDan desde que tengo diecisU+00E9is). Y la verdad, es que nunca les di motivos para que me juzguen. Cada cual sus gustos. Defiendo esta saga como si fueran creados por mU+00ED, porque estos libros me <b>cambiaron</b>. U+00BFEstoy orgullosa? Totalmente.<br /><br />Ahora, vuelvo a este libro. Siempre me preguntU+00E9 U+00BFpor quU+00E9 nunca escribU+00ED una reseU+00F1a para este libro si es mi favorito? Y es que no puedo expresar todas mis emociones con palabras. En este libro sentU+00ED todo: felicidad, ira, confusiU+00F3n, tristeza, llorU+00E9 hasta cansarme, gritU+00E9, y mucho mU+00E1s.<br /><br />Pensar que leU+00ED los siete en febrero de 2011, cuando luego de dos meses de ver <i>Harry Potter y las Reliquias de la Muerte Parte 1</i> en el cine, llamU+00E9 a mi prima y le pedU+00ED urgentemente los libros, porque necesitaba saber el final. <b>ESE FINAL</b>. Siempre fui fan de Harry Potter, no recuerdo cuando vi la primer pelU+00EDcula, ni la edad, y no me voy a poner a calcular. Pero siempre estuve enamorada de Harry y adoraba los magos. En el 2011 me decidU+00ED leerlos y, U+00A1no me arrepiento!<br /><br />Entonces, quiero partir el libro en varias partes y comentar algo chiquito sobre ello. Porque, siendo totalmente sincera, siento que nunca podrU+00EDa expresar <b>bien</b> lo que me pasU+00F3 en cada escena.<br /><br />En la primera parte se resume a: U+201CTe invito a romper tu corazU+00F3n con la muerte de Hedwig y Moody <i>and I don't care</i>U+201D. Les puedo jurar que yo todavU+00EDa tengo en mente que ellos siguen vivos. Fue tan brusco toda esa escena de los mortU+00EDfagos y el viaje de Harry que no los vi llegar.<br /><br />DespuU+00E9s: U+201CVamos, Ron, Hermione, no quiero que vengan conmigo, es un peligroU+201D. Si, Harry, como si fueses vos solito y saldrU+00EDas de todos los problemas. U+00BFQue harU+00EDas sin el cerebro de Hermione? U+00BFQuU+00E9 harU+00EDas sin Ron que, ademU+00E1s de ser tu mejor amigo y tu cable a tierra, es la persona que te levanta el U+00E1nimo y siempre estarU+00E1 para ti? Toda esta parte me daba bronca, lo entendU+00EDa, U+00A1pero si yo fuese U+00E9l no serU+00EDa tan cabeza hueca para no llevarlos!<br /><br />DespuU+00E9s de eso: U+00BFUna boda? U+00BFEn serio? Y acU+00E1 vienen lindas partes como: los celos de Ron hacia Viktor Krum, los celos de Harry hacia Viktor Krum... (Viktor, te hubieses quedado en casa). Y ahU+00ED te deja en claro que Rowling ya decidiU+00F3 dos parejas hasta el final, punto, se acabU+00F3.<br /><br />Mucho mU+00E1s despuU+00E9s: Entrada al Ministerio, Ron los abandonas, van al Valle de Godric, encuentro con Nagini, etc. Cada momento, esencial para la historia y te atrapa. Y al final, cada uno te deja gritando mentalmente: NO PUEDE SER, POR AMOR A ROWLING, U+00BFPOR QUU+00C9?<br /><br />Al casi final: La batalla de Hogwarts es mi gran escena favorita (una de las tantas), no me voy a poner a explicar, pero saco lo imprescindible, como: la escena de Harry con Voldemort (U+00A1Snape no te pertenecU+00EDa!), la muerte de Fred (totalmente necesaria, <i>NO ME JUZGUEN</i>, pero es en serio, no en la guerra todos salen ilesos), la infancia-adolescencia-adultez de Snape que me rompiU+00F3 el corazU+00F3n mU+00E1s de lo que ya estaba roto. Leer de vuelta la muerte de Lily y James es desgarrador.<br /><br />Al final... el epU+00EDlogo: A ver, espero no ser la U+00FAnica persona que piensa asU+00ED, pero vi muchos <i>potterheads</i> o fans o personas que leyeron el libro que dijeron que el epU+00EDlogo era innecesario y que estaba mal, que no debU+00EDa ser asU+00ED y demU+00E1s cosas. Primero que nada yo lo vi necesario. AdemU+00E1s, conocer el U+201CquU+00E9 hubiese pasado en diecinueve aU+00F1osU+201D estU+00E1 correcto (Y lo mejor de todo es que deja lugar a <i>muchos</i> fanfics de la tercera generaciU+00F3n, <i>U+00A1yay!</i>) Y bueno, tampoco podU+00EDan esperar que Harry, Ron, Ginny, Hermione, Draco se subieran al tren con sus hijos y Rowling escriba un octavo, noveno, dU+00E9cimo libro. <b>Totalmente no</b>. El libro tiene este final y listo.<br /><br />Creo que hasta acU+00E1 termino, concluyo con que Harry Potter es una de las mejores cosas que me pasU+00F3 y vuelvo a repetir, agradezco eso. <b>Gracias Joanne Rowling</b>.<br /><br />Estoy por llorar otra vez.</span>  <a data-text-id="5743179346934455765" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1762635191" />    <a title="Enzo" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34348183-enzo"><img alt="Enzo" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479437633p2/34348183.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1762635191?book_show_action=false">Oct 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Enzo" class="user" name="Enzo" href="/user/show/34348183-enzo">Enzo</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788498386370" href="/book/show/25003719-harry-potter-y-las-reliquias-de-la-muerte">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1762635191" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9451648495092500642">Se cierra el telU+00F3n para la mejor saga que leU+00ED en mi vida y que tuve la oportunidad de conocer a fines del aU+00F1o pasado. QuedU+00E9 ampliamente satisfecho con todo lo que me encontrU+00E9 a lo largo de la lectura.<br />Esta U+00FAltima entrega fue sublime y el final me llenU+00F3 de emociones. Me hubiera gustado que hubiera mU+00E1s.<br />Los voy a extraU+00F1ar, Ron, Harry, Hermione, Neville, Luna, Sirius, Dobby (U+00A1Dobby!) y tantos otros. No tienen una idea del vacU+00EDo con el que me quedo, voy a aU+00F1orar demasiado este mundo mU+00E1gico y todas sus</span>  <span id="freeText9451648495092500642" style="display:none">Se cierra el telU+00F3n para la mejor saga que leU+00ED en mi vida y que tuve la oportunidad de conocer a fines del aU+00F1o pasado. QuedU+00E9 ampliamente satisfecho con todo lo que me encontrU+00E9 a lo largo de la lectura.<br />Esta U+00FAltima entrega fue sublime y el final me llenU+00F3 de emociones. Me hubiera gustado que hubiera mU+00E1s.<br />Los voy a extraU+00F1ar, Ron, Harry, Hermione, Neville, Luna, Sirius, Dobby (U+00A1Dobby!) y tantos otros. No tienen una idea del vacU+00EDo con el que me quedo, voy a aU+00F1orar demasiado este mundo mU+00E1gico y todas sus criaturas habitantes.<br />Estoy negado a pensar que se acabU+00F3. Por ahora, sU+00F3lo quiero paz para procesar que ya no habrU+00E1 mU+00E1s Gryffindor, Slytherin, Hufflepuff y Ravenclaw (Mi casa, segU+00FAn Pottermore) para mU+00ED, y silencio para poder empezar a concebir el hecho de que ya no volverU+00E9 a saber de McGonagall (que deliberadamente escogU+00ED como mi segunda madre ficticia), Dumbledore, Hagrid, los Weasley, etc.<br />Ya lo han dicho todos, y hoy los entiendo mU+00E1s que nunca asU+00ED que no puedo dejar de hacerlo yo tambiU+00E9n: Gracias. GRACIAS J. K. Rowling. Marcaste la vida de un simple muggle de veintidU+00F3s aU+00F1os que no te olvidarU+00E1 jamU+00E1s.</span>  <a data-text-id="9451648495092500642" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1762635191">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1762635191" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1762635191&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1762635191'><a id="like_count_review_1762635191" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1762635191?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1762635191" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1762635191" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1762635191&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1762635191" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1762635191, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1762635191?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1762635191' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1762635191/comments?reverse=true">View 2 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1762635191' style='display: none'><textarea </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1265788117" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1265788117" />    <a title="NocturnalBlaze" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/39644765-nocturnalblaze"><img alt="NocturnalBlaze" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474830799p2/39644765.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1265788117?book_show_action=false">Nov 01, 2016</a>      <a title="NocturnalBlaze" class="user" name="NocturnalBlaze" href="/user/show/39644765-nocturnalblaze">NocturnalBlaze</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810606" href="/book/show/8786481-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/39644765-nocturnalblaze?shelf=letture-in-inglese">letture-in-inglese</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1265788117" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6321159414519401151">E' difficilissimo scrivere una recensione di un libro che ha avuto un impatto cosU+00EC fondamentale per me, eppure volevo provarci, anche solo per tentare di trasmettere la potenza di questo volume, la capacitU+00E0 che l'autrice ha avuto di connettere e concludere sapientemente tutti i filoni narrativi, regalando un epilogo in grado di soddisfare qualsiasi lettore.<br />Per quanto riguarda la maturazione e le sorti dei personaggi, questo libro dimostra di essere il coronamento di un processo di miglioramento</span>  <span id="freeText6321159414519401151" style="display:none">E' difficilissimo scrivere una recensione di un libro che ha avuto un impatto cosU+00EC fondamentale per me, eppure volevo provarci, anche solo per tentare di trasmettere la potenza di questo volume, la capacitU+00E0 che l'autrice ha avuto di connettere e concludere sapientemente tutti i filoni narrativi, regalando un epilogo in grado di soddisfare qualsiasi lettore.<br />Per quanto riguarda la maturazione e le sorti dei personaggi, questo libro dimostra di essere il coronamento di un processo di miglioramento da parte dell'autrice, che qui riesce ad intessere un affresco magistrale, permettendo a tutti i personaggi coinvolti di rimanere fedeli a se stessi, ma, allo stesso tempo, di mostrare lati inediti, di stupire, di coinvolgere completamente.<br />L'intreccio viene portato avanti sapientemente e molti colpi di scena non si vedono arrivare, c'U+00E8 una costante sensazione di tensione e curiositU+00E0, complice anche l'atmosfera piU+00F9 cupa, meno favolistica, che caratterizza questo capitolo. Le morti sono dolorose da affrontare, ma coerenti con la situazione descritta, ed anche gli altri grandi avvenimenti della trama non possono che lasciare il lettore con il fiato sospeso, permettendo di ridere, piangere, di sentirsi intimamente connessi con i personaggi che si U+00E8 imparato ad amare ed i cui archi narrativi si sono infine avviati alla conclusione. <br />Il settimo libro di questa serie U+00E8 un inno all'amicizia, ai valori piU+00F9 alti che dovrebbero regolare i rapporti umani, alla solidarietU+00E0, al coraggio, all'unitU+00E0, tutti messaggi che vengono descritti magistralmente nella loro contrapposizione alle forze del male. Il talento dell'autrice riesce a rendere questi valori palpabili, edificanti, con uno stile semplice, scorrevole - anche se certamente piU+00F9 maturo rispetto ai capitoli precedenti - e coinvolgente, cosU+00EC da rendere la lettura piacevole a tutti.<br />Dall'inizio alla fine, questo volume non cessa di stupire e ad ogni rilettura possono essere rilevati nuovi dettagli che lo rendono ancora piU+00F9 godibile e piacevole. E' appassionante seguire il nostro trio nella ricerca degli Horcrux, U+00E8 doloroso vederli soffrire, ci si sente tesi mentre ci si immedesima nelle situazioni di ansia e durante la battaglia di Howgarts non si puU+00F2 fare a meno di commuoversi. L'epilogo, d'altro canto, riesce a tirare le fila della vicenda, regalando un momento di grande gioia e semplicitU+00E0, quell'aria di normalitU+00E0 e tranquillitU+00E0 che tutti speravano potesse finalmente caratterizzare le vicende dei personaggi che tanto abbiamo amato. <br />La fine di un grande viaggio, questo, che non ha nulla di cui essere rimproverato: c'U+00E8 azione, tantissima, amicizia, amore, paura, dubbi, vita e morte, divertimento e tensione, il tutto sapientemente dosato e messo in scena da un cast di personaggi indimenticabili, tanto quanto i luoghi in cui essi si muovono. Un piccolo, grande capolavoro della letteratura per ragazzi, che si conclude in maniera impeccabile, lasciando nel cuore dei lettori un vuoto e, allo stesso tempo, una sensazione di calore, malinconica gioia, felicitU+00E0 per aver portato a compimento questa avventura.</span>  <a data-text-id="6321159414519401151" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_539100918" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/539100918" />    <a title="Becky" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1376766-becky"><img alt="Becky" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457393924p2/1376766.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/539100918?book_show_action=false">Feb 25, 2013</a>      <a title="Becky" class="user" name="Becky" href="/user/show/1376766-becky">Becky</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591061" href="/book/show/820344.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=dystopias">dystopias</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=multi-dimensional">multi-dimensional</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=mystery-and-thrillers">mystery-and-thrillers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=tear-jerkers">tear-jerkers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2013">2013</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer539100918" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15036750882611864490">*Sigh* It's over, once again. <br /><br />Once again I read this book through a stream of tears. I just can't seem to help it. It's just... the end, the losses, the trials, everything. I just can't seem to turn off the tear ducts. <br /><br />But my goodness, I love this book so much. Not only does everything come together, but we learn so much more about Dumbledore's history, and what he means when he says that it's choice over ability, what he means when he says that love is the most powerful, what he means when he s</span>  <span id="freeText15036750882611864490" style="display:none">*Sigh* It's over, once again. <br /><br />Once again I read this book through a stream of tears. I just can't seem to help it. It's just... the end, the losses, the trials, everything. I just can't seem to turn off the tear ducts. <br /><br />But my goodness, I love this book so much. Not only does everything come together, but we learn so much more about Dumbledore's history, and what he means when he says that it's choice over ability, what he means when he says that love is the most powerful, what he means when he says to trust in others. As a counterpoint, Voldemort only equates trusting with necessity and regret. <br /><br />This book isn't perfect - it's just NEARLY perfect. I noticed this time around that there were an awful lot of colons strewn about. Places where I think a semicolon or comma or period would be better. But that was only a little distracting. I would also have liked a bit more of the epilogue, to know about everyone that I've loved all this time and how they are doing. And, I might have missed it, but I don't know how Harry and the others could have gotten to Shell Cottage, since Bill, Secret Keeper, hadn't told them about it. Technically, Ron shouldn't have been able to name it. <br /><br />But. But, in light of the otherwise amazingness of this book, I can overlook one tiny little misstep plot hole. I mean, maybe Dobby had to really apparate them there, because Elf magic is different. But I still don't know how they'd have been able to speak the name of the place without Bill having first told them. <br /><br />Anyway. I love the way that the Horcruxes and Hallows are blended here. Both are vital and important to Harry's success, and both must be sought for the right reasons. Not for personal gain or invincibility, but to help other people, to protect them. <br /><br />I've read this series... many times. But it amazes me how I'm still affected by it, every time. I still get nervous for Harry, I still ache for his losses and fears. My heart still pounds every time Hermione is dragged off to be tortured and Ron screams for Bellatrix to take him instead immediately - no hesitation. It makes me love him even more because he doesn't even think about it - it's just a natural urge to protect her. <br /><br />This book makes my soul ache. Love love love love it. I can't help it, I just wallow in it, and as much as I sob my way through it... it's in a proud way. I'm so proud of Harry, Ron, and Hermione. Of Neville. Of all of them. <br /><br />Fantastic. </span>  <a data-text-id="15036750882611864490" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1398473261?book_show_action=false">Sep 22, 2015</a>      <a title="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" class="user" name="I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth" href="/user/show/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth">I SNIFF BOOKS - Beth</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth?shelf=middle-grade-chapter-books">middle-grade-chapter-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30704264-i-sniff-books---beth?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1398473261" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10397802968780419042">Oh. My. That. Was. Epic. Just like I hoped and knew it would be.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941030p8/1305197.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Starting a <i>Harry Potter</i> re-read is ALWAYS a wonderful thing. Turning that very last page in the very last book, not so much. IU+2019ve been with Harry since July 17 so having things end is hard.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941580p8/1305202.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I know IU+2019ll be restless for AT LEAST one whole week while I try to figure out what to read next. IU+2019ll probably start and abandon at least half a dozen books until I find the just right one. I do get quite a bit cranky without a GOOD BOOK to read.</span>  <span id="freeText10397802968780419042" style="display:none">Oh. My. That. Was. Epic. Just like I hoped and knew it would be.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941030p8/1305197.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Starting a <i>Harry Potter</i> re-read is ALWAYS a wonderful thing. Turning that very last page in the very last book, not so much. IU+2019ve been with Harry since July 17 so having things end is hard.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941580p8/1305202.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I know IU+2019ll be restless for AT LEAST one whole week while I try to figure out what to read next. IU+2019ll probably start and abandon at least half a dozen books until I find the just right one. I do get quite a bit cranky without a GOOD BOOK to read. IU+2019m like a hungry toddler who missed her nap. ItU+2019s true.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941009p8/1305196.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>This is my 4th time reading the series. IU+2019m continually amazed at how I donU+2019t remember all the details and how I still get swept up in EVERYTHING.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442941119p8/1305198.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>During this re-read, I thought or over-thought things ;) I wrote up VERY lengthy commentary/analysis for each of the first four books. You can find them on my Harry Potter shelf or view them on my blog here: <br><br><br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/08/20/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire/" rel="nofollow">Goblet of  Fire</a> (#4)   <br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/08/05/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/" rel="nofollow">Prisoner of Azkaban</a> (#3)   <br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/07/29/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-chamber-of-secrets/" rel="nofollow">Chamber of Secrets</a> (#2)   <br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/07/22/obessessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone/" rel="nofollow">SorcererU+2019s Stone</a> (#1)   <br><br><br>My goodreads friend Joseph left such a WONDERFUL comment on my commentary for book #4. But ALAS, I dropped the ball for doing analysis for books 5 U+2013 7. When I read the series again, because oh YES there will be another re-read, IU+2019ll definitely write something up for the books I missed this time around.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442429213p8/1237257.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The last page has been turned. So sad but I knew it was coming. What do you think is the best and worst thing about starting a <i>Harry Potter</i> re-read?!<br><br><b>all my reviews can be found at <a target="_blank" href="http://www.isniffbooks.wordpress.com" rel="nofollow">www.isniffbooks.wordpress.com</a></b></span>  <a data-text-id="10397802968780419042" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1641479398" />    <a title="Frahorus" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/26190517-frahorus"><img alt="Frahorus" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464165301p2/26190517.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1641479398?book_show_action=false">Jun 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Frahorus" class="user" name="Frahorus" href="/user/show/26190517-frahorus">Frahorus</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26190517-frahorus?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26190517-frahorus?shelf=letteratura-inglese">letteratura-inglese</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26190517-frahorus?shelf=duemila">duemila</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1641479398" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8182759693336595053">E si concludono in modo epico le avventure del mago Harry Potter (con colpi di scena a iosa) dove finalmente veniamo a conoscenza di tutto quello che aveva (benignamente) architettato il buon preside Silente e il suo fido professor Piton (ambiguo fino alla fine). Lord Voldemort era cosU+00EC accecato dal potere da non aver mai tenuto conto dell'amore - la vera magia che muove tutto! - che sconfigge anche la morte (cosU+00EC ho inteso la "resurrezione" di Harry). <br />Harry matura tantissimo in questo ultimo vo</span>  <span id="freeText8182759693336595053" style="display:none">E si concludono in modo epico le avventure del mago Harry Potter (con colpi di scena a iosa) dove finalmente veniamo a conoscenza di tutto quello che aveva (benignamente) architettato il buon preside Silente e il suo fido professor Piton (ambiguo fino alla fine). Lord Voldemort era cosU+00EC accecato dal potere da non aver mai tenuto conto dell'amore - la vera magia che muove tutto! - che sconfigge anche la morte (cosU+00EC ho inteso la "resurrezione" di Harry). <br />Harry matura tantissimo in questo ultimo volume: prima crede di dover cercare gli Horcrux tutto da solo, per evitare che i suoi migliori amici si possano far del male, poi capisce che soltanto condividendo e unendosi in comunitU+00E0 prima con Ron ed Hermione, poi con il rinato (e mai defunto) Esercito di Silente, si poteva sconfiggere definitivamente il mago oscuro. C'U+00E8 una morale? Certo: l'amore vince sul male, sull'odio, sulla solitudine. L'unione fa la forza. La vera magia U+00E8 l'amore, il rispetto, la pace tra maghi e babbani, non ci sono maghi di serie a e b, tutti insieme, unendo le forze, si puU+00F2 creare e ricreare un mondo migliore. Anche una piccola cosa, ma buona, contribuisce a migliorare prima di tutto noi stessi, poi il mondo intero. <br /><br />La Rowling ha creato un fantastico mondo che U+00E8 ormai reale per tutti (all'epoca, io ero giU+00E0 grandicello) i bambini e i ragazzi degli anni '90/'00. Certo rispetto ai film nei romanzi si approfondisce meglio il passato del preside, di Riddle, di Piton e dei genitori di Harry. <br /><br />Lo stile Dell'autrice U+00E8 semplice e riesce a farti scorrere le pagine (soprattutto questa ultima lettura si fa divorare).<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="8182759693336595053" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>
