elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1747438327" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1747438327" />    <a title="Cindy Rollins" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3480406-cindy-rollins"><img alt="Cindy Rollins" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1379169069p2/3480406.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1747438327?book_show_action=false">Sep 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Cindy Rollins" class="user" name="Cindy Rollins" href="/user/show/3480406-cindy-rollins">Cindy Rollins</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3480406-cindy-rollins?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3480406-cindy-rollins?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1747438327" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15479857644575772300">One of the best things about a series of books is you really do become a part of the world, the community. It is hard to say goodbye to Hogwarts-Harry, Hermoine, Ron, Hagrid....<br /><br />Reading these books 20 years after their original publication has been interesting. I had heard this and that over the years and those tidbits of knowledge colored by reading. I thought Harry died in the end. Permanently. I think I am giving this 5 stars just because he lived and married Ginny and had a family who went to</span>  <span id="freeText15479857644575772300" style="display:none">One of the best things about a series of books is you really do become a part of the world, the community. It is hard to say goodbye to Hogwarts-Harry, Hermoine, Ron, Hagrid....<br /><br />Reading these books 20 years after their original publication has been interesting. I had heard this and that over the years and those tidbits of knowledge colored by reading. I thought Harry died in the end. Permanently. I think I am giving this 5 stars just because he lived and married Ginny and had a family who went to Hogwarts. I like happy endings. <br /><br />I wouldn't call these Christian books but there is no denying the Christian symbolism throughout the books but most noted in this final volume. So much controversy surrounding the books, so many years, still people preach against them, I don't see it. I guess people are different. <br /><br />In my own weird journey, I read all of JK Rowling's other books before reading Harry. I am not usually one to follow fads in reading is one reason it took me so long. I almost always regret wasting time on modern books 'everybody' is reading. I was impressed with Rowling's writing and what I considered her honesty. I liked her so when they rereleased the Jim Dale recordings I thought, "Why not?" I am so glad I did. I might even read them all again someday; it is hard to say goodbye.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="15479857644575772300" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1747438327">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1747438327" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1747438327&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1747438327'><a id="like_count_review_1747438327" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1747438327?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1747438327" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1747438327" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1747438327&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1747438327" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1747438327, true, &#39;&#39;); Rowling<br /><br /> The final book in the series, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is about a magical world where wizards are fighting for power. Harry is the hero who is searching for a way to destroy the dark wizard, Lord Voldemort. The only way he can accomplish this is to find and destroy magical objects (horcruxes) in which Lord Voldemort has hidden parts of his soul. Harry and his friends, Ron and Hermione, skip their last year at Hogwarts</span>  <span id="freeText1220284243553717688" style="display:none">August Book Report<br />Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows<br />J.K. Rowling<br /><br /> The final book in the series, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is about a magical world where wizards are fighting for power. Harry is the hero who is searching for a way to destroy the dark wizard, Lord Voldemort. The only way he can accomplish this is to find and destroy magical objects (horcruxes) in which Lord Voldemort has hidden parts of his soul. Harry and his friends, Ron and Hermione, skip their last year at Hogwarts to complete this mission. The Death Eaters have taken over the Ministry of Magic, forcing many honorable wizards into hiding. Harry, Ron, and Hermione find themselves in countless dangerous situations as they try to infiltrate the ministry and destroy the horcruxes!<br /><br /> Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows has several powerful themes, but my favorite message that the story expresses is to never give up. Harry Potter has lost many things he cares about in this point of the story. He can't go back to the one place he feels at home (Hogwarts), he can't openly protect his friends from danger, and many of his loved ones have been brutally murdered. Even though his situation seems hopeless, Harry never gives up trying to defeat Voldemort. He moves forward in his journey to destroy the horcruxes without a second thought. He doesn't even seem to consider giving up as an option. This is something to be admired in a hero!<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="1220284243553717688" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1325028759" />    <a title="Ally" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15655618-ally"><img alt="Ally" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472122701p2/15655618.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1325028759?book_show_action=false">Jul 04, 2015</a>      <a title="Ally" class="user" name="Ally" href="/user/show/15655618-ally">Ally</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1325028759" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15104776918554629562"><a href="http://s1314.photobucket.com/user/Roxlet/media/image.jpg1_zpsslrexhm6.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435995244i/15404695._SY540_.jpg" alt=" photo image.jpg1_zpsslrexhm6.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>I have had an incredibly stressful few weeks and I had a mighty need for Harry Potter so I started rereading the series three weeks ago, finished yesterday. I feel like I had some kinda spiritual experience while reading these books; I felt like I was there. There's something genuinely magical about this story. These books are filled with hope, adventure, love and friendship and I feel a connection to them in my heart. It's not a reminiscence of childhood. I didn't read these books when I was a</span>  <span id="freeText15104776918554629562" style="display:none"><a href="http://s1314.photobucket.com/user/Roxlet/media/image.jpg1_zpsslrexhm6.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435995244i/15404695._SY540_.jpg" alt=" photo image.jpg1_zpsslrexhm6.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>I have had an incredibly stressful few weeks and I had a mighty need for Harry Potter so I started rereading the series three weeks ago, finished yesterday. I feel like I had some kinda spiritual experience while reading these books; I felt like I was there. There's something genuinely magical about this story. These books are filled with hope, adventure, love and friendship and I feel a connection to them in my heart. It's not a reminiscence of childhood. I didn't read these books when I was a kid. I've always loved and enjoyed them as an adult, they speak to me. I felt quite emotional after the end. I feel like every time I read them I find something new, and something useful. What kind of witchcraft did JK Rowling employ to write these books ?! Amazing storytelling, wonderful imagination. And now I enter the worse book hangover of all time, I just want more Harry !! <br><br>x</span>  <a data-text-id="15104776918554629562" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1325028759">  <td </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1352931782" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1352931782" />    <a title="Athena" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38334161-athena"><img alt="Athena" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421712238p2/38334161.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1352931782?book_show_action=false">Aug 06, 2015</a>      <a title="Athena" class="user" name="Athena" href="/user/show/38334161-athena">Athena</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1352931782" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12603750664288556020">*Edit: It's the day after I read this book and I think it's finally sinking in. It's over, what world will ever compare to this? I'm seriously going into a reading slump, I want more! And Snape? I think he's growing on me, I wish he had someone. Was he ever happy again?*<br /><br />I am so glad I read this series, however this isn't my favorite book of the series. I know what you're thinking, how could I say that? I was spoiled for almost all the deaths in this book, so I had time to emotionally prepare mys</span>  <span id="freeText12603750664288556020" style="display:none">*Edit: It's the day after I read this book and I think it's finally sinking in. It's over, what world will ever compare to this? I'm seriously going into a reading slump, I want more! And Snape? I think he's growing on me, I wish he had someone. Was he ever happy again?*<br /><br />I am so glad I read this series, however this isn't my favorite book of the series. I know what you're thinking, how could I say that? I was spoiled for almost all the deaths in this book, so I had time to emotionally prepare myself. It wasn't as heartbreaking as I had thought, some deaths didn't give the character justice. In addition, like Order of the Phoenix, the beginning of the book seemed to drag on. Particularly, when the trio went into hiding. After a bit, it did pick up. the Gringotts scene was one of my favorites! Talk about epic! The ending of the book wae confusing at first, the explanations were long and not engaging. However, I'm immensely proud of Neville! Overall, as a series this is still phenomenal and is one unforgettable world of magic! ....And OKAY, but what about Luna? Is there somewhere online where J.K. Rowling tells us?</span>  <a data-text-id="12603750664288556020" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/718023703?book_show_action=false">Mar 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Jenny (Jenny&#39;s Book Bag) Baker" class="user" name="Jenny (Jenny&#39;s Book Bag) Baker" href="/user/show/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker">Jenny (Jenny&#39;s Book Bag) Baker</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545139700" href="/book/show/4979435-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=all-time-best-seller">all-time-best-seller</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=third-person-pov">third-person-pov</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=1000000">1000000</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16404316-jenny-jenny-s-book-bag-baker?shelf=big-books">big-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer718023703" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15249680579013614460">This is one of the greatest fantasy fiction series ever written. <b>J. K. Rowling</b> has set the standards high and other authors have yet to come close to her talents. Everything about this series is amazing U+2014 the world building, the characterization, the dialogue, the storytelling and the writing. SheU+2019s created a world that all of her fans would love to live in and characters that we would befriend if we had the chance. The intricate details of this story are amazing. I rarely reread books, but I wi</span>  <span id="freeText15249680579013614460" style="display:none">This is one of the greatest fantasy fiction series ever written. <b>J. K. Rowling</b> has set the standards high and other authors have yet to come close to her talents. Everything about this series is amazing U+2014 the world building, the characterization, the dialogue, the storytelling and the writing. SheU+2019s created a world that all of her fans would love to live in and characters that we would befriend if we had the chance. The intricate details of this story are amazing. I rarely reread books, but I will absolutely reread this series many, many times. I highly recommend this entire series to everyone. </span>  <a data-text-id="15249680579013614460" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> id="reviewTextContainer1712797567" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10345383877662024644">4.5<br />No se que pensar ni decir, creo que tengo un problema de que hace aU+00F1os que no lloro con un libro y me esta preocupando jaja, este no fue el caso tampoco.<br />No puedo creer que haya terminado la saga cuando hace 3 aU+00F1os atrU+00E1s me negaba a leerla, no me declaro fan de esta pero si me encantU+00F3 esta saga, no me arrepiento para nada de haberla leU+00EDdo. bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30325097-claus-maack?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30325097-claus-maack?shelf=reread">reread</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30325097-claus-maack?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30325097-claus-maack?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1173676997" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6703000572026545542">My favourite Harry Potter book and the perfect conclusion to what is my favourite series of all time.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1232313864" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14493471153788398653">breaks my heart every single fucking time.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1232313864">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1232313864" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1232313864&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1232313864'><a id="like_count_review_1232313864" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1232313864?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1232313864" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1232313864" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1232313864&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1232313864" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1232313864, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1232313864?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1232313864' style='display: '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1787204219" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1787204219" />    <a title="Eric Allen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6229358-eric-allen"><img alt="Eric Allen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1315376770p2/6229358.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1787204219?book_show_action=false">Oct 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Eric Allen" class="user" name="Eric Allen" href="/user/show/6229358-eric-allen">Eric Allen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1787204219" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16283128243278759055">Sooooooo, for me, this book is both good and bad. It has a really good ending, but how it gets there is pretty dull, unnecessarily convoluted, and relies heavily on characters suddenly not being the same characters they've been for the last six books.<br /><br />I like to look at the first third of this book as being about the same as the first 40 mins or so of Return of the Jedi. The two have generally the same problems and they came about in generally the same way. We have a really epic and thought provok</span>  <span id="freeText16283128243278759055" style="display:none">Sooooooo, for me, this book is both good and bad. It has a really good ending, but how it gets there is pretty dull, unnecessarily convoluted, and relies heavily on characters suddenly not being the same characters they've been for the last six books.<br /><br />I like to look at the first third of this book as being about the same as the first 40 mins or so of Return of the Jedi. The two have generally the same problems and they came about in generally the same way. We have a really epic and thought provoking cliffhanger in the previous volume, but then we have to spend the time at the beginning of this one resolving it before we can move on to the actual story of this one. While not horrible, or even really all that bad, it's unnecessary. It just keeps going on, and on, and on, and on, and on, and it's just like, hey, can we maybe get on with THIS story sometime in the book instead of resolving the last one? And throughout the entire thing I keep thinking to myself, why is this even happening? The cliffhanger didn't really need to be there from the previous book. And we already found out who R.A.B. was in Order of the Phoenix, so anyone who was paying attention wasn't spending the time between books wondering and theorizing. So, really, what, exactly, was the point of the fake locket? It just takes up space, giving the characters busy work to plow through to clean up after the previous book before they can get on with this book's story. In my opinion, Rowling did herself a pretty big disservice with the whole fake locket business, because instead of heading straight into the story of the Deathly Hallows, which aren't even mentioned until over halfway through the book, we have to spend a few hundred pages resolving the fake locket that we really didn't need to. It makes the book longer for no real payoff, much like the beginning of Return of the Jedi, which makes the movie longer, with no real payoff, and, in fact, it made the movie too long, and a very tense and exciting subplot had to be removed from the movie to make room for it. The Emperor orders the Death Star to fire on the moon just after the shield goes down and all of the rebel fighters are flying into it, and there was supposed to be this really tense race to see whether the fighters would reach the reactor before it powers up to fire, with Luke trying to beat Vader and get to the Emperor and make him take back the order. Most of the scenes were already filmed with completed special effects. You can find them on the bonus disc of the bluray boxed set. And all that awesomeness was cut from the final film because George Lucas just had to leave us hanging for 3 years on what happened to Han after Boba Fett got away with him at the end of the previous movie, and spent a third of the run time of this one resolving that plotline. <br /><br />Another thing I don't really like about this book is how Harry is suddenly a genius that knows all the answers and figures everything out on his own. He has NEVER figured out anything on his own in the entire series. He had always needed the help of others to get through things and piece together the mysteries. And here, he just sort of becomes a genius that doesn't need to rely on the others to solve everything in the end. It was pretty out of character for him. I also got really sick of Hermione's nagging. She's never really nagged all that much in previous books, but in this one she is constantly nagging at both Harry and Ron, which seems like a really feeble attempt by the author to introduce some more tension between the characters.<br /><br />Anyway, I do like this book, or at least the parts of it that are actually relevant to the story of this book, rather than dealing with the previous book's baggage. I really enjoy the ending, and how it all comes together with the big battle at Hogwarts. I really like how Neville had a chance to shine in this book, showing how much he has grown as a character. There are some things here that I feel the movie had a better grasp on than the book, however. Some authors are great at writing action, some authors are better at other things, and Rowling is one of the latter. She's great with mysteries and comedy, and day to day frustrations and slow building tension. She's not all that great with action. <br /><br />So, anyway, my final verdict on this one is that it's a good ending, but not without it's problems. There's a lot of unnecessary fluff, and a huge portion of the book is devoted to tying up loose plot threads from the previous book that really could have been cut out and both books would have been better for it. There are some pretty long boring stretches in this book, where it really seems like a good editor and a couple more drafts to tighten things up could have helped, but on the whole I still really liked this book. <br /><br />So if you happen to have built yourself a steampunk time machine and are visiting 2016 from the early 19th century and have never heard of Harry Potter before, give it a try, it's a really fun and entertaining series.<br /><br />And now I'm all caught up and ready for Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them next month. Woohoo... except that it means I now have nothing to distract me from finishing Empire of Storms by Sarah J. Maas, which is soooooooooo not very good.</span>  <a data-text-id="16283128243278759055" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1787204219">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1787204219" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1787204219&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1787204219'><a id="like_count_review_1787204219" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1787204219?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1787204219" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1787204219" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1787204219&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1787204219" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1787204219, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1787204219?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1787204219' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1787204219/comments?reverse=true">View 2 comments</a><span </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1756527079" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1756527079" />    <a title="Romane" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27353893-romane"><img alt="Romane" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460093055p2/27353893.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1756527079?book_show_action=false">Oct 22, 2016</a>      <a title="Romane" class="user" name="Romane" href="/user/show/27353893-romane">Romane</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1756527079" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5508947932795809791"><i> <b>All was well.</b> </i><br><br>Here is the final book of the Harry Potter series. The conclusion to an epic tale which holds a special place in my soul.<br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br>The <i>wizarding world</i> and the <i>muggle world</i> is slowly turning into a chaotic mess. Harry Potter is the key to defeat Lord Voldemort. <br><br>Reading this book never bored me, not even for a second. The story turned more intense and sinister. A lot of people said that this book served as a summary of some sort, because the characters repeated what they did in the past</span>  <span id="freeText5508947932795809791" style="display:none"><i>  <b>All was well.</b></i><br><br>Here is the final book of the Harry Potter series. The conclusion to an epic tale which holds a special place in my soul.<br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br>The <i>wizarding world</i> and the <i>muggle world</i> is slowly turning into a chaotic mess. Harry Potter is the key to defeat Lord Voldemort. <br><br>Reading this book never bored me, not even for a second. The story turned more intense and sinister. A lot of people said that this book served as a summary of some sort, because the characters repeated what they did in the past years. Such as; Going to <i>Gringotts Wizarding Bank</i>, riding a broomstick, drinking Polyjuice Potion, and returning to the Chamber of Secrets.<br><br>I've also read two articles which is connected to this; <a href="https://www.google.com.ph/amp/s/amp.reddit.com/r/harrypotter/comments/3adyua/i_just_realized_that_the_battle_of_hogwarts_is/?client=ms-android-samsung" rel="nofollow">  <i>The Battle of Hogwarts is the previous six books in reverse order</i></a>, and <a href="https://www.google.com.ph/amp/s/amp.businessinsider.com/harry-potter-battle-hogwarts-reverse-2016-1" rel="nofollow">  <i>J.K. Rowling used this clever strategy in the final 'Harry Potter' book</i></a>.<br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br>One of the delightful things that made me genuinely happy, amidst all the depression and tragedy, is <b>Ron and Hermione.</b> I've been rooting for them since the beginning and this is the book where they seem to be more open about their true feelings toward each other. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476987079i/20904883.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476987079i/20904884._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>I'm not a huge fan of <i>Ginny x Harry</i> pairing to be honest, but I wish they showed in the film how their relationship grew. In the movie their love seemed to pop out of nowhere. I also wish they showed how badass Ginny really is.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476987788i/20905023.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>I kind of ship Helena Ravenclaw (a.k.a. the <i>Grey Lady</i>) and the <i>Bloody Baron</i>. Their story reminds me of <a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2628232/" rel="nofollow">Penny Dreadful</a>.<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>I love how Xenophilius Lovegood reminds me of Howl, (from <a href="http://m.imdb.com/title/tt0347149/" rel="nofollow">  <i>Howl's Moving Castle</i></a>), and I could not help but associate their house to the Moving Castle itself. I mean, blonde hair, eccentric lifestyle, house cluttered with thousands of objects U+2014 Need I say more? <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476987788ra/20905024.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Look at them. What's not to love?<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br><blockquote>  <b>U+201CSaintlike,U+201D repeated George, opening his eyes and looking up at his brother. U+201CYou see . . . IU+2019m holy. Holey, Fred, geddit?U+201D</b></blockquote><br><br>waahh I'm in love.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476985787i/20904719._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I love the twins so much. I love them to bits. Fred and George are inseparable. <br><br>So, why, just... why did Miss Rowling kill Fred?<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><blockquote>  <b>"After all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure."<br>U+2014 Albus Dumbledore</b></blockquote><br><br>U+2022 Hedwig<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476984618i/20904567.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>U+2022 Dobby<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476985317i/20904668._SY540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>U+2022 Remus Lupin & Nymphadora Tonks<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476985317i/20904669.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>... I was taken aback by their deaths. <i>Big time</i>. And then some.<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>The Tales of Beedle the Bard gave me the chills. <br><br>There is a theory I've read about <i>The Tale of the Three Brothers</i>. It goes like this:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476993856i/20905654.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><blockquote><b>Voldemort</b> = Antioch Peverell, "The one who died drunk in power."<br><br><b>Snape</b> = Cadmus Peverell, "The one who died for love."<br><br><b>Harry</b> = Ignotus Peverell, "The one who greeted Death like an old friend." <br><br><b>Dumbledore</b> = Death, <i>Old friend.</i></blockquote><br><br>If you think about it, yes, it does make sense. <br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>So who cast the spell that killed Ariana Dumbledore? I think it was Gellert Grindelwald because he knew how to cast <i>Avada Kedavra</i>, doesn't he? But what if she killed herself accidentally? There's just so many possibilities.<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>Speaking of sisters, I kind of feel sorry for Petunia, because she can't go to Hogwarts. I never liked her character because of how awful she is, but still, her effort to write a letter to Dumbledore was futile. It's kind of pathetic, really. Because of that she was always jealous of Lily, bitter even.<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>It's kind of ironic how Snuffles (Sirius' alias) and Snivellus (<i>Root word - Snivel</i>. Nickname given to Snape by James and Sirius,) almost share the same meaning.<br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br><blockquote>  <b>"After all this time?"<br>"<i>Always.</i>" said snape.</b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476989029i/20905174._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Reading the previous books of Harry Potter, I was led to believe that Severus Snape is a neutral character. A literary red herring. He's not good, he's not evil. He's somewhere in between. He's a mystery. But then as the books continued, I believe that he cared for Harry unconditionally. <br><br>There's more to him than meets the eye. He is altruistic to the core. He tried so hard to hide the fact that he is also a human being capable of loving U+2014 He suppressed himself of this tiny mundane pleasure, mainly because of self-loathing. He always maintained this dark image he wanted everyone else to believe, but he was not as cruel as he appeared to be.<br><br>He never bothered to credit himself about the good things he had done. Yes, he made some mistakes, but he owned them. <i>He more than owned them</i>. Seriously, if you are not moved by his unrequited love for Lily, then you have no heart.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476994389i/20905741._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476993856i/20905655.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476993856i/20905656._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1476993856i/20905657._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><i>* * *</i><br><br><br>As the characters from the books grow up before my eyes, I realized I have grown up too U+2014 physically, mentally, and emotionally. Words will not be enough to express how much I loved reading Harry Potter. How it helped me cope through some dark moments in my life. Thank you <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a>. This experience has been beyond magical. <br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="5508947932795809791" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_997087400" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/997087400" />    <a title="Xime GarcU+00EDa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25821784-xime-garc-a"><img alt="Xime GarcU+00EDa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463070390p2/25821784.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/997087400?book_show_action=false">Feb 07, 2015</a>      <a title="Xime GarcU+00EDa" class="user" name="Xime GarcU+00EDa" href="/user/show/25821784-xime-garc-a">Xime GarcU+00EDa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788498381450" href="/book/show/2366001.Harry_Potter_y_las_Reliquias_de_la_Muerte">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25821784-xime-garc-a?shelf=love-love-love">love-love-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25821784-xime-garc-a?shelf=reseU+00F1ados">reseU+00F1ados</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer997087400" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4690911093409368818">: Me encantU+00F3, en serio.<br><br>Harry Potter llegU+00F3 a mi vida en el momento justo, podrU+00EDamos decir, cuando yo tenU+00EDa diez aU+00F1os y mi mamU+00E1 querU+00EDa obligarme a leer Julio Verne (nota mental: nunca obliguen a leer a sus hijos Julio Verne cuando reciU+00E9n cumplen diez aU+00F1os. No es saludable). PodrU+00EDa decirse que elegir leer Harry Potter fue mi resistencia a mi mamU+00E1, mi manera de oponerme a ella. U+00A1Y cuU+00E1nto me alegro! <br><br>LeU+00ED <i>Harry Potter y las reliquias de la muerte</i> por primera vez allU+00E1 en 2008, cuando saliU+00F3. Recuerdo que</span>  <span id="freeText4690911093409368818" style="display:none">U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605: Me encantU+00F3, en serio.<br><br>Harry Potter llegU+00F3 a mi vida en el momento justo, podrU+00EDamos decir, cuando yo tenU+00EDa diez aU+00F1os y mi mamU+00E1 querU+00EDa obligarme a leer Julio Verne (nota mental: nunca obliguen a leer a sus hijos Julio Verne cuando reciU+00E9n cumplen diez aU+00F1os. No es saludable). PodrU+00EDa decirse que elegir leer Harry Potter fue mi resistencia a mi mamU+00E1, mi manera de oponerme a ella. U+00A1Y cuU+00E1nto me alegro! <br><br>LeU+00ED <i>Harry Potter y las reliquias de la muerte</i> por primera vez allU+00E1 en 2008, cuando saliU+00F3. Recuerdo que sabU+00EDa la fecha exacta en que llegaba a mi paU+00EDs, recuerdo que fui a mi librerU+00EDa de siempre a pedir que me lo reservaran porque temU+00EDa que se agotaran en el primer dU+00EDa. Recuerdo que el precio me habU+00EDa parecido caro (una ganga comparado con hoy en dU+00EDa), pero yo lo iba a pagar igual porque era el U+00FAltimo. U+00A1El U+00FAltimo de la saga de Harry Potter!<br><br>Y me acuerdo que al terminarlo, me sentU+00ED vacU+00EDa. No era mi favorito. Me gustaban mucho mU+00E1s los otros libros anteriores. Pero este era el U+00FAltimo. No habU+00EDa mU+00E1s Harry Potter despuU+00E9s. No habU+00EDa nada. ReciU+00E9n este aU+00F1o, cinco aU+00F1os despuU+00E9s, saliU+00F3 alguna noticia de nuevos cuentos sobre Harry Potter. Pero en ese momento era morir con lo que tenU+00EDas en tus manos, el U+00FAltimo libro: tU+00F3malo o dU+00E9jalo, compadre. <br><br>Pospuse su relectura mucho, justamente por la razU+00F3n de que no era mi favorito. El quinto de la saga lo leU+00ED unas cuatro veces, y los demU+00E1s, al menos dos veces cada uno. Pero este no lo habU+00EDa vuelto a tocar. QuizU+00E1 porque no sucede en Hogwarts, quizU+00E1 porque ya sabU+00EDa quiU+00E9nes se morU+00EDan, quizU+00E1 porque simplemente era el U+00FAltimo. No lo sabU+00EDa.<br><br>Pero ahora que lo releU+00ED, me di cuenta de muchas cosas que mi yo de doce aU+00F1os no sabU+00EDa asociar. Me di cuenta de cosas que solo mi yo de dieciocho de ahora podrU+00EDa comprender, porque ahora tengo cinco aU+00F1os mU+00E1s de vida y cinco aU+00F1os mU+00E1s de lectura y de cultura encima. <br><br>Lo primero que me percatU+00E9 de esta U+00FAltima novela era la similitud con la historia real que todos compartimos. Sencillo: un lU+00EDder que se cree con la autoridad de elegir quiU+00E9n merece vivir bien y quiU+00E9n no; restricciones; toques de queda; autoritarismo. U+00BFLes suena a algo? SU+00ED, es Voldemort, que condena a los <i>muggles</i> por ser de sangre impura y tiene a su sU+00E9quito de seguidores, que son los MortU+00EDfagos. Pero si escudriU+00F1an un poquito mejor, descubrirU+00E1n que el siglo pasado un hombre alemU+00E1n intentU+00F3 lo mismo con los judU+00EDos y los gays y tambiU+00E9n tenU+00EDa sus seguidores...<br><br>Lo que mU+00E1s me sorprendiU+00F3 de la relectura fue darme cuenta de eso. Que Rowling recreU+00F3 en un libro para niU+00F1os todas las desgracias que el mundo habU+00EDa sufrido a mediados del siglo pasado. Y que seguro un niU+00F1o no lo nota de esa forma, sino que le parece que es algo que solo puede pasar en el mundo de Harry Potter. Esto, concluyo, hace a Voldemort mucho mU+00E1s real y letal de lo que nos pareciU+00F3 en todos los libros. Esto vuelve al SeU+00F1or Tenebroso no un personaje, sino una persona. <br><br>Lo que tambiU+00E9n descubrU+00ED en la relectura son un par de errores tradicionales que se le escapan a cualquiera, solo que, como coloco a Rowling siempre en un pedestal, pensU+00E9 que ella no caerU+00EDa en ellos. Hay demasiados <i>plot holes </i> en la novela, que pretenden ser arreglados con un simple diU+00E1logo o dos palabras, justificando ese errorcito. Me molesta, es como un zumbido de mosquito en medio de la noche, pero bueno, supongo que la autora no podU+00EDa remitirse a corregir libros anteriores para hacer que todo saliera derechito y perfecto en este. <br><br>TambiU+00E9n en su momento no supe ver bien las muertes de los personajes. No entendU+00EDa quU+00E9 tan grave era para la saga en general que muriera tal o cual personaje. Ahora que lo releU+00ED, se me llenaron los ojos de lU+00E1grimas por Remus, Tonks, y mU+00E1s que nadie, Fred, de cuyo gemelo ya todos conocemos el destino (el pobre George no pudo volver a elaborar un <i>Patronus</i> en su vida, y si se mira en el espejo de Erised, solo ve su reflejo - lU+00E1grimas, contU+00E9nganse). <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1404472893i/10242403.jpg" width="375" height="500" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Sigo pensando, y esto ya lo hacU+00EDa con doce aU+00F1os, que la pareja de Ron y Hermione me parece sumamente forzada. Para colmo hace poco Rowling confirmU+00F3 que lo mejor habrU+00EDa sido poner a Harry y a Hermione juntos. No porque sonara predecible, o clichU+00E9 (U+00BFel hU+00E9roe principal con la mejor amiga?, quU+00E9 original), sino porque desde siempre notU+00E9 quU+00EDmica suficiente entre los dos. Cuando Hermione queda petrificada en el segundo libro, Harry no sabe quU+00E9 hacer sin ella... Cuando Ron queda en la enfermerU+00EDa, es Hermione con quien Harry se abre al hablar de su padre en el tercer libro... Cuando Harry estU+00E1 por enfrentarse al Colacuerno HU+00FAngaro, es Hermione quien va a desearle buena suerte y a abrazarlo en el cuarto... Estos dos siempre merecieron terminar juntos, aunque Harry se jacte de quererla como una hermana y de estar enamorado de Ginny (que, por cierto, tambiU+00E9n me pareciU+00F3 forzado. Nada en contra de Ginny, me cae sU+00FAper bien, pero cuando uno shipea a una pareja con tanta fuerza no hay quiU+00E9n te convenza de lo contrario). <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418511364ra/12813302.gif" width="380" height="159" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Con este libro llorU+00E9, reU+00ED, y hasta soU+00F1 U+00E9. Fue mi escape a los estudios. La noche previa a rendir mi U+00FAltimo examen en la facultad, este libro fue lo U+00FAnico que me distrajo. En medio de mi estrU+00E9s y desazU+00F3n, me encontrU+00E9 con viejos amigos, con caras conocidas y con algU+00FAn que otro chiste que hizo que me olvidara de mis pesares.<br><br><b>Las historias que mU+00E1s amamos viven en nosotros para siempre. AsU+00ED que, cuando vuelvas o por las pU+00E1ginas o por la gran pantalla, Hogwarts estarU+00E1 siempre allU+00ED para darte la bienvenida a casa.</b> ~ J. K. Rowling. </span>  <a data-text-id="4690911093409368818" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext Ghabar" href="/user/show/46113221-sara-ghabar">Sara Ghabar</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591054" href="/book/show/820343.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46113221-sara-ghabar?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46113221-sara-ghabar?shelf=owned">owned</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1704691491" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6520935240414923541"><blockquote> <i> "All was well." </i> </blockquote><br><b>NOTHING IS WELL WITH ME</b>. Nothing is well with anyone who had just finished reading <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Harry_Potter___7_" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter, #7) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a>.<br><br><img src="<a href=" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475419812ra/20719606.gif" alt=" photo 8207993_zps3mj0cp9e.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br> The amount of death was heart-wrenching, every time it happened I had to put the book down for a couple of seconds then re-read the passage to believe that it's true and that my eyes are not playing some sick game with me.<br><br><img src="<a href=" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475419812ra/20719607.gif" alt=" photo 681557_zpsh2fgzsai.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br> Now, after being consumed by Hogwarts and the handsome, magical world for approximately 2 and a half months, it's so hard to let go and s</span>  <span id="freeText6520935240414923541" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <i> "All was well." </i></blockquote><br><b>NOTHING IS WELL WITH ME</b>. Nothing is well with anyone who had just finished reading <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Harry_Potter___7_" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter, #7) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a>.<br><br><img src="<a href=" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475419812ra/20719606.gif" alt=" photo 8207993_zps3mj0cp9e.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br> The amount of death was heart-wrenching, every time it happened I had to put the book down for a couple of seconds then re-read the passage to believe that it's true and that my eyes are not playing some sick game with me.<br><br><img src="<a href=" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475419812ra/20719607.gif" alt=" photo 681557_zpsh2fgzsai.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br> Now, after being consumed by Hogwarts and the handsome, magical world for approximately 2 and a half months, it's so hard to let go and say goodbye *sob*.<br><br><br><b> J.K. Rowling </b>, you're awesome.<br><br><img src="<a href=" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475419812ra/20719608.gif" alt=" photo dean1_zpsjzqbygfx.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="6520935240414923541" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_8569075" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/8569075" />    <a title="Alex Telander" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/595788-alex-telander"><img alt="Alex Telander" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1326834904p2/595788.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/8569075?book_show_action=false">Sep 16, 2010</a>      <a title="Alex Telander" class="user" name="Alex Telander" href="/user/show/595788-alex-telander">Alex Telander</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/595788-alex-telander?shelf=books-read-in-2007">books-read-in-2007</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer8569075" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11334887300407938569">HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS BY J. K. ROWLING: Who will die? What will happen to Hogwarts? Is Snape good or bad? Will Voldemort finally die? And is it possible Harry might die? Many people around the world have been waiting two years for the final installment of the Harry Potter series. As I write this, people of all ages are furiously reading; many have already finished. This is it folks, the last one, with no more planned; and the results are in: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows,</span>  <span id="freeText11334887300407938569" style="display:none">HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS BY J. K. ROWLING: Who will die? What will happen to Hogwarts? Is Snape good or bad? Will Voldemort finally die? And is it possible Harry might die? Many people around the world have been waiting two years for the final installment of the Harry Potter series. As I write this, people of all ages are furiously reading; many have already finished. This is it folks, the last one, with no more planned; and the results are in: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, weighing in at 759 pages, concludes the series in spectacular, jaw-dropping, and awe-inspiring fashion, solidly placing the fantasy series up there with Star Wars, <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/34.The_Fellowship_of_the_Ring__The_Lord_of_the_Rings___1_" title="The Fellowship of the Ring (The Lord of the Rings, #1) by J.R.R. Tolkien">The Lord of the Rings</a>, and Stephen KingU+2019s The Dark Tower, possibly as one of the best fantasy series of all time. This seven-book series, which will be published as a complete set on September 18 in a beautifully designed trunk-like box with handles and your very own lock, will be one for the ages, to be read by children for many generations to come.<br /><br />The Death Eaters are slowly but surely taking over, as weU+2019ve always known they eventually would, increasing their numbers and employing the army of Dementors, under the control and guidance of Lord Voldemort. Rowling puts her three main characters U+2013 Harry, Hermione, and Ron U+2013 to the ultimate test here. In the last six books Harry has gotten by with help from friends and teachers, always seemingly getting that necessary and crucial help at the last second; but now the trio are seventeen, no longer considered underage, and able to perform magic wherever and however they so please. Rowling doesnU+2019t hold back, leaving them to fend for themselves, solve their own problems, and get out of each and every situation on their own. Deathly Hallows is nonstop action, one scene of fighting and almost death leading onto the next, as the three seek out the Horcruxes. Going on the vague and barely informative words of wisdom from the late Albus Dumbledore, they piece it together, using their magical and educational knowledge U+2013 not just HermioneU+2019s! U+2013 with the goal of finally defeating Voldemort once and for all. And while Harry has expressed in the past that itU+2019s up to him, heU+2019s the Chosen One, and needs to go it alone, he isnU+2019t given the opportunity here.<br /><br />People are dying, mainly muggles, but also Mudbloods, and any whose bloodline is tainted with that of the non-magical, leading to a growing world that harkens back to the time of the Third Reich in Nazi Germany, as well as echoing the doom and hopelessness of 1984. With VoldemortU+2019s rule seemingly solid and complete, Harry gets help he doesnU+2019t want from the Order of the Phoenix and DumbledoreU+2019s Army, leading up to a great final battle where the castle known as Hogwarts lives up to its name as a defensible fortress.<br /><br />This is the last book folks: who will live and who will die, who will triumph and who will fall is at the mercy of the turning page and the next sentence. But with the size of this book, you can be sure youU+2019ll be on the ride of your life from the first page until the last. And you will feel a sadness and longing at the realization that the long journey in the life of Harry Potter is finally over. Yet Rowling has done such an incredible job with Deathly Hallows, weaving in details and points from all previous six books, that you are left with a strong sense of nostalgia. And whatU+2019s the only cure for this feeling? Why to begin the books all over again with the first when Harry Potter first looked upon Number Four, Privet Drive.<br /><br />For more book reviews, and author interviews, go to <a href="http://www.bookbanter.net" rel="nofollow">BookBanter</a>.</span>  <a data-text-id="11334887300407938569" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review8569075">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks"> U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_8569075" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_8569075" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=8569075&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_8569075" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 8569075, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/8569075?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_8569075' style='display: a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1754455113" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1754455113" />    <a title="Emily" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/88025-emily"><img alt="Emily" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475287992p2/88025.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1754455113?book_show_action=false">Sep 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Emily" class="user" name="Emily" href="/user/show/88025-emily">Emily</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545139700" href="/book/show/4979435-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/88025-emily?shelf=reread-books">reread-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1754455113" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10523204305136049619">How have I never written a review of this book?<br /><br />When people ask me which is my favorite book, I always have to say this one. It's the book with which I have the strongest emotional attachment. Of all the books I've read, this is the one I would choose to read before I died if I had the choice. Not only is it long enough to give me plenty of time to get my affairs in order, but it tells me how to live and how to die. With courage and bravery and by making the choice that is hard and not taking the</span>  <span id="freeText10523204305136049619" style="display:none">How have I never written a review of this book?<br /><br />When people ask me which is my favorite book, I always have to say this one. It's the book with which I have the strongest emotional attachment. Of all the books I've read, this is the one I would choose to read before I died if I had the choice. Not only is it long enough to give me plenty of time to get my affairs in order, but it tells me how to live and how to die. With courage and bravery and by making the choice that is hard and not taking the easy way out. Every one of my favorite characters in this series goes on an emotional journey when faced with the threat of evil, heartbreak, and loss. This book shows me that love is the greatest weapon we have against the throes of evil and misfortune and our own failings as humans. Dobby returning to his former masters' house to save his friend Harry Potter. Hermoine Granger and her compulsion to go to the library. To be the brains behind it all. Luna Lovegood and her indefatigable sense of the unusual slyly masking her emotional connection to Harry and her friends. "Hermoine my head, Luna my heart," I often say. Neville Longbottom becoming Harry's equal in bravery and courage. Harry himself accepting his destiny walking alongside his beloved family into the forest, the family he had longed to see since standing before the Mirror of Erised. What do I see when I look into that same mirror? How am I like Harry? How can I be more like Ron--the heart of the trio? How am even sometimes like Voldemort with his myopic selfishness? Who and what on this earth do I overlook? <br /><br />This book always seems to coincide with emotional upheavals in my life, and this time is no different. It is almost like scripture in that this book speaks to me differently every time I come to it. Some new piece of wisdom comes forward. I leave this reading of Harry Potter with a sense that bravery and courage and walking towards the hard things in your life can only be done with friends and family by your side. But in the end, we all walk into the forest of uncertainty alone, just like Harry. This book holds my dreams and even my tears across the many years I have read and reread it. I know I will return to this world again and again with friends and family old and new. Seeing loved ones fall in love with this world is one of the greatest joys of my life. Welcome to the club. </span>  <a data-text-id="10523204305136049619" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_35176936" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/35176936" />    <a title="Chris" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1605591-chris"><img alt="Chris" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1252166169p2/1605591.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/35176936?book_show_action=false">Nov 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Chris" class="user" name="Chris" href="/user/show/1605591-chris">Chris</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1605591-chris?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1605591-chris?shelf=witches">witches</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1605591-chris?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer35176936&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer35176936" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2380548457163622485">Okay, so I'll admit that when the Potter books first came out, I wasn't a kid. I don't have kids, unless you count three cats and a dog (though sometimes its three dogs), but you shouldn't because dogs and cats are different from kids. I don't have to send them to school, and I don't really have to read to them. Though, I had a dog who growled during <i>Paradise Lost</i> and a cat who loves <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/20524.Anthony_Trollope" title="Anthony Trollope">Anthony Trollope</a>. Anyway, the point is I am not the targeted age group. I have a soft spot for Potter. Rowling ge</span>  <span id="freeText2380548457163622485" style="display:none">Okay, so I'll admit that when the Potter books first came out, I wasn't a kid. I don't have kids, unless you count three cats and a dog (though sometimes its three dogs), but you shouldn't because dogs and cats are different from kids. I don't have to send them to school, and I don't really have to read to them. Though, I had a dog who growled during <i>Paradise Lost</i> and a cat who loves <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/20524.Anthony_Trollope" title="Anthony Trollope">Anthony Trollope</a>. Anyway, the point is I am not the targeted age group. I have a soft spot for Potter. Rowling gets children to read long books. It's fantasy. Its about outcasts. It has dogs, cats, owls.<br /><br />I, however, did not really like this one. Why? It didn't need to be as long as it was. It really didn't. It was predictable, at least if you think about everything it was. The real reason, however, is what in Hades did Rowling do to Hermione? I mean, geez, talk about a whining, nagging, annoying girl. She's nothing like she was in the last book. True, she's still smart and far more loyal than Ron. She knows how to pack. But sometimes in the book I just wanted to tell her to be quiet or to stop crying.<br /><br />And what was with all those deaths at the end? Did Rowling just throw names out willy nilly? Remus and Tonks? Because Tonks cares more for her husband than her child? I get people die in war, but the deaths lacked the meaning and feeling that Dobby had. That was a death. The rest just felt like she was running though a list. Real life, maybe. But in this type of book? Why couldn't Harry mourn Hedwig just a little more? Then, I'm suppose to believe that Molly could take out Bellatrix? Really, without Molly showing any real power before? I understand the idea of a mother's rage, but it came across as "can't le Ginny do it because she's a kid".<br /><br />And the ending, the fanfic ending? Why would Harry name his child after Snape before naming a child after Sirius? <br /><br />Well, I'm not a kid, so maybe that's why I didn't like this one so much. </span>  <a data-text-id="2380548457163622485" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_35176936" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_35176936" ref="like" class="jsLike  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_29198386" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/29198386" />    <a title="Gail Harcourt-Brown" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1394333-gail-harcourt-brown"><img alt="Gail Harcourt-Brown" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1217949895p2/1394333.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/29198386?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2008</a>      <a title="Gail Harcourt-Brown" class="user" name="Gail Harcourt-Brown" href="/user/show/1394333-gail-harcourt-brown">Gail Harcourt-Brown</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer29198386&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer29198386" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10550297564371161037">A very weak ending to the popular series. Here are my main criticisms:<br /><br />1. Harry, Hermione and Ron spend more than half the book just wandering around looking for horcruxes, and they do it in a manner that's alarmingly clumsy given that the fate of wizardom is on their shoulders.<br /><br />2. At various points Rowling conveniently allows Harry (and the reader) to "see" (via dreams and visions) what Voldemort is up to, but Voldemort, despite his immense powers, is unable to do the same with Harry. In fact he</span>  <span id="freeText10550297564371161037" style="display:none">A very weak ending to the popular series. Here are my main criticisms:<br /><br />1. Harry, Hermione and Ron spend more than half the book just wandering around looking for horcruxes, and they do it in a manner that's alarmingly clumsy given that the fate of wizardom is on their shoulders.<br /><br />2. At various points Rowling conveniently allows Harry (and the reader) to "see" (via dreams and visions) what Voldemort is up to, but Voldemort, despite his immense powers, is unable to do the same with Harry. In fact he seems mostly unaware that Harry is spying on him. <br /><br />3. Help, advice, and historical information (including the secrets of Snape's past) are conveniently passed along to Harry through the pensieve. It's like a magical YouTube.<br /><br />4. Harry gets so much help from a talking image of Dumbledore that the headmaster might as well be there in person.<br /><br />5. Voldemort seems oddly incompetent for an evil overlord about to take over the world.<br /><br />6. The "last battle" is unimpressive and even silly at times. (Mrs. Weasley saying "Get back! She's mine!" and "Not my daughter, you bitch!"? Come on. She's Mrs. Weasley, not Dirty Harry.)<br /><br />7. The resolution between Harry and Voldemort is completely predictable to anyone who's paid attention to the other 6 books. <br /><br />8. The explanation about the Elder Wand (on which the whole resolution depends) makes no sense, no matter how you look at it. It's just a big, twisted chain of pretzel logic.<br /><br />No, I am not a Harry Potter hater. I loved the series and always looked forward to the next installment. But some of the books were stronger than others and this one, unfortunately, is the weakest.</span>  <a data-text-id="10550297564371161037" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review29198386">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link29198386" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=29198386&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer'
