 </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1277935827" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1277935827" />    <a title="Amanda NEVER MANDY" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36873041-amanda-never-mandy"><img alt="Amanda NEVER MANDY" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470689139p2/36873041.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277935827?book_show_action=false">Dec 16, 2015</a>      <a title="Amanda NEVER MANDY" class="user" name="Amanda NEVER MANDY" href="/user/show/36873041-amanda-never-mandy">Amanda NEVER MANDY</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36873041-amanda-never-mandy?shelf=harry-plopper">harry-plopper</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36873041-amanda-never-mandy?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1277935827" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8953602963182309608">The number one sign of a truly amazing book for me is the inability to put it back down once it has been picked up. We arenU+2019t talking just a physical need here, but mental. Walking around consumed by the story, with every thought circling and connecting trying to bring it all to life. That is a readerU+2019s bliss.<br /><br />From the second I cracked the spine on this one I knew I was in for it, that there would be no controlling that insatiable need to devour each and every word it provided. I tried to pace my</span>  <span id="freeText8953602963182309608" style="display:none">The number one sign of a truly amazing book for me is the inability to put it back down once it has been picked up. We arenU+2019t talking just a physical need here, but mental. Walking around consumed by the story, with every thought circling and connecting trying to bring it all to life. That is a readerU+2019s bliss.<br /><br />From the second I cracked the spine on this one I knew I was in for it, that there would be no controlling that insatiable need to devour each and every word it provided. I tried to pace myself and find other things to entertain my mind but there was no use trying, I just had to know what was happening. It was almost as if I feared that if I left it closed too long that the story would continue on without me and I would miss something vital. That my inattentiveness might even hurt my beloved characters in some way.<br /><br />I reiterate, <b>ALL A MARK OF A TRULY OUTSTANDING BOOK</b>.<br /><br />I also had one of those U+201Choly shit, I actually agree with a clichU+00E9 U+201D moments with this book and I blame my husband for it. After catching me alternating between wiping my eyes, gritting my teeth and mumbling curses under my breath, he couldnU+2019t help but ask why I was being more U+201CmeU+201D than usual. I of course pointed out how it was all finally going down and he asked if he should read them.<br /><br />U+201CYes, are you stupid?U+201D<br /><br />U+201CBut reallyU+2026all of them?U+201D<br /><br />U+201CYes, are you lazy?U+201D<br /><br />U+201CYou said so yourself, that all the info and good stuff was in the last one. Why waste my time on the rest.U+201D<br /><br />U+201CWellU+2026 U+201D<br /><br />So I have had to think on it and ask myself honestly what my exact recommendation would be. I mean you could go without all the slow, steady backstory build-up and probably manage just fine. BUT, what would be the fun in that? Then it hit me (along with a massive wave of self-disgust for the whole motivational poster bit), that a book (series) is a journey, not a destination.<br /><br />You are very welcome. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="8953602963182309608" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2803571-morgan?shelf=tears-for-days">tears-for-days</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1718210579" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9248614553284173626"><b> <i>We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.<br /></i> </b><br /><i>U+201CHe must have known I'd want to leave you."<br />"No, he must have known you would always want to come back.U+201D <br /><b><br /><i>U+201CYou think I'm a fool?" demanded Harry.<br />"No, I think you're like James," said Lupin, "who would have regarded it as the height of dishonor to mistrust his friends.U+201D <br /></i></b><br /><i>U+201CCinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?U+201D<br /><b><br /><i>It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have nev</i></b></i></i></span>  <span id="freeText9248614553284173626" style="display:none"><b>  <i>We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.<br /></i></b><br /><i>U+201CHe must have known I'd want to leave you."<br />"No, he must have known you would always want to come back.U+201D <br /><b><br /><i>U+201CYou think I'm a fool?" demanded Harry.<br />"No, I think you're like James," said Lupin, "who would have regarded it as the height of dishonor to mistrust his friends.U+201D <br /></i></b><br /><i>U+201CCinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?U+201D<br /><b><br /><i>It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.<br /></i></b><br /><i>What appeared to be fine golden chains wove around the pictures, linking them together, but after examining them for a minute or so, Harry realized that the chains were actually one word, repeated a thousand times in golden ink: friends . . . friends . . . friends . . .<br /><b><br /><i>For instance, this new idea that You-Know-Who can kill with a single glance from his eyes. ThatU+2019s a basilisk, listeners. One simple test: Check whether the thing thatU+2019s glaring at you has got legs. If it has, itU+2019s safe to look into its eyes, although if it really is You-Know-Who, thatU+2019s still likely to be the last thing you ever do.<br /></i></b><br /><i>Hogwarts was the first and best home he had known. He and Voldemort and Snape, the abandoned boys, had all found home here.<br /><b><br /><i>U+201CSeverus Snape wasn't yours," said Harry. "Snape was Dumbledore's, Dumbledore's from the moment you started hunting down my mother...U+201D<br /></i></b><br /><i>Words are, in my not-so-humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic. Capable of both inflicting injury, and remedying it.</i></i></i></i></i></span>  <a data-text-id="9248614553284173626" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>            swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_3236173" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3236173" />    <a title="Jessica" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/202724-jessica"><img alt="Jessica" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477428335p2/202724.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3236173?book_show_action=false">Apr 06, 2011</a>      <a title="Jessica" class="user" name="Jessica" href="/user/show/202724-jessica">Jessica</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=all-timefavorites">all-timefavorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3236173" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10339421730281994305">Wow.<br /><br />So, I've never reviewed this before, because, what can you say about it?! I bought it at a midnight release party, devoured it, and knew that I loved it.<br /><br />But now that I've spent the last couple of weeks reading it aloud to my son, I understand why I loved it so much. Does anyone fully appreciate the scope of what Rowling did with this book? She spent years upon years, and six other books building a world and populating it with characters, and then she BROUGHT IT AND THEM ALL TOGETHER. Spells,</span>  <span id="freeText10339421730281994305" style="display:none">Wow.<br /><br />So, I've never reviewed this before, because, what can you say about it?! I bought it at a midnight release party, devoured it, and knew that I loved it.<br /><br />But now that I've spent the last couple of weeks reading it aloud to my son, I understand why I loved it so much. Does anyone fully appreciate the scope of what Rowling did with this book? She spent years upon years, and six other books building a world and populating it with characters, and then she BROUGHT IT AND THEM ALL TOGETHER. Spells, tools, people, events, that had been sprinkled throughout the other six books were now smoothly woven together into this last great battle. And yes, they spend a lot of time camping, but as Harry says to Ron, "Did you think we'd be finding a Horcrux a day?" No, I didn't, or at least I hoped that they wouldn't, because that would have been too pat, too unrealistic. Instead, they had to search, they had to learn, they had to struggle, and be bored, and be lost, and then find what they needed. The Ron-Harry-Hermione friendship is tested, and found to be unbreakable. Ron and Hermione's relationship moves forward, Harry has time to reflect on his life, the people who have helped him, what his future might hold.<br /><br />And I loved it. I loved the moments of solemn reflection. I loved the testing of loyalties, revelations about the youth of Dumbledore and Snape (and if you don't bawl like a baby reading about Snape's memories, YOU HAVE NO SOUL!), Lily and even Petunia. There are no throwaway characters in Rowling's world, yet it isn't just some endless catalogue of: And Dean did this, and Neville did this . . . Everything is part of one whole, beautiful story. The Weasleys continue to show their strength and love for Harry (and if you don't cry when Percy shows up, or when Fred . . . you know . . . YOU HAVE NO SOUL!), Neville proves that he is his parents' son, and a true Gryffindor . . . and in short, there are so many stand up and cheer moments that I couldn't sit still while I was reading it. Of course, there are many, many tragedies, but after each tragedy, a moment of triumph to balance it, for which I say:<br /><br />Thank you, J. K. Rowling, for creating one of the best, most magical series for children of all time. Thank you for giving us Harry, Ron, Hermione, Fred and George, Ginny and Luna, and so many wonderful moments.<br /><br />And thank you, most of all, for not screwing up the grand finale.<br /><br />Best. Series ender. Ever.</span>  <a data-text-id="10339421730281994305" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1541467910" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1541467910" />    <a title="jamieson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson"><img alt="jamieson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478436535p2/7706640.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1541467910?book_show_action=false">Oct 11, 2016</a>      <a title="jamieson" class="user" name="jamieson" href="/user/show/7706640-jamieson">jamieson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591054" href="/book/show/820343.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=childrens-literature">childrens-literature</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1541467910" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8914055579654173783"><i> <blockquote>Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love</blockquote> </i> <br /><br />This is my favourite Harry Potter book, I adore it, I love it so much. It's weird because it's not /usual/ Harry Potter. It doesn't have much Hogwarts, there's no quidditch -- but I <b>love it</b> <br /><br />I don't wanna get gushy about Harry Potter I mean <i>you all feel me on this</i> everyone loves Harry Potter, you get me. I'm just gonna list some reasons I love this book, this series, so much. <br /><br />- <b>The characters. </b> I just want</span>  <span id="freeText8914055579654173783" style="display:none"><i>  <blockquote>Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love</blockquote></i> <br /><br />This is my favourite Harry Potter book, I adore it, I love it so much. It's weird because it's not /usual/ Harry Potter. It doesn't have much Hogwarts, there's no quidditch -- but I <b>love it</b> <br /><br />I don't wanna get gushy about Harry Potter I mean <i>you all feel me on this</i> everyone loves Harry Potter, you get me. I'm just gonna list some reasons I love this book, this series, so much. <br /><br />- <b>The characters. </b> I just want it to be on the record Harry James Potter is one of my top five favourite characters. He is just SUCH A GOOD PERSON. I admire his bravery, his selflessness and his determination ( and also he's literally the most savage person his roasts are life ) I love so much about him - I love that he's not perfect either. He can be mean, arrogant, literally annoying asf but I LOVE HIM. He makes me so emotional, like he actually breaks my heart. <br /><br />Thats why this book is actual crack for me. There is so much of it relating to Harry's parents, his past, his childhood. There is so much about him having to do the right thing even though it's hard, even though he's suffering, even though people <i>have literally been fucking with him for years</i> he does the right thing anyway I JUST LOVE HIM ALOT <br /><br />Other characters, Ron man. Ron. He fucks up bad but he comes back and he redeems himself and urggh I love him. His loyalty is amazing, but he's such a real character. I love how he (quite literally) is able to conquer (stab with a sword) his demons and his character development is amazing and he's just so funny and such a good friend he's my son ?? I love him. <br /><br />HERMIONE I honestly can't say anything except wife me she's so inspirational and passionate and sticks to her beliefs even when they're unpopular and I honestly just love her and the trio so much ?<br /><br /><b>Deathly Hallows is just so good like lets recap on some highlights.</b> <br /><blockquote><br /> --> Opens on Dudley actually accepting Harry and thanking him<br /> --> Wild broom chase, crazy sky wand fights and <i>I'm Holey Fred ... get it ?</i><br /> --> Ron fighting his mother about the wedding. Harry and Ginny. Horcrux planning. <br /> --> Coffee shop death eater skirmish<br /> --> REGULUS ARCTURUS BLACK<br /> --> Lily's letter<br /> --> KREACHER<br /> --> Ministry break-in. Harry sticking it to Umbridge<br /> --> Potterwatch<br /> --> GRINGOTTS BREAK-IN ?!?!<br /> --> The DA resisting in Hogwarts, magical graffiti that says <i>Dumbledore's Army, Still Recruiting!</i><br /> --> Speaking of Dumbledore, just the entirely of his and Aberforths family story<br /> --> Godrics Hollow. Harry seeing James & Lily's graves and the house. Heartbreaking but beautiful<br /> --> THE BIT WHEN NEVILLE WIPES OUT NAGINI<br /> --> Snape's story<br /> --> Everything coming together so beautifully at the end aND THE GRAND HALL SCENE<br /> --> Harry mending the Phoenix wand <br /> --> Teddy Lupin existing<br /> --> Harry getting to see his parents/Sirius/Lupin say what he's always wanted to crying bye<br /> --> like the whole book tbh ?? I love it ??<br /><br /></blockquote><br />I could say alot about the beautiful messages and sybolism. I could say about the beautiful and poignant way Harry's grief and loss about his parents is dealt with, or talk about the perfect symbolism of Voldermort's death - and how it shows that he was not special but just a regular man who was devoid of love and took his quest for power way too far. I could talk about how Voldermort's soul is represented and what Voldermort represents for humanity but I wouldn't be the first and I won't be the last and I would have too much to say anyway (and no way to say it how I wanna)<br /><br />So instead I'll just say I adore this book, forever and always. I adore this series and everything it gave me. I love that it created such a wonderful and expansive world I wanna live in. I love that it gave me characters who were my friends growing up. I love that it's defined my childhood and become to important to me and I can't believe it came out nearly ten years ago. I love it so much, forever. </span>  <a data-text-id="8914055579654173783" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_10655209" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/10655209" />    <a title="Traci" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/285209-traci"><img alt="Traci" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1199166928p2/285209.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/10655209?book_show_action=false">Dec 18, 2007</a>      <a title="Traci" class="user" name="Traci" href="/user/show/285209-traci">Traci</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">no one</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/285209-traci?shelf=pure-crap">pure-crap</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer10655209&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer10655209" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9354342392254940069">Why do I hate this book???<br />Oh, let me count the ways:<br />1. Predictable.<br />2. Ohmigosh, they're going to get caught!!! And they barely get away. How many times did that happen? At the wedding, at the cafe, in the woods, at the Malfoys, at Gringotts, at the Ministry, at Godric's Hallow ... ... ... at Luna's dad's house ... ... did I miss any??? I mean, after one such incident, there's a line that says something like, How they managed to escape from such a situation was beyond him ... yeah, that's because</span>  <span id="freeText9354342392254940069" style="display:none">Why do I hate this book???<br />Oh, let me count the ways:<br />1. Predictable.<br />2. Ohmigosh, they're going to get caught!!! And they barely get away. How many times did that happen? At the wedding, at the cafe, in the woods, at the Malfoys, at Gringotts, at the Ministry, at Godric's Hallow ... ... ... at Luna's dad's house ... ... did I miss any??? I mean, after one such incident, there's a line that says something like, How they managed to escape from such a situation was beyond him ... yeah, that's because it's a freakin' novel.<br />3. What the fuck was up with that chapter with Dumbledore? It's like JK Rowling was trying too hard to make this book more than the good story it should have been.<br />4. Draco was ignored, explained away as a just a contrived plot point.<br />5. Ron leaving and then coming back to save Harry - contrived plot point.<br />6. Ron and Hermione finally kissing ... in the middle of a war ... in the middle of a hallway that's about to fall apart ... ... sure, that's going to happen.<br />7. Who the fuck cares about the characters that did die? I mean, only the Weasely twin was someone important.<br />8. And of course Hedwig died. Harry couldn't have a way to communicate with the Wizarding world now could he.<br />9. Lord Voldemort has been foiled by Harry how many times now? And when he "kills" Harry, don't you think that a wizard mastermind who's been foiled by this stupid boy as many times as he had, would go make sure the little prat is dead himself? Like he'd go poke him with his wand or something?<br />10. Hermione, in every other book, has had some sort of thing that only she can figure out, but in this book she suddenly becomes this little wussy girl that lets Harry walk all over her.<br />--<br />It took me FOUR days to read this book. FOUR!!! I - little miss read the HP books in ten hours straight - put this book down volutarily for three nights in a row. It took all my self-discipline not to throw it across the room.<br />There were two redeeming parts of this book. Just two.<br />1. At the Malfoy's when Ron is screaming for Hermione.<br />2. The chapter about Snape.<br />That's it.<br />And the Epilogue sucked.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="9354342392254940069" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review10655209">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link10655209" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=10655209&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_10655209'><a id="like_count_review_10655209" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/10655209?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">53 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_10655209" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_10655209" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=53&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=10655209&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_10655209" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 10655209, true, &#39;&#39;); class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1454534586" />    <a title="Danielle (Love at First Page)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page"><img alt="Danielle (Love at First Page)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466719440p2/1312450.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1454534586?book_show_action=false">Jan 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Danielle (Love at First Page)" class="user" name="Danielle (Love at First Page)" href="/user/show/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page">Danielle (Love at First Page)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545583008" href="/book/show/17347379-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=favorites-young-adult">favorites-young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=fantasy-scifi-paranormal">fantasy-scifi-paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=these-are-not-tears">these-are-not-tears</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=own-physical-copy">own-physical-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=i-love-fairy-tales">i-love-fairy-tales</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=cover-love">cover-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=challenge-a-series-a-month-2016">challenge-a-series-a-month-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1454534586" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10083660625777440521">Okay, wow, it's been a long time since I've cried that often while reading a book. There are no words. Harry, Ron, Hermoine... those brave kids. How they always stood together - or came back to each other. Any scene with James, Lily, Sirius, and Lupin basically shredded me. I want a prequel novel more than anything. Dumbledore... one of the most unforgettable characters ever written. And misguided, misunderstood Snape, yeah he pulled at my heartstrings too. <br /><br />Just such an amazing story. <i>Deathly Ha</i></span>  <span id="freeText10083660625777440521" style="display:none">Okay, wow, it's been a long time since I've cried that often while reading a book. There are no words. Harry, Ron, Hermoine... those brave kids. How they always stood together - or came back to each other. Any scene with James, Lily, Sirius, and Lupin basically shredded me. I want a prequel novel more than anything. Dumbledore... one of the most unforgettable characters ever written. And misguided, misunderstood Snape, yeah he pulled at my heartstrings too. <br /><br />Just such an amazing story. <i>Deathly Hallows</i> is definitely my favorite of the series. So happy I finally took this journey, even if J.K. Rowling stole several pieces of my soul along the way...<br /><br />Some books change you on the inside. Not only will I want to cry whenever I think about this one, but it's made me feel I will never be the same again. People who aren't readers will never understand this inexplicable power of a great book. I think Dumbledore would want us to pity them, yes? :)</span>  <a data-text-id="10083660625777440521" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1454534586" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1454534586" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_3798963" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3798963" />    <a title="Eleanor" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/76346-eleanor"><img alt="Eleanor" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1430845601p2/76346.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3798963?book_show_action=false">Jul 30, 2007</a>      <a title="Eleanor" class="user" name="Eleanor" href="/user/show/76346-eleanor">Eleanor</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">those who like epics, fantasy, magic, school</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3798963" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16990733176438122434">(shamelessly cross-posted from my livejournal entry) Spoilers below!<br /><br />I remember picking up Harry Potter around the time that book 3 had come out. There had been buzz about the books in the post with a picture of JK standing by railroad tracks and some inside joke about "muggles." I probably wouldn't have read them had I not babysat for my nextdoor neighbor's kids who were 7 and 10 at the time, and asked me to read it to them as a bedtime story. What is so compelling about these children's books?</span>  <span id="freeText16990733176438122434" style="display:none">(shamelessly cross-posted from my livejournal entry) Spoilers below!<br /><br />I remember picking up Harry Potter around the time that book 3 had come out. There had been buzz about the books in the post with a picture of JK standing by railroad tracks and some inside joke about "muggles." I probably wouldn't have read them had I not babysat for my nextdoor neighbor's kids who were 7 and 10 at the time, and asked me to read it to them as a bedtime story. What is so compelling about these children's books? The well-woven archetypes, the mystery, the imaginative combination of fantasy and fancy? As another blogger put it, the books are overflowing with story. Never once are they a method for JK to assuage her vanity as a writer, because the writing itself isn't deep, their success is a result of Rowling being an increadibly steady storyteller whose approach has more than a few similarities to classic storytelling. Her main three characters account for the three things Aristotle named as the only necessary ingredients in successful rhetoric - Ethos (Harry) Pathos (Ron) and Logos (Hermione). She extends this to all aspects of the Harry Potter world, to houses in Hogwarts, their respective teachers, as well as borrowing latin for names of spells and words from other languages as names for characters-- Malfoy (quoting wikipedia) is derived from Old French "mal foi" or "mal foy," which means "bad faith" or "bad trust". The Old French mal foy itself is derived from Latin mala fide, which as a judicial term means intentional mischief, ill will or evil intentions.(/quoting wikipedia) Grimmauld place is also a pun on "grim old place." As far as the pacing, it takes into realistic account the rest and hunger the characters go through with no detail spared as to when and what the characters eat. For some reason this makes a story more effective to me, call me weird, I like reading about people eating. Though while I read the Odyssey this made me put the book down more than a few times because it made me hungry. Anyhow, the constant thread through these books was the final showdown that had to happen between Harry and Voldemort, though I think I would have read them anyway for her generously detailed fantastic world...<br /><br />I was surprised Harry didn't die. I really thought it was going to happen and was a little disappointed with the end, mostly because the meeting with Dumbledore in the train station purgatory was a bit much of a deus ex machina for me. I know she had to vindicate Dumbledore and I thought that was fine but something about it was too clean and easy without her usual foreshadowing. I knew Snape would be vindicated in the end! I loved how she rounded out his story, all that was perfect. I was a huge fan of the way in which Rowling discredited the phrase "for the greater good" probably much to the confusion of most of her younger readers. Was a little taken aback at the vague comparison of that to the holocaust, how she wrote something like "for the greater good" was on the gates of a place where Grindewald killed people but it drove the point home. The Elder Wand ownership thing was...it was like she painted herself into a corner and had to get it resolved before she could finish the book, made the final duel a bit too, er, complex. But my favorite moment in all of these books came at the end of chapter 35 right before Harry regains consciousness for the final battle. It was the most elegant way to finish out this series that has made millions of children into avid readers:<br /><br />"Tell me one last thing," said Harry. "Is this real? Or has this been happening inside my head?"<br />Dumbledore beamed at him, and his voice sounded loud and strong in Harry's ears even though the bright mist was descending again obscuring his figure.<br />"Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?"</span>  <a data-text-id="16990733176438122434" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review3798963">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link3798963" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=3798963&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_3798963'><a id="like_count_review_3798963" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/3798963?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">46 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3798963" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3798963" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=46&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=3798963&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_3798963" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 3798963, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">8 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/3798963?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_3798963' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/3798963/comments?reverse=true">View all 8 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_58390750" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="None Of" href="/user/show/12893261-none-of"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/12893261-none-of">None Of</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer18152780565475850889">Guys listen theres something wrong with Eleanor's eye. I think we should urge her to see an eye docter and guys please no jokes.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Sep 18, 2012 06:30PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_65193976" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Sosen" href="/user/show/5590799-sosen"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474087082p1/5590799.jpg" alt="5590799" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/5590799-sosen">Sosen</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11419039003577413927">I thought the ending was pretty freakin' terrible.  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_468116673" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/468116673" />    <a title="Vilda" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15094746-vilda"><img alt="Vilda" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1438091034p2/15094746.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/468116673?book_show_action=false">Aug 26, 2016</a>      <a title="Vilda" class="user" name="Vilda" href="/user/show/15094746-vilda">Vilda</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855713" href="/book/show/22844208-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Everyone!</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=read-in-2007">read-in-2007</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=emotional-roller-coaster">emotional-roller-coaster</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=highlighted-like-crazy">highlighted-like-crazy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=the-favorites">the-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=buddy-read">buddy-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=laugh-out-loud-moments">laugh-out-loud-moments</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=sob-fest">sob-fest</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=didn-t-want-to-put-down">didn-t-want-to-put-down</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=huggles">huggles</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=satisfaction-yes">satisfaction-yes</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=oh-the-heartache">oh-the-heartache</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=puts-a-smile-on-your-face">puts-a-smile-on-your-face</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=favorite-series">favorite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=buddy-reads-with-nika">buddy-reads-with-nika</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=i-have-no-words">i-have-no-words</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=wipes-tears">wipes-tears</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=physical-copy">physical-copy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer468116673" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9414920623904372202"><b>5+ stars</b><br /><br /><blockquote> <i>"'You'll stay with me?'<br />'Until the very end,'"</i> </blockquote><br />After this re-read, I think that this book is in fact my absolute favorite of the series; there is just no other book that can compete for me. Within their Hogwarts years, #3 will always have my heart, but as for the complete series... It has to be this one. This book is... everything. <b>It is the final answers, the final fight, the end... It is such an emotional roller coaster that it's impossible to explain to someone who hasn't experienced</b></span>  <span id="freeText9414920623904372202" style="display:none"><b>5+ stars</b><br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>"'You'll stay with me?'<br />'Until the very end,'"</i></blockquote><br />After this re-read, I think that this book is in fact my absolute favorite of the series; there is just no other book that can compete for me. Within their Hogwarts years, #3 will always have my heart, but as for the complete series... It has to be this one. This book is... everything. <b>It is the final answers, the final fight, the end... It is such an emotional roller coaster that it's impossible to explain to someone who hasn't experienced it for themselves.</b> I've read plenty of emotional books by now, but I don't think any other book has affected me in the way that this book has nor do I think that any will.<br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>"The scream was the more terrible because he had never expected or dreamed that Professor McGonagall could make such a sound."</i></blockquote><br />This series is my childhood. It's been in my life since I was about 9 or 10 years old, about the age when I desperately wanted my own Hogwarts letter, and ended when I was about 14/15 years old. I always loved to read, but this series was the first one that made me truly addicted to reading. I would bring these books with me everywhere and do my best to sneak away to read; dinners at relatives, soccer tournaments, any kind of trip... <b>I've re-read these books more times than I can ever remember and I still love them just the same. It's just this huge part of my life. All of these characters are.</b> And so, this final book, with so much nostalgia, love, death and horror filling it's pages... <b>*takes deep breath*</b><br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>"NOT MY DAUGHTER, YOU BITCH!"</i></blockquote><br />I'm not even sure what I'm trying to say. This book is fantastic in my opinion, the series as a whole is, and I love it so very, very much. I'm basically shaky with emotions. I've laughed, cried, chuckled with tear-filled eyes... No matter how many times I read this book, I experience the same thing. No matter that I know what is coming; perhaps that even makes it harder. <b>I guess I just wanna say that it is a huge favorite of mine, holding a spot no other book or series could ever take from my heart.</b> And I love whenever I have the opportunity to visit this world, and these wonderful and lovable characters, all over again. <br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>"'After all this time?'<br />'Always,' said Snape."</i></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="9414920623904372202" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_858762188" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/858762188" />    <a title="Vane J." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19590155-vane-j"><img alt="Vane J." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468102148p2/19590155.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/858762188?book_show_action=false">Feb 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Vane J." class="user" name="Vane J." href="/user/show/19590155-vane-j">Vane J.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=amazing-characters">amazing-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=2014">2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=ate-my-heart">ate-my-heart</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=speshul-snowflake">speshul-snowflake</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=all-the-feels">all-the-feels</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer858762188" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9074410464595081375">Aaaaand it's over. Again.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454967480ra/18035902.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And I'm utterly shattered, but I'm also in a state of <i>ecstasy</i> because of how the many pieces of the puzzle the Harry Potter series is fitted. Seriously, I can't think of no other series of book so cautiously planned, in which all the details are important and everything - <i>everything</i> - makes sense in the way this does in the end.<br><br>It was about time I truly appreciated what a fantastic world J.K. Rowling created with this series. As I had said before, I didn't really love th</span>  <span id="freeText9074410464595081375" style="display:none">Aaaaand it's over. Again.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454967480ra/18035902.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And I'm utterly shattered, but I'm also in a state of <i>ecstasy</i> because of how the many pieces of the puzzle the Harry Potter series is fitted. Seriously, I can't think of no other series of book so cautiously planned, in which all the details are important and everything - <i>everything</i> - makes sense in the way this does in the end.<br><br>It was about time I truly appreciated what a fantastic world J.K. Rowling created with this series. As I had said before, I didn't really love this series before this reread - I simply <i>liked</i> it, and that was enough for me to not get the fweels and not to be in pain because of all the deaths that happened.<br><br>Deaths which, by the way, made the book better and worse at the same time. Worse because duh, characters we learned to love no longer were; and better... because well, doesn't that prove how brave an author Rowling is? She doesn't go the safe, sugar-coated way. She goes in the painful and realistic one, even though this was not supposed to be a book for adults.<br><br>This book is not my favourite in the series (that place goes for both <i>The Goblet of Fire</i> and <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i>), but it's still brilliant. The plot gets more complex than before, it's more action-packed and intense, and all the loose strings in the series finally get attached, that is to say, the missing explanations are given and the last twists delivered, some of which include this:<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454950589ra/18033816.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Oh, Snape. A complex character, that one was. I never hated him. I admit sometimes I loathed him when he was unfair towards his students, but it was passing anger and I got over it; besides, he was a damn genius in Potion-making and magic in general. Now after reading book 7, I realised I actually feel kind of bad for him. All the life he didn't have... and all because he wallowed in his past.<br><br>I'm eternally grateful for my decision of rereading this series. During it, I infected my brothers with HP <s>obsession</s> love, and I finally became one of those people who see the world of HP as real as our <s>Muggle</s> world, because as Albus Dumbledore said,<br><br><blockquote>Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?</blockquote><br><br>It'd be a lie if I say I'll never get over this series - I've gotten over worse things (i.e. <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/7171771-the-monstrumologist">The Monstrumologist</a>) - but nonetheless I'll never forget about this journey, and of course, I'll always keep it in my heart, no matter how cheesy and unlike me that sounds.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1454950589i/18033817._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="9074410464595081375" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review858762188">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link858762188" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=858762188&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_858762188'><a id="like_count_review_858762188" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/858762188?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">40 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_858762188" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_858762188" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=40&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=858762188&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_858762188" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 858762188, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">6 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/858762188?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_858762188' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/858762188/comments?reverse=true">View all 6 comments</a><span class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 858762188, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_7711007" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/7711007" />    <a title="Lore" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/544043-lore"><img alt="Lore" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_5f-6a03a5c12233c941481992b82eea8d23.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/7711007?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2007</a>      <a title="Lore" class="user" name="Lore" href="/user/show/544043-lore">Lore</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">no one</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/544043-lore?shelf=harrypotter">harrypotter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer7711007" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13130364292059205620"><i>Deathly Hallows</i> is in fierce competition with <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> as the worst book of the series. It is an extremely bloated book in which nothing much happens for chapters upon chapters because Rowling is dragging the storyline out -- so it can end at the end of the school year, like all the other books. Many plotlines of previous books are barely touched upon (S.P.E.W.) or "resolved" in an entirely dissatisfactory manner (Grawp, though I wasn't unhappy about not seeing more of him). <br /><br />Characters</span>  <span id="freeText13130364292059205620" style="display:none"><i>Deathly Hallows</i> is in fierce competition with <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> as the worst book of the series. It is an extremely bloated book in which nothing much happens for chapters upon chapters because Rowling is dragging the storyline out -- so it can end at the end of the school year, like all the other books. Many plotlines of previous books are barely touched upon (S.P.E.W.) or "resolved" in an entirely dissatisfactory manner (Grawp, though I wasn't unhappy about not seeing more of him). <br /><br />Characters who were hyped in interviews but turned out to be of little importance include Ginny Weasley, who winds up doing absolutely nothing of relevance throughout the whole book, whereas she was annoyingly and tediously present (and acting like a complete jerk) in <i>Half-Blood Prince</i>. Despite my dislike of this character, I had expected to see much more of her, and I was disappointed to see her true purpose was bearing Harry Potter's childrens in one of the, if not <i>the</i>, least believable "romances" of the series.<br /><br />The book, and the series, then end with a cloying epilogue which tells us little about things that actually matter and instead focuses on who marries who, complete with precocious children (who are naturally of similar ages; so considerate of everyone to get pregnant at the same time!) and insipid names (Albus Severus, but no child named after Ginny's dead brother?). I like to pretend this epilogue, or "crapilogue" as disappointed fans have dubbed it, doesn't exist, and that the series officially ends after Harry kills Voldemort. Leaves much more to the imagination and is much more of a fitting end.<br /><br />My expectations prior to the release were faily high. That turned out to be a mistake. I won't be rereading this installment any time soon, possibly not ever again.</span>  <a data-text-id="13130364292059205620" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review7711007">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link7711007" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=7711007&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_7711007'><a id="like_count_review_7711007" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/7711007?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">40 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_7711007" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_7711007" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=40&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=7711007&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_7711007" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 7711007, true, &#39;&#39;); </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div       <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19673751-elena?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer654334593" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10147583127301057096">*Take a deep breath, Elena, take a deep breath!*<br /><br />I think I might be rewatching the movies and then rereading the books again and then rewatching the movies and so on for the rest of my life. Seriously I can't deal with having to let these characters and this amazingly epic story go. I just can't.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review654334593">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link654334593" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=654334593&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_654334593'><a id="like_count_review_654334593" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/654334593?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">40 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_654334593" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_654334593" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=40&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=654334593&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_654334593" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 654334593, true, &#39;&#39;);
