id='comments_for_review_404582564' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/404582564/comments?reverse=true">View all 24 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_150406532" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Khadija" href="/user/show/30466886-khadija"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1409780081p1/30466886.jpg" alt="30466886" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/30466886-khadija">Khadija</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer2470063099904815307">I actually agree with you wholeheartedly. I'm an avid HP fan but the last book just didn't seem "it". Like you've mentioned, she has played it</span>  <span id="freeText2470063099904815307" style="display:none">I actually agree with you wholeheartedly. I'm an avid HP fan but the last book just didn't seem "it". Like you've mentioned, she has played it extremely safe. At the start, the book did follow simplicity in its writing and it never complicated its way through while giving great suspense. <br /><br />The plot was building up nicely too and it was all imaginative but.... The biggest issue for me is character development- especially when it comes to their chemistries with other characters (minor ones). Harry had a little developing going on alongside Hermoine but Ron? I felt he was falling short after book 2.. It seems all his intelligence was drained out of him slowly. His twin brothers seemed more developed than he did.<br />The romance? Don't get me started, I don't know how JKR made the characters fall for one another (although she did build up their "relationship" from the encounter but they never reverberated in my head) for example, Luna and Harry work WAY better than Harry and Ginny.. Heck even Hermoime does. But I never understood the bland so-called love between Ron and Hermoine due to the reasons you have listed above. <br />Even the deaths felt real rushed as you said, not enough mention or a decent dedicated page to their worth; it's like JK was given a page limit and she did not use it wisely whilst trying to stuff everything as much as possible from all aspects.. And it did not work very well.. Feels like a movie adaption from a proper book (if that makes sense). <br /><br />The final showdown? I expected more. I'll review this book better once I reread it again but I also remember not being entirely satisfied with this last installment.. I wish she wrote freely like she has started but ever since book 4 it started to drop (especially book 5 being it the biggest filler with slow pace yet justifying the plot.. Book 6 picked up the pace again but 7 was just... Especially the epilogue.. WHY)<br /><br />Thank you</span>  <a data-text-id="2470063099904815307" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Apr 16, 2016 12:28AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_150433458" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Jocelyn " href="/user/show/11898426-jocelyn"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445810458p1/11898426.jpg" alt="11898426" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/11898426-jocelyn">Jocelyn </a>      <span id="freeTextContainer6888872567815697818">Very interesting thoughts. The elements of a story worth geeking out over are definitely there.</span>  <a data-text-id="6888872567815697818" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Apr 16, 2016 05:41PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_158806142" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/158806142" />    <a title="John Egbert" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5223517-john-egbert"><img alt="John Egbert" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1340483284p2/5223517.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/158806142?book_show_action=false">May 09, 2011</a>      <a title="John Egbert" class="user" name="John Egbert" href="/user/show/5223517-john-egbert">John Egbert</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Harry Potter fans.</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to John by: </span>      My mind.  </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer158806142" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11813095287177929708">I wasn't happy with my previous review, and decided to re-write it.<br /><br />I will round all of my dislikings of this book to three things;<br /><br />1. The Plotholes<br /><br />Oh, JK Rowling. You and your plotholes. Firstly, we have the issue brought up many times by others -- the time turner. I assume Minerva McGonagall had more of those, since she was able to just give Hermione one. Wouldn't they come in handy when everyone was dying? Why not turn back the clock and warn someone about what was going to happen? After all, a</span>  <span id="freeText11813095287177929708" style="display:none">I wasn't happy with my previous review, and decided to re-write it.<br /><br />I will round all of my dislikings of this book to three things;<br /><br />1. The Plotholes<br /><br />Oh, JK Rowling. You and your plotholes. Firstly, we have the issue brought up many times by others -- the time turner. I assume Minerva McGonagall had more of those, since she was able to just give Hermione one. Wouldn't they come in handy when everyone was dying? Why not turn back the clock and warn someone about what was going to happen? After all, as shown in the fourth book time is not set in the Harry Potter world.<br /><br />Secondly, we have the confusion of the ending. How did Harry come back to life? Can someone explain this to me? I thought his mother's love broke when he turned seventeen. How did Voldemort die, but he lived? Why can't Volemort kill a seventeen year old boy with seemingly infinite magical knowledge? The first four books it was cute how Harry kept escaping, but then it started to get confusing. Is there another magic at work here, besides Dumbldedores love? Can we make this more clear? Sigh. <br /><br />Believe me, love is cool and all, but love won't solve all your problems. What about hard work and perseverance? We have a little of that, but not as much as there should be. Love is the answer to everything, I guess, but there comes a time when you need to be practical. That time is when people are <i>dying</i> and you know, you're seventeen and not eleven and you're a chosen one and hey, things are starting to get serious.<br /><br />2. Hermione Granger's Lonely Hearts Club<br /><br />I really wanted to use that. Moving on,<br /><br />I admit, I ship her with Harry. However, that is not why I'm miffed at her ending up with Ron. From book one, Ronald Weasly has belittled her, underestimated her, called her stupid, annoying, hinted that she was ugly, ignored her, yet begged her to do his homework, and promptly not proved that he deserved her affections at all.<br /><br />And yet, we have book seven, they're supposed to be in love?<br /><br />?<br /><br />?<br /><br /><i>?</i><br /><br />Now, I'm not going to pretend like she hasn't been mean to him too, but let's face it -- Hermione was never a jerk towards Ron without reason. He usually always did something to provoke her first, like call her a know it all, ask her to the Yule ball at the last moment, say that she has no friends, imitate her, act as if he was above her and generally be a prat with the "emotional range of a teaspoon" as she so fittingly states.<br /><br />We are not given any reason as to why she should be in love with Ron. We are just told that she is. That bugs me.<br /><br />3. Why Do Donuts Have To Die<br /><br />Maybe that last title was a bit random. By donuts, I mean excessive amounts of minor characters.<br /><br />I know it isn't meant to be this way, but to me as the reader, it seems that JK Rowling killed off a lot of minor characters to sub for one major character. Since I didn't like <i>any</i> of the minor characters she killed off, I guess it seemed gratuitous to me. I mean, I just didn't care that much. Granted, there are casualties in war, but it seemed like she was showing this off at the end to seem badass. It didn't work. It was just annoying.<br /><br />BONUS TIME!<br /><br />4. Some Scars Can't Be Seen<br /><br />Where's the emotional scarring? Everybody ends up happily married at the end, as if a horrible war hadn't taken place but twenty years earlier. They were <i>tortured</i> for the love of god -- some of them were even locked in a dark cellar for weeks on end! Tell me that isn't scarring. Please do.<br /><br />In conclusion,<br /><br />I gave the book one star for a reason. Despite that, there are some things I did like about it;<br /><br />1. Snape!<br /><br />2. Dean, Luna, and Oliver.<br /><br />3. ...Snape?<br /><br />4. We got a lot of Harry/Hermione bonding scenes, even if they were ignored.<br /><br />I'm sure there were other things, but I can't remember them/am too lazy to go into them right now.<br /><br />Keep in mind, I like the Harry Potter series and think JK Rowling is a pretty decent author. But this book just didn't do it for me.</span>  <a data-text-id="11813095287177929708" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review158806142">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link158806142" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=158806142&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_158806142'><a id="like_count_review_158806142" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/158806142?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">32 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_158806142" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_158806142" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button BunnehU+2764" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7897213-andrea-ninja-bunneh"><img alt="Andrea U+2764Ninja BunnehU+2764" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477940392p2/7897213.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/801064991?book_show_action=false">Feb 28, 2014</a>      <a title="Andrea U+2764Ninja BunnehU+2764" class="user" name="Andrea U+2764Ninja BunnehU+2764" href="/user/show/7897213-andrea-ninja-bunneh">Andrea U+2764Ninja BunnehU+2764</a> say "the end", or something profound about the closing of my journey with Harry Potter. I'm not going to. You see, the joy of reading is that there never really is an ending. Not really. For a simple reason. You can always go back to the beginning, revisit people you miss, rediscover those that have been lost, perhaps experience something new you may have not noticed the first time around. Or the second, or the third. <br><br>There is always a chance for a new begin</span>  <span id="freeText17464134317258292981" style="display:none"><a say "the end", or something profound about the closing of my journey with Harry Potter. I'm not going to. You see, the joy of reading is that there never really is an ending. Not really. For a simple reason. You can always go back to the beginning, revisit people you miss, rediscover those that have been lost, perhaps experience something new you may have not noticed the first time around. Or the second, or the third. <br><br>There is always a chance for a new beginning. <b>  <i>Always.</i></b><br>I'll see you again one day soon, at Hogwarts.<br><br><a href="http://s1334.photobucket.com/user/BluAngel1/media/HP/hoggwarts_zpsbfb53e7f.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img Ninja-Bunnehs-Applauding</b></span>  <a data-text-id="17464134317258292981" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div id='like_container_review_801064991'><a id="like_count_review_801064991" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/801064991?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">32 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_801064991" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_801064991" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_801064991" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 801064991, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">11 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/801064991?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_801064991' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/801064991/comments?reverse=true">View all 11 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_801064991' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 801064991, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_478650477" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/478650477" />    <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder"><img alt="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476896265p2/3048260.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/478650477?book_show_action=false">Jun 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="user" name="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder">Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form">a-own-book-form</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=sad">sad</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=ghosts">ghosts</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=magic-powers">magic-powers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=part-of-series">part-of-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=witches">witches</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=monsters">monsters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=shapeshifters">shapeshifters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=s-king-recommends">s-king-recommends</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=4-star">4-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen">movie-seen</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=cover-love">cover-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=got-in-2016">got-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer478650477" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3316217996190888722"><br /><b>U+201CEvery second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air on his face, was so precious: To think that people had years and years, time to waste, so much time it dragged, and he was clinging to each second.U+201D </b><br /><br />I'm sure everyone knows what I mean when I say it's both a good and a bad thing that I've finished the series. Good because I've experienced it all, bad because it's now over.<br /><br />I knew the plot before going in because the last movie was the freshest in my mind, so I braced myself for the d</span>  <span id="freeText3316217996190888722" style="display:none"><br /><b>U+201CEvery second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air on his face, was so precious: To think that people had years and years, time to waste, so much time it dragged, and he was clinging to each second.U+201D </b><br /><br />I'm sure everyone knows what I mean when I say it's both a good and a bad thing that I've finished the series. Good because I've experienced it all, bad because it's now over.<br /><br />I knew the plot before going in because the last movie was the freshest in my mind, so I braced myself for the deaths that were coming, revelations that jumped out to reveal themselves, and the creative wrap-up. Rowling used her imagination at top form to show the hidden natures of some of the characters we previously viewed as villains, backstories of heroes, and twists in escaping death and losing for Harry Potter himself.<br /><br />Since it was the last book, it was the darkest as the battle reigned supreme for Hogwarts and Harry and his friends - they finally had to face that final fight, leaving no one unscathed. My favorite part was definitely at the school when the battle was waging. McGonagall remains a favorite, I wish we knew about her story afterward. Bellatrix versus Mrs Weasley was an epic time, Neville standing up for his friends, and of course the sad, sad deaths that happened to some series regulars.<br /><br />Truthfully some of the down parts were a little dull at times - Harry and Hermione and Ron wandering around had some interesting scenes though, such as the snake Nagiri in the Hollows scene being so creepy it was like something written out of a horror book. The scene where Harry finds the sword was awesome as well, but it just seemed like a little magic was missing when the gang was separated so long from the school and other characters. Those characters, classes, school, hiding from teachers...all of that was a strong binding substance for the story being as great as it was. <br /><br />It would be nice to know more in the epilogue about what happened to some surviving characters, such as the Weasley's besides Ron and Percy, Luna and her father, and a few others. Hopefully Harry kept Kreacher around as a personal house elf for life. <br /><br />The resolution was sweet since it showed the future and who the main characters got together with, as well as Harry giving an important tribute to two main characters in the naming of his son, but it did feel a little off for some reason, not sure why. It almost felt a little forced. It answers marriage and kids but what about careers and other stuff? <br /><br />I know some wanted Harry to end up with another girl in the series, but I'm happy with how it ended. Even J.K. Rowling herself now says she wish she had done that differently, but I think she made the right decision the first time.<br /><br />As evil as Voldemort was, he made a memorable villain. On the other side of the coin, Harry and his friends made intelligent and worthy heroes. I'll miss the school and the stories - everything from laughing and learning, to fighting and plotting. I'll miss the characters who were killed off, and wonder what happened to those left behind. I still think it would have been more interesting had a certain professor lived and played a part in the ending.<br /><br />Of course this series couldn't last forever, but it's good the author wrote seven lengthy books that are impossible to forget. Long live in the magic.<br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="3316217996190888722" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781551929767" href="/book/show/818056.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/167451-suzanne?shelf=british-obsessions">british-obsessions</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/167451-suzanne?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer2640245" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17161721033248548600"><i>U+201CIU+2019m going to keep going until I succeed U+2014 or die. DonU+2019t think I donU+2019t know how this might end. IU+2019ve known it for years.U+201D</i> U+2014 Harry Potter<br /><br />Most seventeen-year olds donU+2019t view the possibility of an early death as being, well, possible. But then again, most seventeen-year olds havenU+2019t come face-to-face with death almost half a dozen times before their first kiss either.<br /><br />In <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i>, the seventh and final installment of the ridiculously popular Harry Potter series, J.K. Rowl</span>  <span id="freeText17161721033248548600" style="display:none"><i>U+201CIU+2019m going to keep going until I succeed U+2014 or die. DonU+2019t think I donU+2019t know how this might end. IU+2019ve known it for years.U+201D</i> U+2014 Harry Potter<br /><br />Most seventeen-year olds donU+2019t view the possibility of an early death as being, well, possible. But then again, most seventeen-year olds havenU+2019t come face-to-face with death almost half a dozen times before their first kiss either.<br /><br />In <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i>, the seventh and final installment of the ridiculously popular Harry Potter series, J.K. Rowling brilliantly ties up every loose end that she has planted over the last ten years since the very first outing of the series was published in 1997. Truly, Rowling has learned exactly what her fans want and subsequently delivers a book that answers every PotterheadU+2019s questions U+2014 and then some. <br /><br />Not only does <i>Deathly Hallows</i> revisit key places and characters from all of the previous six books, but Rowling even manages to make clever references to previous bits of dialogue from her earlier books. Case in point: near the end of the first Potter book, after Hermione fails to see the magical solution to saving the trio from a nasty patch of DevilU+2019s Snare, HarryU+2019s best mate Ron bellows U+201CHAVE YOU GONE MAD? ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT?U+201D Now, six years later, Hermione finally gets her revenge on her red-headed friend when Ron believes that all is lost until Hermione yells to him <i>U+201CAre you a wizard, or what?U+201D</i> thus reminding Ron to use his wand to solve their problem. Subtle references such as this are a large part of what makes RowlingU+2019s books so enjoyable to re-read as there are always deeper meanings and additional allusions that are often only discovered via multiple read-throughs.<br /><br />HarryU+2019s bold statement regarding his own potential death is also a prime example of how much Rowling truly wrote HarryU+2019s last tale for her long-time fans. This line seems to read as a secret U+201Cshout-outU+201D to the Potterites who have also known for years that the series might not end happily ever after. The prophecy in the fifth book revealed that U+201Cneither shall live while the other survivesU+201D, and therefore by the end of book seven either Harry or Voldemort had to die. Rowling cleverly fills her last installment with so many twists, turns and complications, however, that it becomes practically impossible to determine which way this book is going to end. <br /><br />More than any of the other Potter books, <i>Deathly Hallows</i> is a true quest narrative, with the trio spending the majority of the story hunting for horcruxes and hallows whilst evading capture by VoldemortU+2019s Death Eaters. The multiple close-calls that all three main characters find themselves in throughout the book add to the tension that continues to build until the predictably bloody battle at the end of the tale. The book does, after all, chronicle a brutal war, so be prepared for a lot of killing and, consequently, a lot of tears. <br /><br />This is not to say that <i>Deathly Hallows</i> doesnU+2019t offer up a great deal of laughs as well. The hilarious twins Fred and George Weasley make several appearances to ensure that the book isnU+2019t all doom and gloom. By far, the funniest part of the story is the secret radio show <i>Potterwatch</i>, anonymously hosted by former Hogwarts Quidditch commentator Lee Jordan with special appearances from Fred, George, and ex-Defence Against the Dark Arts professor Remus Lupin. Rowling perfectly mixes this blend of humour, tragedy and adventure so that her epic-length novel never lags or drags.<br /><br />To write a 607 page book that millions of die-hard fans around the world are able to devour in less than 24 hours is no mean feat, but RowlingU+2019s farewell to the Boy Who Lived is an incredibly gripping page-turner that will leave all Potter lovers immensely satisfied.</span>  <a data-text-id="17161721033248548600" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review2640245">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link2640245" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=2640245&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2640245'><a id="like_count_review_2640245" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2640245?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">702 class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7819853259865325051">It's hard for me to believe that I finished the Harry Potter series... I wish this series would go on forever!<br />I don't know how I've gone through my life without these books. I regret not reading it when I was younger, but I am so happy that I finally did, better late than never, right?<br />The world built in these books is so real and tangible, it is truly a masterpiece. The characters are engaging and brilliant, and I love how the plot is so interwoven and twisted within itself, especially in this l</span>  <span id="freeText7819853259865325051" style="display:none">It's hard for me to believe that I finished the Harry Potter series... I wish this series would go on forever!<br />I don't know how I've gone through my life without these books. I regret not reading it when I was younger, but I am so happy that I finally did, better late than never, right?<br />The world built in these books is so real and tangible, it is truly a masterpiece. The characters are engaging and brilliant, and I love how the plot is so interwoven and twisted within itself, especially in this last book.<br />I was taken by surprise when I started the series, I didn't think it would pull me in as it did. As I kept reading through the books, the characters slyly stole my heart. Now, having finished the last line, I am flooded with emotion. This series is more than a story or words on a page, it is magic.</span>  <a data-text-id="7819853259865325051" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review973869855">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link973869855" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=973869855&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_973869855'><a id="like_count_review_973869855" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/973869855?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">473 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_973869855" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_973869855" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=473&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=973869855&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_973869855" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 973869855, true, &#39;&#39;); greyText">      Apr 22, 2016 12:25AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_973869855' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 973869855, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_17719129" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/17719129" />    <a title="Tara" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/992038-tara"><img alt="Tara" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1205488168p2/992038.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/17719129?book_show_action=false">Jun 03, 2008</a>      <a title="Tara" class="user" name="Tara" href="/user/show/992038-tara">Tara</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">desperate Harry Potter Fans</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/992038-tara?shelf=children-teenage">children-teenage</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/992038-tara?shelf=sci-fi-fantasy">sci-fi-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/992038-tara?shelf=loathed">loathed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer17719129&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer17719129" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11865805322016875970">Ok, before I start a few warnings. This will contain spoilers (though since I'm writing this a year after the release I don't think it's too much of a tragedy), it will be long and it will be negative because I <i>really</i> didn't like this book.<br /><br />Reading books one to five I was very impressed with the storytelling from a novice novellist. There was magic, there were characters you could love, and sure there were some cliche'd storylines, but they were interspersed with really interesting sidestories (P</span>  <span id="freeText11865805322016875970" style="display:none">Ok, before I start a few warnings. This will contain spoilers (though since I'm writing this a year after the release I don't think it's too much of a tragedy), it will be long and it will be negative because I <i>really</i> didn't like this book.<br /><br />Reading books one to five I was very impressed with the storytelling from a novice novellist. There was magic, there were characters you could love, and sure there were some cliche'd storylines, but they were interspersed with really interesting sidestories (Peeves, SPEW, Weasley's Wizard Wheezes). I was enthralled as a teenager and I am enthralled now as an adult when I re-read them.<br /><br />But I have to say the the quality dropped markedly in books six and seven. The ramblings (that started out cute in GoF and OotP) have become pronounced and boring. The characters have lost much of what made them endearing, and the plot has gone to hell.<br /><br />Focusing on Deathly Hallows, I had a very strong feeling that six months before her deadline, JKR went on to the internet, discovered that everyone had guessed her 'twists' (honestly, who didn't know that Harry was an accidental Horcrux, RAB was Sirius's brother, the diadem was at Hogwarts, the locket was at Grimmauld Place, Dumbledore ordered Snape to kill him, Snape was in love with Lily and Ron would be a it and abandon Harry and Hermione?), and felt the need to come up with a new plot device. This would explain the incredible stupidity that is the deathly hallows and the plot holes and gaps in logic that involve them.<br /><br />Now, it has been a while since I read it so some of my names and such might be wrong, and if it does answer the questions in the book in such a round about way I apologise, but the Elder Wand does not make sense. I'm willing to accept that it follows it's own set of rules separate from those of other wands (where Haary can use Hermione's wand almost as well as his own and all of the disarming they did in book five didn't make their wands all change ownerships) but the course of events whereby Harry became the owner of the wand are just plain silly. If Grindelwald simply stole the wand from Gregorovich (sp?), how did that make him the wands owner? If the wand is unbeatable, how did Dumbledore defeat Grindelwald (I know Rita Skeeter theorised that Grindelwald surrended, but how does that pass the wand's ownership to Dumbledore. Surrender is not the same as defeat). And if the wand is unbeatable, why was Dumbledore unable to defeat Voldemort when they dueled on OotP? And also, is Harry really so conceited and stupid to think that no one would ever defeat or disarm him, making them the owner of the wand? Shouldn't he have broken it? If he does become an auror in later life someone is bound to disarm him eventually, and if they knew about the wand, they could easily steal it back from Dumbledore's tomb.<br /><br />The other major thing that ticked me off was the characterisation. Hermione, Harry and Ron have always been some of my favourite characters, but here they are acting completely different from previous books. Harry using Unforgivable curses without a hint of remorse, and not comforting Hermione when Ron takes off, instead staring at a 'Ginny-dot'. Can we say creepy and stalkerish? <br /><br />And Hermione, who for the most part was still loyal and brave and smart (loved the bottomless bag bit, and her being there for Harry at Godric's Hollow), was so pathetic when it came to Ron. I know love makes people do the wacky, but crying for days on end when they're supposed to be searching for Horcruxes, kissing him in the middle of the war because he finally showed a tiny inkling of care towards the house-elves. <br /><br />And Ron. Gah! I mean, I love Ron, but you would have thought he could have grown up a little, just a smidgen. But no, running away because of the locket (one ring to rule them all...). Those who defend him saying it affected him more than Harry or Hermione because he had more insecurities is just dumb. Harry and Hermione had just as much to be insecure about. Harry, with his saving-people-thing, could easily have gone nuts with the locket around his neck and ran away from the others because he was terrified that they'd get killed. And Hermione has always been insecure, about being Muggle-born, about proving herself, about Ron and Harry and their friendships. Sure, he wanted to come back the moment he left, but he still left. Which I could accept were it not for such a stupid reason. And then he got his 'super-moment' which was so lame. Honestly, 'Ron can remember and copy paseltongue', uhuh. Wouldn't it have made much more sense to say, have Ginny come along, who could possibly still say the word from when she opened it under Tom's control in CoS. And then Ron mentioned the house-elves, to make himself 'worthy' (JKR's words, not mine) of Hermione. For one thing, why does he need to make himself 'worthy' since she already loved him for all his insensitivity and insecurity, and why did that 'worthiness' have to be something that Harry already had in abounds?<br /><br />Yes, I am a H/Hr shipper, but that is by no means the reason I hated this book (as you can see from above). If H/Hr had been handled as badly as R/Hr or H/G, I would have hated it. But the fact remains that the most romantic scenes in this book were between Harry and Hermione. At Grimmauld Place when Harry showed Hermione the picture, at the wedding where Hermione beamed at Harry, at Godric's Hollow where they strolled arm in arm under the kissing gate in the snow. While in canon, Harry married Ginny and Ron married Hermione, that will never convince me that they are the better couples. Harry and Hermione had the friendship, the trust, the alchemy. They were the most developed relationship in the series, and the fact that they didn't end up together in the book doesn't change that.<br /><br />The final things I feel like picking on - the epilogue came across as being written by a teenage fangirl. No depth, no meaning, just stupid-named kids. I get that JKR wanted Harry to end the book with the normal family life he never had, it could have been handled so much better. And seriously, Albus Severus? That poor kid must have been teased horribly. And why Severus? Sure, he turned out to be not evil, but for Harry to chance his mind about the man after seven years of abuse and ill treatment just because he was scamming on Lily. It's just gross. And unrealistic. I was so hoping there was more to Snape's story than twenty years of unrequited love. Gah. It may have been a sweet way for him to become not evil, but Lily was very, very dead for a very long time, and no one holds on that hard to love. If caring for her wasn't enough for him to stray away from the dark arts while she was alive, why was it enough when she was dead?<br /><br />Also, the invisibility cloak was supposed to be infallible, and yet Moody saw through it in OotP and Dementor's could see through it in PoA, supposedly. And, my god did the death scene's suck in this book. Yes, its a war so plenty of people, including main characters were going to die, but when I felt worse about Dobby than I did about Remus (who is one of my favourite characters) you just know that the author hasn't put enough emotion into it. He was the last of the Marauders, for god's sake, he deserved an on-page death at the very least. Maybe defending Harry or Tonks. Something!<br /><br />Well, there ends the rant. There were a few good points in the novel (like Godric's Hollow, before the stupidity of Harry not realising that Bathilda was Nagini, and the awesomeness of Neville) but they were few and far between and do not at all make up for the rest of the drivel.<br /><br />Read it because it is the conclusion to a series that took seventeen years to write, but do not expect the fireworks that such a finale could have been. There's better fanfics out there.</span>  <a data-text-id="11865805322016875970" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review17719129">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link17719129" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=17719129&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_17719129'><a id="like_count_review_17719129" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/17719129?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">344 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_17719129" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_17719129" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=344&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=17719129&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_17719129" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 17719129, true, &#39;&#39;); class="section">      <div id="review_126591021" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/126591021" />    <a title="Jason" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4426615-jason"><img alt="Jason" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1403411965p2/4426615.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/126591021?book_show_action=false">Jun 22, 2012</a>      <a title="Jason" class="user" name="Jason" href="/user/show/4426615-jason">Jason</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4426615-jason?shelf=thrill-me-chill-me-fulfill-me">thrill-me-chill-me-fulfill-me</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4426615-jason?shelf=dead-tree-edition">dead-tree-edition</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4426615-jason?shelf=for-kindle">for-kindle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4426615-jason?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4426615-jason?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer126591021" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14369698752868368818">This is just a pithy review on the <i>Harry Potter</i> series as a whole. It is not an in-depth analysis of the work in general, nor is it a review on any one particular installment.<br /><br /><i>Harry Potter</i> is a work of art. I got made fun of once when I was out to dinner with some friends, because while we were discussing these books I made the mistake of referring to them as U+201Cliterature.U+201D I felt like I had to defend that assertion because, although the definition of literature is pretty broad, it seems like it s</span>  <span id="freeText14369698752868368818" style="display:none">This is just a pithy review on the <i>Harry Potter</i> series as a whole. It is not an in-depth analysis of the work in general, nor is it a review on any one particular installment.<br /><br /><i>Harry Potter</i> is a work of art. I got made fun of onceU+00B9 when I was out to dinner with some friends, because while we were discussing these books I made the mistake of referring to them as U+201Cliterature.U+201D I felt like I had to defend that assertion because, although the definition of literature is pretty broad, it seems like it should really only apply to works with some definable qualitative value or literary merit. In this case, my friends were wrongU+2014Rowling explores themes and concepts in this series that I think are valuable to children and young adults who look to her characters for qualities they seek to emulate, and I believe her works will have lasting impact on this and future generations.<br /><br />IU+2019ve heard it said before that everything you need to know youU+2019ve learned in kindergarten. Well, that might be somewhat of an oversimplification, but I do think children or young adults who grow into this series, seeing Harry and his friends mature as they themselves mature, can glean some pretty important life lessons from it. They are impressionable human beings who are learning about themselves and are starting to make the choices that reflect the kinds of people they want to be.<br /><br />So what does <i>Harry Potter</i> teach them? Well, here is a bullet list of what it has taught <i>me</i>. And if youU+2019re good, IU+2019ll think about turning this into a PowerPoint presentation. Or maybe not.<br /><blockquote>U+2022 The quality of your character is not a reflection of where you come from or who your parents are; rather, it is a reflection of the choices you make, so make them wisely.<br /><br />U+2022 The way you treat other people, especially those less fortunate than you, reveals your true colors more quickly and more completely than almost anything else you do.<br /><br />U+2022 It is a good thing to have dreams and ambitions, but that alone is not enough. You cannot expect success without effort.<br /><br />U+2022 It is far less important what your abilities are than what you actually do with them. Your abilities alone do not define you.<br /><br />U+2022 Nobody likes to fail, but to refuse an attempt at success on the grounds that youU+2019re afraid to fail is failure in itself.<br /></blockquote>Growing up is about figuring out who you are and coming to terms with your strengths and weaknesses, and it is about deciding how to utilize the strengths and mitigate the weaknesses in order to become a better person. ItU+2019s a lifelong struggle, but it starts early, and I think <i>Harry Potter</i> offers the tools to help achieve that. It can help young people find their way, and maybe <i>thatU+2019s</i> an oversimplification for a seven-volume series of novels, but thatU+2019s what I got out of it, and thatU+2019s why I will recommend this to my kids as they start to become ready for some life lessons of their own.<br /><br />U+00B9This is misleading; IU+2019ve been made fun of countless, <i>countless</i> times.</span>  <a data-text-id="14369698752868368818" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review126591021">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link126591021" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=126591021&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_126591021'><a id="like_count_review_126591021" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/126591021?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">248 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_126591021" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_126591021" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=248&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=126591021&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_126591021" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 126591021, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">49 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/126591021?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_126591021' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/126591021/comments?reverse=true">View all 49 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_89703482" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Janaki" href="/user/show/27171057-janaki"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_25x33-d79c46f9428d2aea1444d67c091766a6.png" alt="F 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/27171057-janaki">Janaki</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer15825524394481472036">I have been laughed for the same reason. But I totally agree with you. Harry Potter is one of the greatest literary works of the century.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jan 01, 2014 06:13AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_92190121" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Colin Foster" href="/user/show/28407756-colin-foster"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/28407756-colin-foster">Colin Foster</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer16892951933795557635">The best of the best = the worst of the best. was about to leave the house for the last time. Long ago, when he had been left alone while the Dursleys went out to enjoy themselves, <br>the hours of solitude had been a rare treat: Pausing only to sneak <br>something tasty from the fridge, he had rushed upstairs to play on DudleyU+2019s computer, or put on the television and flicked through the <br>channels to his heartU+2019s content. comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_443102262" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/443102262" />    <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey"><img alt="Mohammed Arabey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364338486p2/13592557.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/443102262?book_show_action=false">Feb 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="user" name="Mohammed Arabey" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey">Mohammed Arabey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer443102262" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1047202433685929355">First of all, It's awesome finding out that this book is Dedicated specially to you by the Queen herself -for me Joanna Rowling is the English Queen for Magic, just as there's a Queen for muggles- & it's Really yours personally..<br><b>If you Stuck With Harry Until The Very End.</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380395691i/762126.jpg" width="367" height="306" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I've been stuck with Harry myself for 10 years now..when I first read the Arabic edition of the 1st book on Sep.2003.. I felt how it's different than the movie,The characters more alive ,forcing you to feel that they're your</span>  <span id="freeText1047202433685929355" style="display:none">First of all, It's awesome finding out that this book is Dedicated specially to you by the Queen herself -for me Joanna Rowling is the English Queen for Magic, just as there's a Queen for muggles- & it's Really yours personally..<br><b>If you Stuck With Harry Until The Very End.</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380395691i/762126.jpg" width="367" height="306" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I've been stuck with Harry myself for 10 years now..when I first read the Arabic edition of the 1st book on Sep.2003.. I felt how it's different than the movie,The characters more alive ,forcing you to feel that they're your friends, like you're already living with them in the School of Witchcraft and Wizardry,it was like my other Home<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380395691i/762127._SX540_.jpg" width="383" height="155" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I finished the series in Arabic and start it in English 2 years ago,It was still fresh and as thrilling, emotional ,great as ever.<br><b><br>Here I'll try to stick to review that part of the series only ,till I write more about the experince of living The Harry Potter Saga<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1367230001p8/750337.jpg" width="380" height="300" alt="My Harry Potter Treasure" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>The Plot<br>********</b><br>Remember before book 7 release how were we been feeling?<br>**Harry still got 4 Horcruxes to find -and even to know what it'll be- and even how to destroy it.<br>**And then Fight the 7th Part of the shuttered soul...Voldemort himself, his Death Eaters and the traitor Snape. <br>**How he can do all that without Dumbledore , Black and all of those he can't tell about his quest as Dumbledore ask him to not tell but to Ron and Hermione.<br><br>We all thought it will be difficult to fit it all in one last volume ,and to wrap up characters and events.<br> But the amazing plot of that book didn't only fit for that all. and also add a new element "The Deathly Hallows" and fit it perfectly into the full story.. <br><b><br>I can't believe how that book fit everything we're all been asking about since the very early beginning ,and some of the facts that anyone wondered about like How the trace dedicate the underage magic, Why we can't just create food from thin air, or why there was a Taboo on saying "Voldemort"'s name..and so more.<br>It dive deeply into the past of important characters we thought we know enough , Dumbledore and Snape.<br><br>From the beginning you see a wrapping up for the characters,the places -like Private Drive- and the events.. you'll see a lines that connected to the very early of the series and book one..you'll be in a journey toward the ending without feeling disconnected from the whole previous events and characters.<br><br>There's no something you'll feel-if u pay enough attention - out of place ,out of the plot or out of the characters .<br><br>The Characters <br>**************<br>Was so glad that J.K.Rowling announce that there's no "new" character presented in the last books which was perfect since it's the end of the series and it's better to focus on our beloved characters and the ones we lived wit them for years.<br><br>The characters deals here with the "real responsibilities" that comes with the coming of age. <br>or the quest they asked for and they have to do for their good and greater good<br><br>There were no any "Exaggeration" or over acting, the characters go normally ,naturally and very real, The writer chose to describe even the smallest feelings they feel in some important situations like for example Harry's final visit to the Dark Forest, or the boredom of the days on the run from place to place.<br><br>And won't forget the wrapping up of Every character sometimes with surprises which is never out of character.<br>She was always have it all planned and well drawn <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1379786756i/487239.jpg" width="384" height="259" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The Message <br>***********<br>I have to admit at my second reading I find an extraordinary spiritual amazing message<br>It starts with the 2 quotations one is pagan, and one is from a Christian tradition.. one about the Death and one about Friends..<br>and it fit perfectly to the theme of the book,and the message of Love that can beat any other force.<br><br>I saw also a symbol in the Dumbledore's character and the whole Harry -Dumbledore's relation, complicated symbol of Faith, religion and religious people. in many ways that you have to look carefully to dedicate it.<br></b><br>U+0650 U+0650And look at the final fight between Harry and Voldemort ..I was like..My God you're the best writer EVER<br><blockquote><b>U+201CYouU+2019re right. But before you try to kill <br>me, IU+2019d advise you to think about what youU+2019ve done. . . . Think, and <br>try for some remorse, Riddle. . . .U+201D </b><br>U+201CWhat is this?U+201D <br>Of all the things that Harry had said to him, beyond any revelation or taunt, nothing had shocked Voldemort like this. Harry <br>saw his pupils contract to thin slits, saw the skin around his eyes <br>whiten. <b><br>U+201CItU+2019s your one last chance,U+201D said Harry, U+201CitU+2019s all youU+2019ve got left. . . . <br>IU+2019ve seen what youU+2019ll be otherwise. . . . Be a man . . . try . . . Try for <br>some remorse. . . .U+201D</b> </blockquote><br> It's not just normal fight between Good and Evil , It's amazing written novel.<br><br>Can't seriously describe all of what I want to say about this series Just one thing I can admit,<br>It's my wonderful journey, It's my friends, It's the books that made me- trying to be- a better person. It's where I meet my friends.. It's where I truly Laugh while reading/living the story..It's where I cry with characters and feel sorry for some. <br>It's magic..It's real magic cause It's words of Love<br><br><br>So glad to finish it at 2nd May, And so strange I didn't feel I'm going to miss the Harry Potter books although I finished it before in Arabic, and that was the ending of my experience with it in English, But deep inside me is sure I'll go back to Hogwarts again ,re-reading from one to seven soon ISA.<br><br>Before I finish I have to share this great man's word..Who really was the best transforming a paper character to a real life <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380395691i/762128.jpg" width="388" height="266" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Thank you Joanna Rowling. <br><br>Mohammed Arabey<br>16 April 2013<br>2 May 2013 "Harry Potter International Day"**<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380395691i/762129.jpg" width="390" height="110" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>**On That Day 2nd May 1998 ,The Battle of Hogwarts and Lord Voldemort's downfall .<br>Happy 15th Anniversary..<br><br>14/01/16<b>R.I.P Alan Rickman..one of the greatest talented actors ever</b>,here's his last farewell for a character he made so real..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452791529i/17744224._SY540_.jpg" width="396" height="568" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Oh God, And that's even Sadder...:(<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453077176i/17778750._SX540_.jpg" width="399" height="319" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="1047202433685929355" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review443102262">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link443102262" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=443102262&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_443102262'><a id="like_count_review_443102262" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/443102262?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">159 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_443102262" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_443102262" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=159&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=443102262&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_443102262" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 443102262, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/577785715?book_show_action=false">Sep 29, 2015</a>      <a title="Darth J " class="user" name="Darth J " href="/user/show/18974711-darth-j">Darth J </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=witch-wizard">witch-wizard</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=longer-than-necessary">longer-than-necessary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=dragons">dragons</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer577785715" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13883813341753943257">(So I never did a review of this and am deciding to add one now.)<br><br>I'm a Millennial, and like most Millennials, I grew up with Harry Potter. Not <i>just</i> the books, but we kinda aged <i>with <b>him</b></i> (or thereabouts). It's a coming of age story for our whole generation, whether or not we received our Hogwarts letters.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1443549286i/16375602._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And we <i>were</i> there together. We were at <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/577785894?book_show_action=false">midnight release parties</a> and movie theaters, lined up and excited to share in the adventure. I can't think of the number of people who I've bonded with over</span>  <span id="freeText13883813341753943257" style="display:none">(So I never did a review of this and am deciding to add one now.)<br><br>I'm a Millennial, and like most Millennials, I grew up with Harry Potter. Not <i>just</i> the books, but we kinda aged <i>with <b>him</b></i> (or thereabouts). It's a coming of age story for our whole generation, whether or not we received our Hogwarts letters.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1443549286i/16375602._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And we <i>were</i> there together. We were at <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/577785894?book_show_action=false">midnight release parties</a> and movie theaters, lined up and excited to share in the adventure. I can't think of the number of people who I've bonded with over these stories--people who I wouldn't have thought to have much in common with in the first place. We came from all different backgrounds, much like the 4 houses, and joined in the Battle of Hogwarts.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443550150ra/16375803.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>We mourned the deaths of beloved characters.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443550413ra/16375830.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443549829ra/16375669.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1443550311i/16375819._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And cheered on the sheer wit and bravery of others.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443549953ra/16375757.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1390714086ra/8268948.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443550095ra/16375802.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>We debated what Harry should have done with the Elder Wand.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443550531ra/16375836.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>But we never let go of this world. We continue to relive these memories through fan fiction, arts and crafts, music, food and drink, and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AXP_Xb0oW84" rel="nofollow">theme parks</a>.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1443550764i/16375846._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br>Being that it came out nearly a decade ago, I think it holds up pretty well.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443549175ra/16375594.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="13883813341753943257" href="#"
