class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_829021598" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/829021598" />    <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury"><img alt="Cait (Paper Fury)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1356324709p2/11375137.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/829021598?book_show_action=false">Jan 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="user" name="Cait (Paper Fury)" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury">Cait (Paper Fury)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855713" href="/book/show/22844208-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=magical-fantasy">magical-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=5-star">5-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer829021598" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3727653211792547125">Wheeeeeere do I even start with this? WHERE. Every human and their bobcat has reviewed this book, but I'M GONNA ANYWAY BECAUSE MY THOUGHTS ARE IMPORTANT. (I am also a Slytherin, FYI.) I'm also really angry because I'm giving it 5-stars <i>because it's so freaking clever</i>. But I've got complaints. But HECK. Life is short. Eat dessert first. Give books 5-stars. But I feel emotionally manipulated by this sneaky paperback, DARN YOU HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS. MY LOVE FOR YOU IS COMPLICATED.<br /><br />Fir</span>  <span id="freeText3727653211792547125" style="display:none">Wheeeeeere do I even start with this? WHERE. Every human and their bobcat has reviewed this book, but I'M GONNA ANYWAY BECAUSE MY THOUGHTS ARE IMPORTANT. (I am also a Slytherin, FYI.) I'm also really angry because I'm giving it 5-stars <i>because it's so freaking clever</i>. But I've got complaints. But HECK. Life is short. Eat dessert first. Give books 5-stars. But I feel emotionally manipulated by this sneaky paperback, DARN YOU HARRY POTTER AND THE DEATHLY HALLOWS. MY LOVE FOR YOU IS COMPLICATED.<br /><br />First: <b>let's talk about why Cait is a Grumpy Gills:</b><br /><br />U+2022 The fact that the pacing is rubbish. Sorry?! But it kind of is. The beginning borderlines B.O.R.I.N.G. Not enough that I wasn't interested? But enough that I was annoyed. It felt like JK Rowling didn't know what to do with her characters if they didn't have Hogwarts classes to get to.<br /><br />U+2022 I'm annoyed that the Slytherins were still labelled at the end as "badies". C'mon. Honestly?! Especially in that epilogue when <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Ron <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> says "don't make friends with Slytherins, kids!" I mean. Rubbish and growls. <i>(I am a defensive Slytherin, FYI.)</i><br /><br />U+2022 And speaking of Slytherin's...I kind of thought Harry and Draco might've <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[made up or something?? Been tentative friends????? BUT NO??!?! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Apparently all the stuff I'd gleaned from the internet is wishful thinking. Heh.<br /><br />U+2022 There was VERY cliche Voldemort-must-monologue-before-his-kill scene.<br /><br />U+2022 To be realistic...Harry should've passed out from FOOD DEPRIVATION. Why is not one angry about this?!? The lad barely EVER ATE. I was hungry reading this blasted book. Someone give the kid a scone before he kills a thing.<br /><br />U+2022 I'm annoyed Luna and Neville didn't get more page time. REALLY annoyed.<br /><br />U+2022 I still don't ship the ships. In bk6 I was totally onboard with Harry and Ginny. But now? Meh. They like have no chemistry, sorry. And Hermione and Ron? LET. ME. LAUGH. No. Still...no. Though Ron did mature a lot in this book and I am proud. <br /><br /><br />...okay. My wrath is out. Now time for the FEEEEEEELS. Don't say I didn't warn you.<br /><br /><b>EVERYTHING I <i>FREAKING LOVED</i> AND THE REASONS THIS BOOK IS GETTING 5 FREAKING STARS OMG FEELELLELELELELS:</b><br /><br />U+2022 My darling baby <b>Neville Longbottom.</b> No joke. I HAD A DREAM ABOUT HIM LAST NIGHT. (I have not seen any movies, btw.) But my motorbike had broken down and he came and fixed it for me and it was adorable and my heart melted. I want a Neville Longbottom, please and thank you. MY CRUSH. <333 (Note: I do not own a motorbike. Nor would I want to. I would probably die on it, geesh, brain, where are you coming up with this stuff?)<br /><br />U+2022 <b>The plot is clever. </b>Okay seriously IT IS CLEVER. I loved how things tied in and tied up and I loved all the "reveals" and it was just <i>clever</i>.<br /><br />U+2022 And the world building is my favourite as always. I want to live a Hogwarts. BUT DOESN'T EVERYBODY?<br /><br />U+2022 <b>Professor MacGonagall.</b> Because she gives life. She is everything. All my love for Professor MacGonagall and her terrific dialogue lines, okay?<br /><blockquote>U+201COur Headmaster is taking a short break," said Professor McGonagall, pointing at the Snape-shaped hole in the window.</blockquote><br /><br />U+2022 I love Harry. I really do. Like at the end there, he was almost a little <i>too</i> perfect, which was boderline irritating? But he is a precious little piece of pumpkin juice and I LOVE how he makes mistakes and sometimes needs slapping with a broomstick, but at the end of the day he's just a GOOD KID. Likey.<br /><br />U+2022 Obviously Hermione. <3 And I'm glad Ron grew up a lot in this book, because gee that kid was 3 centimetres away from getting his nose punched by moi.<br /><br />U+2022 I hate hate hate hatttttte when the word "bitch" is used in a derogatory way towards women. But. There was this scene with Molly Weasley and Bellatrix LeStrange = and I liked it. YOU KNOW THE ONE, FOLKS.<br /><br />U+2022 Snape. Omg. <i>Snape.</i> I do agree that his a very complex character and I LIKE that. But I still hate him. Why? Because he could've done EVERYTHING just how he needed too -- sans bully children. I get why he hated Harry. I would've hated Harry if James had been like that (question: why the hell did Lily marry James?!??! Seriously?! HE SUCKED) but Neville?! Why did Snape pick on Neville so bad? He literally traumatised my darling baby and I shall not forgive him. <b>I do not "like" Snape but I like the complexity of his story.</b> And I kind of wish there as a book about Snape. His backstory seemed too rushed.<br /><br />U+2022 <b>THE DEATHS. <3</b> Okay that sounds marginally sadistic. But hear me out. I <i>hate</i> when big battle finales keep all the "favourites" alive. It's dumb and unrealistic. There need to be deaths, and I think HPatDH did it really well. I got all tied up in knots several times. SNIFFLES. <br /><br />U+2022 <b>I love Luna.</b> She is an amazing special creature and I wish she was in the books more.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Speaking of which...I have to admire how ALL the characters are just so epic.</b> I would seriously read spin-off series on anyone of them. THAT takes skill to write even secondary characters so the reader is invested.<br /><br />U+2022 I LIKED IT EVEN THOUGH IT KINDA MANGLED FEELS AND IT FRUSTRATED ME. But it surprised me! When I thought I'd seen all the spoilers of ever. <i>And</i> I was emotionally invested. Omg. I WAS.<br /><br />U+2022 (No tears though. I am a Vulcan.)<br /><br /><br />*** ABOUT THAT EPILOGUE ***<br />Okay but, spoilers about the finale below. <br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I am twitchy about the finale. I thought there'd be more. All we know is who married who and how many kids they had and what STUPID names they gave their children. And Harry's son James is basically Harry's father reincarnated. Does that not disturb anyone? *raises hand*<br /><br />But what did Harry and Ginny do? Like did they get a Killed Voldemort Pesnion and get to retire? Did Harry become an Auror? Why the HECK didn't he get to teach in school? I think he'd been an awesome Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher.<br />Did Lunar and Neville marry?<br />Or did Neville save himself for me?<br />What did George do, sans Fred? Like, could George exist without a Fred?<br />Why did Hermione settle so low when she married Ron?<br />What happened to Kreecher? I want to hug Kreecher. I also want him to bring me a sandwich too.<br />Did Professor MacGonagall stay in school to teach or did she scream when she saw Harry's children and say "I QUIT"?<br /><br />....I am kind of angry there are no answers to these. Let me huff. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><br /><b>Aaaaand...I'M DONE.</b> What else do I say? Yes. I loved it. YES. I love this series. I had a rocky start, and I thought it was dumb. But seriously? If I'd been reading this as a kid. I would been obsessed. OBSESSED. As is, I really want to own the books just for <i>the sake of it</i> because they're good and they're amazing and they deserve the world-wide cult fandom. It's a <b>satisfying and grand and perfectly wretched finale</b> and I should like to cheer enthusiastically.<br /><br />Omg, look at me. I'm a little HP fangirl. IT'S OVER FOR ME. I'VE REACHED THE POINT OF NO RETURN. <br /><br /><blockquote>U+201COf course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?U+201D<br /></blockquote><br /><br />(Also that quote means so much to me I cannot even.)<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="3727653211792547125" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review829021598">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link829021598" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=829021598&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_829021598'><a id="like_count_review_829021598" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/829021598?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">146 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_829021598" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_829021598" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=146&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=829021598&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_829021598" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 829021598, true, &#39;&#39;); U+0641 U+0636 U+0644 U+0634 U+062E U+0635 U+064A U+0647 U+0641 U+064A U+0627 U+0644 U+0631 U+0648 U+0627 U+064A U+0629 U+0639 U+0644 U+0649 U+0627 U+0644 U+0625 U+0637 U+0644 U+0627 U+0642 3></span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jan 16, 2016 03:53AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_282331080' class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1567205862" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1567205862" />    <a title="Aj the Ravenous Reader" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader"><img alt="Aj the Ravenous Reader" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453105148p2/30248594.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1567205862?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Aj the Ravenous Reader" class="user" name="Aj the Ravenous Reader" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader">Aj the Ravenous Reader</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Aj the Ravenous Reader by: </span>       <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/26279017-jia">Jia</a> and <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/31172066-kyra">Kyra</a>  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=extreme-tear-jerker">extreme-tear-jerker</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=lol">lol</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=love-love-love">love-love-love</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1567205862" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4220595741536401519"><i> <b>U+201CThe true master of death does not seek to run away from death. He accepts that he must die and understands that there are far worse things in the living world than dying.U+201D </b></i> -Albus Dumbledore<br /><br /><b> <i>To you, yes you, reader of this review</i> </b>, should you decide to read this review from beginning up to the very end, I offer you my deep thanks for your resilience, bravery and loyalty for this may be one of the longest reviews youU+2019ll ever read on Goodreads. You still have time to back out though, so donU+2019t te</span>  <span id="freeText4220595741536401519" style="display:none"><i> <b>U+201CThe true master of death does not seek to run away from death. He accepts that he must die and understands that there are far worse things in the living world than dying.U+201D </b></i> -Albus Dumbledore<br /><br /><b>  <i>To you, yes you, reader of this review</i></b>, should you decide to read this review from beginning up to the very end, I offer you my deep thanks for your resilience, bravery and loyalty for this may be one of the longest reviews youU+2019ll ever read on Goodreads. You still have time to back out though, so donU+2019t tell me you havenU+2019t been warned.^^<br /><br /><b>  <i>To <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a>, </i></b>there is no argument about your brilliance. You are a certified genius, a person with superhuman writing ability and imagination and I canU+2019t praise you enough for writing these books that have forever changed my life. But youU+2019re still human and surely youU+2019ve recognized your flaws. One of which is your penchant for killing your characters. You canU+2019t blame me for thinking that one of the reasons you created so many great and memorable characters is for you to be able to kill as many of them as you want to. I accept though with the heaviest heart that certain characters needed to die, needed to sacrifice their lives for the greater good but I find no good reason for the death of <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Fred! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. Why? Why kill him? HavenU+2019t you killed enough already? Why did he even have to die?! Why not Percy instead? (kidding). I honestly think no Weasley should have died for obvious reasons I donU+2019t think I still have to enumerate. Also, I honestly believe the last book lacks at least 200 more pages. Why jump to 19 years later epilogue right after the devastating war? DonU+2019t the rest of the other characters deserve a few pages about them? A simple tribute perhaps to all their sacrifice and pain and loss? I have gone so far, have read hundreds and hundreds of pages from book one only to be spared of better resolutions before an epilogue. Also, donU+2019t you think <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Professor Severus Snape <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> deserved a better, more respectful way to die? And whatever happened to <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Professor MoodyU+2019s <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>body? So you see, even though I admire you with 99.72 percent of my heart, .28 percent percent is resenting your choices. But thank you. Now my heart is tougher and braver. Characters in the next books I read could all die and I probably wouldnU+2019t shed a tear. I just wish I read your books before <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/18710190.Allegiant__Divergent___3_" title="Allegiant (Divergent, #3) by Veronica Roth">Allegiant</a> and <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/7260188.Mockingjay__The_Hunger_Games___3_" title="Mockingjay (The Hunger Games, #3) by Suzanne Collins">Mockingjay</a>. I probably would have considered those happy endings.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Harry Potter</i></b>, I will never forget your brave and pure heart. You showed me that heroes can be an average boy with no special superpowers except courage, trustworthy instincts and strength of will, oh and of course, a bunch of awesome wizards and witches supporting and protecting him the best way they can. <br /><br /><b>  <i>To Hermione Granger </i></b>, you are the most kick-ass heroine IU+2019ve ever met without needing to actually kick ass. You only needed your intellect, level headedness and kind heart and like Ron said, without you and your beaded bag, he and Harry would not have survived a day during your quest.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Ron Weasley</i></b>, you probably are the biggest idiot in the story but you showed the best of you in times you are needed the most. I admire your loyalty, sarcasm and free spirit and there is no better man for Hermione than you. <br /><br /><b>  <i>To Fred and George</i></b>, when in tears, I could always count on you guys for a good laugh. It's no fun without you. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[George, itU+2019s hard enough losing a part of your body but to have to lose your twin brother too. Oh Gaaaaawd! *wails*  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><b>  <i>To Hagrid (and Graupy) </i></b>, *hugs* IU+2019ll never forget your gallons of tears and rock cakes! Thank you for your loyalty, friendship and bravery. You will be remembered for generations. <br /><br /><b>  <i>To Professor Snape,</i></b>you are indeed the bravest of them all. Your sacrifice is utterly self-less and certainly the biggest of all. Your memories Harry and I saw in DumbledoreU+2019s Pensieve ripped my heart to pieces and I spent days and nights crying for you. You're a true hero and you deserve a monument. Maybe I'll name my son after you. *wails*<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Professor Dumbledore</i></b>, you are the true epitome of sacrifice, love and humility. You find something good in every person and you never fail to offer kindness even to those others deem undeserving.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To DumbledoreU+2019s Army led by Neville, Luna, Ginny,</i></b>, you guys are awesome!<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the Order of the Phoenix,</i></b> you were amazing especially you Mrs. Weasley! IU+2019m so sorry for your losses but thank you, thank you so much.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the Hogwarts Professors led by Prof. Mc Gonagall</i></b>, you did an amazing job holding off Voldy! You were all brilliant!<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the Malfoys,</i></b>uh I donU+2019t know. How about I just stick my tongue out at the lot of you!<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Dobby, </i></b> *wails* I canU+2019tU+2026just thank you so much. YouU+2019re the most loyal elf. The bravest free elf I know.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Kreacher,</i></b> you poor thing. I had no idea what you had to go through and what made you the way you are. In the end, thank you for your bravery and for leading the elves to the battle.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the Death Eaters and Snatchers led by Bellatrix and Greyback</i></b>, I have two words for<br />you. U+201CAVEDA KEDAVRA!U+201D<br /><br /><b>  <i>To Umbridge,</i></b> off to Azkaban, you go! <br /><br /><b>  <i>To Voldemort</i></b>, thatU+2019s right, I dare! I am completely with Harry, You donU+2019t learn from your mistakes, Riddle, do you?<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the rest of the fallen,</i></b> <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Professor Moody, Cedrick, Sirius, Remus, Tonks, James and Lily, Colleen Creevey and many others <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>, like Neville said, your death was not in vain. Thank you! *wails*<br /><br /><b>  <i>To the movie makers and actors</i></b>, thank you for bringing to life the characters we love. We will always look up to you people. Don't you dare disappoint us!^^<br /><br /><b>  <i>To my Goodreads friends who bullied me into reading Harry Potter,</i></b> thank you for destroying my life! I was doing perfectly fine without these books. You wrecked me pretty bad especially when I was reading the last book. I felt like hundreds of Dementors were surrounding me while reading it that I had to constantly cast a Patronus Charm while reading. It was really exhausting. My Patronus is a baby elephant, btw! Oh and I'm <b>House Gryffindor, hurray!</b> I'm afraid, I'm becoming worse than Luna Lovegood.<br /><br /><b>  <i>To <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/26279017-jia">Jia</a> and <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/31172066-kyra">Kyra</a></i></b>, HAPPY BIRTHDAY, my young, smart and beautiful friends <b>(March 06 is their actual birthday). You are both gifted for having such passion for reading at such young ages. Savor that gift and seize your most special day! <3</b></span>  <a data-text-id="4220595741536401519" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1567205862">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1567205862" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1567205862&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1567205862'><a id="like_count_review_1567205862" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1567205862?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">127 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1567205862" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1567205862" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=127&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1567205862&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1567205862" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1567205862, true, &#39;&#39;); itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3465278" />    <a title="Rion" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/217197-rion"><img alt="Rion" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1185315015p2/217197.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3465278?book_show_action=false">Aug 28, 2007</a>      <a title="Rion" class="user" name="Rion" href="/user/show/217197-rion">Rion</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Big nerds</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3465278" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10041901895627701501">***SPOILERS:<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />From an interview with Rowling on the Today show:<br /><a target="_blank" href="http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19" rel="nofollow">http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19</a>...<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />Rowling said her original epilogue was U+201Ca lot more detailed,U+201D including the name of every child born to the Weasley clan in the past 19 years. (Victoire, who was snogging Teddy U+2014 Lupin and TonksU+2019 son U+2014 is Bill and FleurU+2019s eldest.)<br /><br />Harry, Ron and Hermione<br />We know that Harry marries Ginny and has three kids, essentially, as Rowling explains, creating the family and the peace and calm he never had as a child</span>  <span id="freeText10041901895627701501" style="display:none">***SPOILERS:<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />From an interview with Rowling on the Today show:<br /><a target="_blank" href="http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19" rel="nofollow">http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19</a>...<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />Rowling said her original epilogue was U+201Ca lot more detailed,U+201D including the name of every child born to the Weasley clan in the past 19 years. (Victoire, who was snogging Teddy U+2014 Lupin and TonksU+2019 son U+2014 is Bill and FleurU+2019s eldest.)<br /><br />Harry, Ron and Hermione<br />We know that Harry marries Ginny and has three kids, essentially, as Rowling explains, creating the family and the peace and calm he never had as a child.<br /><br />As for his occupation, Harry, along with Ron, is working at the Auror Department at the Ministry of Magic. After all these years, Harry is now the department head.<br /><br />U+201CHarry and Ron utterly revolutionized the Auror Department,U+201D Rowling said. U+201CThey are now the experts. It doesnU+2019t matter how old they are or what else theyU+2019ve done.U+201D<br /><br />Meanwhile, Hermione, RonU+2019s wife, is U+201Cpretty high upU+201D in the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, despite laughing at the idea of becoming a lawyer in U+201CDeathly Hallows.U+201D<br /><br />U+201CI would imagine that her brainpower and her knowledge of how the Dark Arts operate would really give her a sound grounding,U+201D Rowling said.<br /><br />Harry, Ron and Hermione donU+2019t join the same Ministry of Magic they had been at odds with for years; they revolutionize it and the ministry evolves into a U+201Creally good place to be.U+201D<br /><br />U+201CThey made a new world,U+201D Rowling said.<br /><br />The wizarding naturalist<br />Luna Lovegood, the eccentric Ravenclaw who was fascinated with Crumple-Horned Snorkacks and Umgubular Slashkilters, continues to march to the beat of her own drum.<br /><br />U+201CI think that Luna is now traveling the world looking for various mad creatures,U+201D Rowling said. U+201CSheU+2019s a naturalist, whatever the wizarding equivalent of that is.U+201D<br /><br />Luna comes to see the truth about her father, eventually acknowledging there are some creatures that donU+2019t exist.<br /><br />U+201CBut I do think that sheU+2019s so open-minded and just an incredible person that she probably would be uncovering things that no oneU+2019s ever seen before,U+201D Rowling said.<br /><br />Luna and Neville Longbottom?<br />ItU+2019s possible Luna has also found love with another member of the D.A.<br /><br />When she was first asked about the possibility of Luna hooking up with Neville Longbottom several years ago, RowlingU+2019s response was U+201CDefinitely not.U+201D But as time passed and she watched her characters mature, Rowling started to U+201Cfeel a bit of a pullU+201D between the unlikely pair.<br /><br />Ultimately, Rowling left the question of their relationship open at the end of the book because doing otherwise U+201Cfelt too neat.U+201D<br /><br />Mr. and Mrs. Longbottom: U+201CThe damage is done.U+201D<br /><br />There is no chance, however, that NevilleU+2019s parents, who were tortured into madness by Bellatrix Lestrange, ever left St. MungoU+2019s Hospital for Magical Maladies.<br /><br />U+201CI know people really wanted some hope for that, and I can quite see why because, in a way, what happens to NevilleU+2019s parents is even worse than what happened to HarryU+2019s parents,U+201D Rowling said. U+201CThe damage that is done, in some cases with very dark magic, is done permanently.U+201D<br /><br />Rowling said Neville finds happiness in his grandmotherU+2019s acceptance of him as a gifted wizard and as the new herbology professor at Hogwarts.<br /><br />The fate of Hogwarts<br />Nineteen years after the Battle of Hogwarts, the school for witchcraft and wizardry is led by an entirely new headmaster (U+201CMcGonagall was really getting on a bitU+201D) as well as a new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher. That position is now as safe as the other teaching posts at Hogwarts, since VoldemortU+2019s death broke the jinx that kept a Defense Against the Dark Arts professor from remaining for more than a year.<br /><br />While Rowling didnU+2019t clarify whether Harry, Ron and Hermione ever return to school to finish their seventh year, she did say she could see Harry popping up every now and again to give the U+201Codd talkU+201D on Defense Against the D</span>  <a data-text-id="10041901895627701501" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review3465278">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link3465278" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=3465278&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_3465278'><a id="like_count_review_3465278" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/3465278?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">121 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3465278" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3465278" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=121&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=3465278&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_3465278" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 3465278, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">13 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/3465278?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_3465278' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/3465278/comments?reverse=true">View all 13 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_93007958" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Ninza" href="/user/show/22391141-ninza"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/22391141-ninza">Ninza</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11784996491367025003">This holds so much of useful information. Thank you, kind stranger. You have made the world a better place. :)</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Feb 18, 2014 02:10AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_108398128" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Dystopia28" href="/user/show/34184734-dystopia28"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1428082960p1/34184734.jpg" alt="34184734" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/34184734-dystopia28">Dystopia28</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer5412886741314362533">I absolutely love this review! Oct 26, 2014 05:14PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_3465278' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 3465278, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_3387780" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3387780" />    <a title="pinkgal" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7577-pinkgal"><img alt="pinkgal" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1232473322p2/7577.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/3387780?book_show_action=false">Jul 22, 2007</a>      <a title="pinkgal" class="user" name="pinkgal" href="/user/show/7577-pinkgal">pinkgal</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591061" href="/book/show/820344.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7577-pinkgal?shelf=magic_fairytale-esque">magic_fairytale-esque</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer3387780" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1445751454421723234">It was September 1998; the third Harry Potter book had just been released. Pottermania? What's that? It was still unknown except to a vast population of younglings who'd read it... and I fell in love. Oh, how I fell in love. I fell in love with the poor, starved-for-affection, later known to be a twit Harry. I fell in love with the pretentious know-it-all Hermione. I fell in love with the awkward, grew-up-in-his-brother's-shadows Ron... and most of all? I fell in love with the snarky,</span>  <span id="freeText1445751454421723234" style="display:none">It was September 1998; the third Harry Potter book had just been released. Pottermania? What's that? It was still unknown except to a vast population of younglings who'd read it... and I fell in love. Oh, how I fell in love. I fell in love with the poor, starved-for-affection, later known to be a twit Harry. I fell in love with the pretentious know-it-all Hermione. I fell in love with the awkward, grew-up-in-his-brother's-shadows Ron... and most of all? I fell in love with the snarky, unplatable, snarling, rude, hygienically-disinclined professor of potions, Severus Snape.<br><br>Almost ten years later, I'm still obsessed with it in many ways. <br><br>This is the Seventh Book. This is the end of Harry Potter. I cried, I wept, I laughed, sometimes quite hysterically. And overall? I loved it. I loved Ron's humour, Harry's angst, Hermione's smarts, Snape's devotion, Dumbledore's love, Percy's return, Dobby's sacrifice, the change of Kreacher, absolutely <i>everything</i>. I kept waiting and waiting to be disappointed and yes, I was disappointed on the occasion, but the thrill far outweighed the flaws. <br><br>As for Snape? One of the characters I fell absolutely in love with? <b>THIS IS A HUGE SPOILER</b>.<br><br>Snape...<br><br>...<br><br>...<br><br>...<br><br>...<br><br>...<br><br>Snape dies. He dies working for Dumbledore. He dies, looking into Harry's eyes. He dies because for the last thirty years of his life, he has loved Lily Evans and everything he has done and everything he sacrificed was for her. His death provoked a number of emotions in me and one of the major ones was utter, utter grief. He's been abused and used his whole life, whether by his parents, by his classmates, by Voldemort, by Dumbledore, and I felt such freaking <i>anger</i> that in the end, he wasn't even given the proper funeral that he <i>totally</i> deserved. In the book itself, it made sense, because whatever Snape did for the Greater Good, he was still a bastard. But as a reader, my heart broke into ittybitty pieces over him. <br><br>There were tons of other things going on at the same time. I say, Rowling is an excellent action scene writer. I'm terrible at writing action that's vivid and engaging, but she managed to do it. <br><br>Harry himself lives. But he's been forever scarred by his experience. And that, actually, is one of the best parts of his book. He was such an <i>arse</i> in books 5 and 6, and to have this mature young man emerge was one of the greatest joys in this series. I was so, so, so happy that he got the happiness he wanted. The ending was much WTF? for me, since it was like a SOOPER HAPPILY EVER AFTER ending, but at the same time... Harry is finally happy and that means a great deal to me. <br><br>Well. Harry, I've been a fan for almost ten years and in those ten years, you've made me laugh, cry, scream, whoop, run around, obsess, tender, hard, awesome and about a million other things. I've watched you grow from a scared, unsure first year into a hopeful young man in the third and fourth, an angsty teen in the fifth and sixth, and in the seventh? You came full circle and you were as your parents were. Happy, with children of your own. You changed so much and it felt like I had grown up partly with you, though I was but fourteen years old when I read you. <br><br>I love all of the characters, I love all the books, and well? <br><br>R.I.P. Severus Snape. You'll be missed. Same with you, Fred, Dobby, Lupin, Tonks, Moody, Colin, Scrimgoeur, Bellatrix, Peter, yes, even Voldemort. A lifetime has passed and HP is going to be one of those books that'll stay with me forever. <br><br>So... peace out, Harry! You deserve out!</span>  <a data-text-id="1445751454421723234" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review3387780">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link3387780" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=3387780&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_3387780'><a id="like_count_review_3387780" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/3387780?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">111 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_3387780" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_3387780" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=111&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=3387780&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_3387780" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 3387780, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1329644212" />    <a title="P " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25327841-p"><img alt="P " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469415764p2/25327841.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1329644212?book_show_action=false">Aug 06, 2016</a>      <a title="P " class="user" name="P " href="/user/show/25327841-p">P </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545583008" href="/book/show/17347379-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=favorites-2015">favorites-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1329644212" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18419281086265749576"><b> <blockquote>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D </blockquote> </b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1458917977i/18549445._SY540_.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows literally touched the deepest part of my heart. This book has many layers and each one was refined by the smartest author I've ever known. J.K. Rowling always has a plan, she never threw anything into her books without thinking it first. In this case, I think she planned the ending of this book since she started writing for sure, and every point she emphasized in HP</span>  <span id="freeText18419281086265749576" style="display:none"><b>  <blockquote>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D </blockquote></b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1458917977i/18549445._SY540_.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows literally touched the deepest part of my heart. This book has many layers and each one was refined by the smartest author I've ever known. J.K. Rowling always has a plan, she never threw anything into her books without thinking it first. In this case, I think she planned the ending of this book since she started writing for sure, and every point she emphasized in HP 7 was unfaltering and made me believe that it's a pure diamond when she ended her story with an epic score.<br><br><b>  <blockquote>U+201COf course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?U+201D </blockquote></b><br><br>Harry, Ron and Hermione prove themselves that they're just ordinary humans. They bicker. They argue each other. They make the sly plan. Importantly, they get to know how to forgive and forget, that's all that matters.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1458917977ra/18549446.gif" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>  <blockquote>U+201CWe're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.U+201D</blockquote></b><br><br>This book is EVERYTHING. It became much more than just a fiction for me. It had its voice and when it whispered in my ears, I literally believed that there was magic in this world. Each chapter made me strong and wanted to be someone better. Each character epitomized a different kind of person. This book doesn't deserve five stars review, it's beyond measure and a thousand stars are not even enough.<br><br><b>  <blockquote>Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.U+201D</blockquote></b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1458918520ra/18549542.gif" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>More at <a target="_blank" href="http://goo.gl/RWrdg3" rel="nofollow">http://goo.gl/RWrdg3</a></span>  <a data-text-id="18419281086265749576" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1329644212">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1329644212" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1329644212&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/36954539" />    <a title="Will Byrnes" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1526851-will-byrnes"><img alt="Will Byrnes" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1291462190p2/1526851.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/36954539?book_show_action=false">Jul 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Will Byrnes" class="user" name="Will Byrnes" href="/user/show/1526851-will-byrnes">Will Byrnes</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1526851-will-byrnes?shelf=all-time-favorites-fiction">all-time-favorites-fiction</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer36954539" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3654705995149555351">And so it comes to a close, this amazing series, with a battle royal. Which of our most loved and most loathed characters will survive? Which side will prevail? What secrets will be revealed in this final episode? The Harry Potter series is one of the triumphs not only of modern marketing but of contemporary literature. While the danger in any series exists that the joy of newness has rubbed off, Rowling keeps us interested by offering continued mystery, diversity, characters we can relate to</span>  <span id="freeText3654705995149555351" style="display:none">And so it comes to a close, this amazing series, with a battle royal. Which of our most loved and most loathed characters will survive? Which side will prevail? What secrets will be revealed in this final episode? The Harry Potter series is one of the triumphs not only of modern marketing but of contemporary literature. While the danger in any series exists that the joy of newness has rubbed off, Rowling keeps us interested by offering continued mystery, diversity, characters we can relate to and a palette of literary reference that gives resonance to her creation. You will cry at the end, but those tears may be because there will be no more Harry Potter books to read...well, for a while anyway. </span>  <a data-text-id="3654705995149555351" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review36954539">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link36954539" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=36954539&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_36954539" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_36954539" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_36954539" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 36954539, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">13 </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_2175622" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2175622" />    <a title="Sammy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/103544-sammy"><img alt="Sammy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1264098311p2/103544.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/2175622?book_show_action=false">May 01, 2008</a>      <a title="Sammy" class="user" name="Sammy" href="/user/show/103544-sammy">Sammy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/103544-sammy?shelf=a-the-best">a-the-best</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer2175622&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer2175622" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13963348707920142431">Was this book so awesome because it finally addressed all those long unanswered questions?  Yes.  Was this book just fantastic because we finally know what happens to everyone?  Yes.  Was this book wonderful because Rowling was ruthless and took no prisoners?  Yes.  Was this book splendid because we knew all the characters and cared about them like they were real?  Yes.  Was this book so great because it made you laugh, cry, gasp, emote out loud?  Yes.  That was one of my favorite things about</span>  <span id="freeText13963348707920142431" style="display:none">Was this book so awesome because it finally addressed all those long unanswered questions?  Yes.  Was this book just fantastic because we finally know what happens to everyone?  Yes.  Was this book wonderful because Rowling was ruthless and took no prisoners?  Yes.  Was this book splendid because we knew all the characters and cared about them like they were real?  Yes.  Was this book so great because it made you laugh, cry, gasp, emote out loud?  Yes.  That was one of my favorite things about the book.  Regardless of where I was, whether it be sitting on the couch next to my roommate, alone in my room, or standing in my shop, I found myself cheering and gasping and all other sorts of reactions, I was just that into the story.The most emotional part for me, one of them at least, was when Dobby died.  I don't know what it was about that, but I was sobbing and had tears streaming down my face.  When they describe putting the socks on his feet, that was the part that opened the floodgates.  I am one of those people that supports the theory that socks are a very imporant symbol in the Harry Potter series.  I even did a report in one of my high school English classes on it.  <i>"Ron sat on the edge of the grave and stripped off his shoes and socks, which he placed upon the elf's bare feet.  Dean produced a woolen hat, which Harry placed carefully upon Dobby's head, muffling his batlike ears."</i>  Rowling, master of subtle detail, still includes that brief mention of socks.  It was that which really did me in.Another thing that impressed me was how well the story flowed.  Probably a combination of being a good writer and knowing, without a doubt, where the story was going and what she wanted to have happen allowed Rowling to keep the story smooth and not jerky.  So easily, especially in the beginning/middle chapters in Harry, Ron, and Hermione's search for Horcruxes things could have become so choppy.  And while time did pass quickly in brief sections it still flowed.  A lot of writers, even good writers, can't seem to make something like that work, yet Rowling did, proving herself yet again.I was also really impressed by her ballsy moves of killing off several main characters, especially right in the beginning.  I thought it was going to be in the big final battle ('cause c'mon, you knew it was coming) that we lost all our favorites, not within the first few chapters.  RIP Hedwig and Mad-Eye.  That was one major way you got sucked in because you're thinking, "Oh my God!  Characters I love are already dying!  What the-" and then you keep going because you need to know if anyone else is going to kick it.  For some reason though Rowling just loves killing off my favorite characters, Dumbledore, Moody, Fred (and George too in a way), Lupin, Tonks.  I was especially angry over the Lupin/Tonks death.  It felt like a sort of snub because, yay they're married!  Yay, they're having a baby!  Yay, he's a little metamorphmagus.  Boo, both parents are suddenly dead.  Rude.  But I guess it made the whole thing hurt a lot more, and it did.Honestly, I felt Rowling tied things up beautifully and not in that harried, "Oh yeah about that?  Um... this happens!  Yeah, that's it!"  I think many fans feel vindicated (i.e. the Snape/Lily shippers, those who thought Harry was a Horcrux, don't mess with Mrs. Weasley) after reading this book.  Of course there are probably some who are broken down and upset that what they thought was going to happen didn't.  In the end we all got one hell of a story and went on one fantastic adventure.  No matter what happened, no matter who died or who ended up with who this book was more than I could have hoped for, I was not disappointed at all.All I can say now is: Jo, thank you.</span>  <a data-text-id="13963348707920142431" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review2175622">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link2175622"
