class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_2175622'><a id="like_count_review_2175622" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/2175622?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">98 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_2175622" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_2175622" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=98&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=2175622&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_2175622" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 2175622, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">15 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/2175622?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_2175622' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/2175622/comments?reverse=true">View all 15 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_2175622' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 2175622, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1586681846" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1586681846" />    <a title="Liza" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/50370792-liza"><img alt="Liza" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468187304p2/50370792.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1586681846?book_show_action=false">Apr 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Liza" class="user" name="Liza" href="/user/show/50370792-liza">Liza</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747591054" href="/book/show/820343.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50370792-liza?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50370792-liza?shelf=favorites-of-all-time">favorites-of-all-time</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50370792-liza?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1586681846" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8951388002887715623">In all honesty I am for once in my life simply lost for words. This DESTROYED me. This ripped me apart, then put me back together, then ripped me apart all over again. If this is not a good finale, then I do not, and will never know, what is. This brought it all. Every quality deemed to each Hogwarts house, bravery, skill, cunning, ambition, knowledge, wit, honesty, equality, plus action and adventure, were prominent throughout the entire book. J.K. Rowling is a master and brings in real world</span>  <span id="freeText8951388002887715623" style="display:none">In all honesty I am for once in my life simply lost for words. This DESTROYED me. This ripped me apart, then put me back together, then ripped me apart all over again. If this is not a good finale, then I do not, and will never know, what is. This brought it all. Every quality deemed to each Hogwarts house, bravery, skill, cunning, ambition, knowledge, wit, honesty, equality, plus action and adventure, were prominent throughout the entire book. J.K. Rowling is a master and brings in real world issues into her fantastical one. I cried, I laughed, I screamed, I smiled, and when it was all over I just sat there and contemplated what my life will be like now that I have finished the series once more. I highly recommend this series more than anything else in the world to those who need some magic in their lives, which is virtually everyone. Love conquers all, and without delving too much into spoilers, that is where I will leave this. Please pick up this series if you have not, I promise it will not disappoint.<br /><br />This next portion is a little bit into my history with Harry Potter, to better understand how I come up with my thoughts about this series. The first time I read the Harry Potter series I was 13 years old. Now, that may seem a bit older than most when they started reading this miraculous series, but I was skeptical to the power that these books had on so many. Although I was older than most when I first read this series, I was also still pretty young and could really only relate to Harry and the others up to about the third book, Prisoner of Azkaban, when they were 13, like I was. Now, exactly five years later, I have been every age (other than in '19 Years Later'), that Harry, Hermione, and Ron have been throughout the entire series, which I think benefits me greatly in understanding their thoughts, feelings, and decisions in each book. When I first read the books, I knew that I could never love anything more, and now, five years later, I am even more sure that this series will not only stay with me forever, bring me light in my darkest days, and be passed on to my children, but also that I have not felt this way about anything. It might seem silly, but I think when one finds this in something, they know, whether or not others will understand. I will most certainly be rereading this series in the future many more times and will continue to be astounded with the growth that I see in myself as I get older, but also with this series, because as I change, it changes with me. It would be a dishonour to give this anything less than 5 stars! Infinity out of 5!</span>  <a data-text-id="8951388002887715623" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1586681846">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1586681846" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1586681846&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1586681846'><a id="like_count_review_1586681846" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1586681846?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">90 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1586681846" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1586681846" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=90&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1586681846&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1586681846" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1586681846, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1586681846?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1586681846' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1586681846/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_149871686" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="P " href="/user/show/25327841-p"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469415764p1/25327841.jpg" alt="25327841" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/25327841-p">P </a>      <span id="freeTextContainer17529130618408074033">Nice review, Liza !</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Apr 04, 2016 09:34AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_149874276" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Maggie U+2618 (Reader in Wonderland)" href="/user/show/40477684-maggie-reader-in-wonderland"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468735623p1/40477684.jpg" alt="40477684" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/40477684-maggie-reader-in-wonderland">Maggie U+2618 (Reader in Wonderland)</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer4790361944591364556">Very beautiful review, Liza. Harry Potter is with me more than eleven years now.:)</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Apr 04, 2016 10:36AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1586681846' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1586681846, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_4122751" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/4122751" />    <a title="Loren Harway" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/245084-loren-harway"><img alt="Loren Harway" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1265989505p2/245084.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/4122751?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2007</a>      <a title="Loren Harway" class="user" name="Loren Harway" href="/user/show/245084-loren-harway">Loren Harway</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">don't ask stupid questions</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer4122751&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer4122751" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7380426223047829627">grrr. *spoilers*<br />This book was meant to be a masterpiece.<br />It wasn't. I was VERY disappointed with the last portion of the book. But the criticisms are for later.<br />I've always thought that JK's writing was admirable if a little underdeveloped, but the paragraphs just don't seem to flow together as well as they used to.<br />They finally leave school. I never thought they would, but it sure as hell was an exciting notion. However the lack of supporting characters (that you might find at Hogwarts) means that</span>  <span id="freeText7380426223047829627" style="display:none">grrr. *spoilers*<br />This book was meant to be a masterpiece.<br />It wasn't. I was VERY disappointed with the last portion of the book. But the criticisms are for later.<br />I've always thought that JK's writing was admirable if a little underdeveloped, but the paragraphs just don't seem to flow together as well as they used to.<br />They finally leave school. I never thought they would, but it sure as hell was an exciting notion. However the lack of supporting characters (that you might find at Hogwarts) means that this book is darker and the lack of humour makes for a depressing hundred pages around pg200.<br />The deaths... a little weird how the human deaths are less effective, maybe that's just me but Hedwig and Dobby's deaths broke my heart. With mad-eye... well, he was an asshole so i didn't care. With Fred... well, there is another one so the impact is lessened. With Lupintonks... well if they were stupid enough to name Harry godfather (even THEY should have seen the parellalism!) then they deserve to die. No i don't mean that, but as we didn't see them die it seems less horrifying.<br />So much more interesting and original than the others this daring new direction led to some bad writing which didn't go anywhere in the end (wtf was the hallows about?).<br />The Hallows was a ridiculous idea and frankly i was horrified that Rowling was attempting to introduce such a 'major' theme in the last book with only one brief reference in book six. They were pointless, in the end what did it matter who had ownership of the elder wand? no one used it in 'the final duel' anyway.<br />I no longer like Dumbledore, JK dragged him through the mud and didn't thoroughly wash him off. Harry forgave him but i sure as hell didn't (and who didn't see the 'Harry is a Horcrux' thing coming?<br />The chapter 'King's cross' made me cry. But not because it was well written, rather the opposite, it didn't make sense at times (where the hell were they?) i had to reread the section on harry's 'phoenixlike' ability several times and i still hate it. It was so weak. This sequence was nothing like the other 'endofbookharryanddumbledore' explanations we have come to know and love. Nothing was explained in this chapter everything was re-explained and slightly embellished. <br />The chapters immediately preceding this were the real treat of the book, Snape is finally redeemed (although after ten years of waiting i did expect a better ironclad reason for trusting him than loving lily). Harry facing his mortality is heartbreaking even though most of us have imagined it countless times. The moment right before his death is about as perfect an HP moment there is. He should have stayed dead and the narration flick to another.<br />Voldemort's Invincible Army is defeated too easily and Bellatrix's death is unsatisfying as Molly has no real motive for revenge (nono Fred's death doesn't count). Harry should have done it. He also should have performed at least one killing curse in the book, he performed the other unforgivables, so why not?<br />Voldemort is killed by a reflecting spell.<br />What?<br />WHAT?<br />Are you KIDDING me?<br />Could it possibly be more anticlimactic?<br />What was the point of the elder wand then? Why the elaborate buildup when Harry doesn't even perform the execution?<br />Anyone could have duelled to a reflection, and since when can that happen?<br />A true HP fan must take alot on faith to enjoy this ending.<br />The less said about the epilogue the better. Probably been written since book one and it shows. There is no depth, any hp fan could guess (or assume) this ending, its not even worth reading. Albus Severus was the only icing on this unsatisfying and dry cake.<br />If you do read this book close it at the end of 'the forest again' and write your own ending.<br />OR wait for JK to realise her mistake and re publish with an alternate ending.<br />This was not a rant.<br /><br />Update: Look. I gave it four stars okay?</span>  <a data-text-id="7380426223047829627" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review4122751">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link4122751" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=4122751&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_4122751'><a id="like_count_review_4122751" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/4122751?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">87 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_4122751" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_4122751" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=87&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=4122751&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_4122751" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 4122751, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">37 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/4122751?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_4122751' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/4122751/comments?reverse=true">View all 37 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_111550612" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Dai" href="/user/show/7926715-dai"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1409282028p1/7926715.jpg" alt="7926715" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/7926715-dai">Dai</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11332267459177921893">I disagree with one thing...<br />"Voldemort is killed by a reflecting spell.<br />What?<br />WHAT?<br />Are you KIDDING me?<br />Could it possibly be more anticlimactic?"<br /><br />I think t</span>  <span id="freeText11332267459177921893" style="display:none">I disagree with one thing...<br />"Voldemort is killed by a reflecting spell.<br />What?<br />WHAT?<br />Are you KIDDING me?<br />Could it possibly be more anticlimactic?"<br /><br />I think the symbolism is that he's finally killed, in part, by his own hand. All of his acts, being purely evil, end up reflected on him in one way or another (eg accidental Harry horcrux), and in the end he dies by that reflection, and falls as just another bad man, not the superior creature he saw himself having become.<br />*sidenote: I see this as the worst departure from the books in the entire series of films; in the film finale Voldemort has this completely supernatural-looking death instead of just collapsing, which spoils the message even though it was admittedly pretty awesome-looking.</span>  <a data-text-id="11332267459177921893" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Dec 26, 2014 03:28AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_138810435" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Jeremy R" href="/user/show/27888700-jeremy-r"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1418784319p1/27888700.jpg" alt="27888700" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/27888700-jeremy-r">Jeremy R</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer17730795674453576113">Wow. Just wow. You totally missed everything Rowling was trying to say in this book. I am discouraged that people like you exist.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug 17, 2015 05:26PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_918022628" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope este momento.</b> Algunas sensaciones son inefables, indescriptibles, tratar de explicarlas serU+00EDa desvirtuar su encanto, asU+00ED que solo voy a decir que, sin exagerar y sin temor a humillarme, leer toda la saga de corrido ha sido una de las mejores experiencias de mi vida.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_381017255" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/381017255" />    <a title="Evgeny" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny"><img alt="Evgeny" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p2/9340136.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/381017255?book_show_action=false">Mar 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Evgeny" class="user" name="Evgeny" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny">Evgeny</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810606" href="/book/show/8786481-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer381017255" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12697449840757663157">He-Who-Must-Not-Be Named is on the loose and is practically unstoppable at this point. He also took special interest in killing Harry Potter whose main mission for the book would be not to die long enough to fulfill the mission given to him by Dumbledore in the previous book, thus no Hogwarts studies this time; it is about stayin' alive for Harry:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457370411i/18351814.jpg" width="340" height="340" alt="Staying Alive" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Something I noticed again during my reread of the series, especially this book: J.K. Rowling is not at all shy about killing her characters, especially</span>  <span id="freeText12697449840757663157" style="display:none">He-Who-Must-Not-Be Named is on the loose and is practically unstoppable at this point. He also took special interest in killing Harry Potter whose main mission for the book would be not to die long enough to fulfill the mission given to him by Dumbledore in the previous book, thus no Hogwarts studies this time; it is about stayin' alive for Harry:<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457370411i/18351814.jpg" width="340" height="340" alt="Staying Alive" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Something I noticed again during my reread of the series, especially this book: J.K. Rowling is not at all shy about killing her characters, especially good ones. George R.R. Martin often gets all the slack for doing this<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457372836i/18352072._SY540_.jpg" width="340" height="450" alt="George R.R. Martin" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>but despite Harry Potter's author saying that she feels bad about killing good people, a great number of them died in the series (and outside it if you start counting from Harry's parents). Some of these deaths are still as tragic on the second time around. <br><br>Harry's gradual discovery of Dumbledore as not-quite-good-guy is brilliant. It took me two reads to grasp all the nuances of this. <br><br>Now for the bad parts which unfortunately made me reduce otherwise perfect rating by one star. Ron - to use his favorite word - is a git, especially in this book. He was destined to remain forever in Harry's shadow, but this is exactly the place he deserved. He did not do anything exciting on his own since fated chess match in the first (!) book. <br><br>As a character Ginny Weasley cannot be even compared to Luna Lovegood, not to mention Hermione Granger. If Harry could not get Hermione, I hoped he ended up with Luna - sure she is loony at times, but she is always understanding, brave, and smart; read carefully her parts if you do not believe me. She was able to help Harry more than Ginny whose only help was kissing him a couple of times. <br><br>The forest sequence of the book was way too long. This is probably the only part of the series which felt drown out. The whole epilogue feels off. I understand the need to show happily ever after<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457373051i/18352104._SX540_.jpg" width="340" height="280" alt="HEA" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>but it still feels out of place. <br><br>So as I mentioned with these complaints I have to reduce the rating by one, reluctantly. The whole series however deserved unconditional perfect rating. If you have not read it because you think this is for children or because it is too mainstream, or because you think it offends your religious beliefs - get off your high horse<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457372574i/18352050._SY540_.jpg" width="340" height="340" alt="High Horse" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>and head to your nearest library for the magical experience. </span>  <a data-text-id="12697449840757663157" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>   <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/15735368-suebee-bring-me-an-alpha">SueBeeU+2605bring me an alpha!U+2605</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer18361765423705768842">Terrific review Evgeny! class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Evgeny" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p1/9340136.jpg" alt="9340136" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/9340136-evgeny">Evgeny</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9399305323021100639"><i>SueBeebring me an alpha! class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_8791724" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/8791724" />    <a title="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/395599-shannon-giraffe-days"><img alt="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1420332941p2/395599.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/8791724?book_show_action=false">Jan 01, 2012</a>      <a title="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" class="user" name="Shannon (Giraffe Days)" href="/user/show/395599-shannon-giraffe-days">Shannon (Giraffe Days)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781551929767" href="/book/show/818056.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=2007">2007</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/395599-shannon-giraffe-days?shelf=2011">2011</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer8791724" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2239148254077631278"><i>This review contains spoilers.</i><br /><br /><b>2011 REVIEW - 2ND READING</b><br /><br /><br />I made a promise to myself that I wouldn't read my review from 2007, when the book first came out, until after I'd published this one. I want to see how they compare - what thoughts/reactions etc. had changed, if any, and any additional insights - but it does make me nervous, because I reckon my first review will prove to be much better written - and what if I seem dumber this time around? I find I get a bit muddled from watching the films,</span>  <span id="freeText2239148254077631278" style="display:none"><i>This review contains spoilers.</i><br /><br /><b>2011 REVIEW - 2ND READING</b><br /><br /><br />I made a promise to myself that I wouldn't read my review from 2007, when the book first came out, until after I'd published this one. I want to see how they compare - what thoughts/reactions etc. had changed, if any, and any additional insights - but it does make me nervous, because I reckon my first review will prove to be much better written - and what if I seem dumber this time around? I find I get a bit muddled from watching the films, too, in that after watching them I can't remember if bits were in the book or the film and vice versa. Oh well. Really must stop over-thinking things! <br /><br />[Scroll down for my first review, from 2007.]<br /><br />The final Harry Potter book always looks too short to me, like, how could everything possibly be wrapped up in a book that's not as long as <i>The Order of the Phoenix</i>, when there's still so much to do?! I felt that the first time, and I felt that again. But once again I admire Rowling's skill in crafting a tremendous story and a powerful ending for what is to me one of the best fantasy series out there. <br /><br />There's a lot going on in this novel, but it's nicely balanced with quieter, slower parts and you really get that last chance to really <i>know</i> Harry, Ron and Hermione. Rowling never lets plot overpower her characters or her story, and she won't be rushed: the pacing is steady and consistent throughout, which only adds to the tension-filled scenes where you start biting your nails.<br /><br />This is a book that makes me cry, and I'll tell you why - in a bit. I wondered how I could share all the things I love about this particular book, and figured listing them was probably the best option.<br /><br /> <br /> Hedwig dying. I had completely forgotten, and it's so, so sad. I like how they did it for the movie, giving her a role and using her as a visual means of identifying Harry, since in the book it's more complicated.   <br /><br /> Hermione erasing her existence - removing knowledge and memory of herself from her parents' minds and sending them off to Australia under new identities so that they aren't a target. There is something incredibly tragic about this, though it doesn't get much attention. I can't imagine the kind of strength and resolve it would take to do that, though the realities of the world would probably help give you the resolve.   <br /><br /><br /> Kreacher becoming an ally. And all for an act of genuine kindness (Harry gives him "Master Regulus'" locket after hearing his story). And what he was made to do for Voldemort. Nothing, not even Kreacher, is black and white, and that's an important lesson to learn. He betrayed Sirius at the end of <i>The Order of the Phoenix</i>, but when you learn more about him, you realise it's not a simple matter at all.   <br /><br /><br /> Dobby's death. He was such a brave, selfless elf, and as characters, he and Kreacher really brought into sharp relief the whole issue of house elves and their mistreatment.   <br /><br /><br /> The mortality of the Weasley's. Until this book, they always struck me as one of those solid features who come close to utter tragedy but always manage to avoid it, like with Arthur getting attacked by the snake. Here, though, George loses an ear and, at the end, Fred is killed. Fred's death is one of the saddest things for me.    <br /><br /><br /> Likewise, Lupin and Tonks' deaths at the final battle - I remember reading that the first time and feeling that sense of utter disbelief. I felt it again here, like someone had surely made a mistake, especially when Harry sees their bodies next to Fred and their described as sleeping. But with a newborn left behind, and the fact that Lupin only recently found the first real happiness he's ever known - to have that cut short, it makes me want to cry just typing this. The deaths of these characters had a much bigger impact on me than the death of Dumbledore - as big a surprise as that was on first reading - at the end of <i>The Half-Blood Prince</i>. In a way, Dumbledore had to go so that Harry could come into his own. But these characters, their deaths are so needless, and they were too young and left too much behind.   <br /><br /><br /> Snape's love for Lily. I knew there was a good reason why we forgave Snape at the end, but I was glad I couldn't remember exactly what it was. Snape is another complex character, who shows that it's not a simple matter of right or wrong, good or evil. He's not someone to be judged at face value or first impressions, though obviously that's what everyone has been doing all his life. It's not even pity that I felt for him, but empathy at losing the woman he loved and sacrificing everything in memory of her. He never stopped loving her. Timeless love. No wonder Dumbledore trusted him implicitly: he understood the power of such emotions and never dismissed them as insignificant.   <br /><br /><br /> The truth about Dumbledore's past, and his sister Ariana. So sad. I haven't seen the second half of the movie version yet but I hope they include these details.   <br /><br /><br /> Harry walking to his impending death, supported by the ghosts of his parents, Sirius and Lupin. I cried when James and Lily and Cedric appeared at the end of <i>The Goblet of Fire</i>, and they had no less power here, bolstering their son and being there so he wasn't alone as he went to Voldemort, knowing he was going to be killed - and not knowing that he would survive it.    <br /><br /><br /> The dragon kept imprisoned in Gringott's Bank. I felt so bad for the poor tortured beast, and so happy when they freed it.   <br /><br /><br /> Xenophilius Lovegood. The position he was in, having his daughter taken away and used as a threat against him, to betray his beliefs (i.e., in Harry as the Chosen One).   <br /><br /> Petunia Dursley, Harry's aunt, is a sad figure in her own right. It becomes clear in this book why she was so anti-magic: she was jealous of her sister Lily's ability. The scene where Lily mentions that Petunia wrote to Dumbledore, asking to be let into Hogwarts, and Petunia's feelings of embarrassment and shame and longing, of feeling excluded - you can't help but feel for the little girl who grew into a resentful woman in denial.   <br /><br /> <br /><br />There's lots of happy things here too, like Fleur and Bill Weasley's wedding and Ron and Hermione finally getting together, as well as great mini-adventures that all lead up to the final show-down. The plan to get into the Ministry of Magic, and later the Gringott's Bank break-in, for example, were really fun and exciting and scary. And one of my favourite scenes is the Neville Longbottom snake-killing scene - really, I just love all the Neville scenes but that one in particular really stuck in my head all the intervening years since first reading it.<br /><br />And underlying it all is this Hitler-like race and class war that Voldemort is enacting. Muggles and Mud-bloods become demonised and terrorised and everyone has to prove their "purity". The film captured this really well in the set design, especially inside the Ministry.<br /><br />I loved that there was so much I couldn't remember when I started this book - I couldn't remember what the Hallows were, or what was inside the Snitch, or how they found the other Horcruxes. I had forgotten Dobby died until I watched the film a few months ago. It was wonderful to read it almost like it was the first time.<br /><br />And then there's the epilogue - I'll mention it because I remember how much fans railed against it when the book first came out. I'm still not sure why, except maybe it wasn't up to the standards of the rest of the series. I read somewhere that Rowling wrote it at the beginning, which is kinda cool, and shows just how well she planned it all out. The line that I love is this one, where Harry tells his son: "Albus Severus, [...] you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew." [p.607] It gets me every time.<br /><br /><br /><b>2007 REVIEW - 1ST READING</b><br /><br />So, there were huge expectations - and quite a few bets, debates and demands - for this last book, and personally I thought it was a great ending to the series. One of the things that I love about these books, that has always impressed me, is how tightly plotted they are, how detailed. Others have complained about the plotholes in <i>Deathly Hallows</i>, but I didn't see any. Granted, I wasn't looking for them, and I didn't succeed in my intention to re-read the previous books before this one (managed <i>Philosopher's Stone</i> but left it too late for the others) so I had forgotten some details. <br /><br /><i>Deathly Hallows</i> made me laugh, made me cry (seriously, I bawled - and there were no tissues at the cottage so had to mop my face with paper towel...), had me pressing my knuckles to my mouth (the closest I come to biting my nails), and kept me on the edge of my seat. What more could you ask for? <br /><br />Quite a few characters die in this book, but everyone knew there would be some deaths because Rowling said there would be. She's also said, apparently, that the books are about death, though, having read the last book, I understand now that she doesn't mean they're about <i>death</i>, but about <i>death</i>. The whole idea behind The Boy Who Lived was that his mother's sacrifice protected him from the killing curse, and when Harry in turn sacrifices himself, he protects everyone at Hogwarts (where all the characters assemble for the big show-down) from Lord Voldemort. <br /><br />I also liked how the death of Dumbledore (in the previous book) and Snape's betrayal are resolved; I liked that Snape did it all for love of Lily, Harry's mother. It worked, brought out the humanity that has always lurked deep beneath Snape's corrosive veneer. The saddest deaths were of Fred, one of the Weasley twins, and Lupin and Tonks, only weeks after the birth of their baby. Is it any wonder that I cried? And even though there was always the hope that Harry would survive, still the section leading up to his sacrifice was written so convincingly, so non-melodrammatically, that I actually had to put the book down for a minute and do a quick turn about the house to calm myself down a bit. <br /><br />The only bit that looked like a glaring plothole at first was when Neville pulls the sword of Gryffindor out of the Sorting Hat to lop Voldemort's snake's head off with. That confused me - last we saw of the sword, the goblin had taken it and disappeared into the depths of Gringotts with it. Then I remembered: Harry had pulled the sword out of the Sorting Hat in the Chamber of Secrets, too. The last lingering doubt is why the hat was on fire and why exactly Voldemort wanted to non-sort them then and there. Ah well, it works for dramatic effect! <br /><br />Another part of the book which has received a lot of flak: the epilogue. Saccharine, it's been described. I have to agree, and it's the only bit of saccharine in the entire series. Apparently it was written way back in the 90s, but I don't think that excuses it. It was like icing on the cake - sickly sweet, not at all filling or satisfying, hiding the cake beneath which is what you <i>really</i> want to eat, as long as you can have the icing too. So we learn how they paired up and what their kids' names are, that Neville is a Herbology professor and, well, very little else. <br /><br />Noticeably, Harry's conversation with Dumbledore in King's Cross Station shows how much Harry has grown and matured. He's moved through his teenage angst and become reliable, responsible, thoughtful, more patient. By not going after the Deathly Hallows, his first impulse is tempered by a new, cooler head. Aside from the humour, reminiscent of Roald Dahl, and the plotting, the character development of Harry is another reason why the books are so enjoyable, and long-lasting.</span>  <a data-text-id="2239148254077631278" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review8791724">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link8791724" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=8791724&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_8791724'><a id="like_count_review_8791724" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/8791724?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">65 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_8791724" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_8791724" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=65&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=8791724&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_8791724" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 8791724, true, &#39;&#39;); Just by the mention of his name, a smile widened on my face. I bet you can imagine how I took "the news" <br /><br /><br /><br /><br />; - ;!</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Feb 09, 2015 12:04PM    </span>  </div>  <div <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Feb 09, 2015 05:09PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_8791724' style='display: class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_794900354" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/794900354" />    <a title="Laz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22313662-laz"><img alt="Laz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459126457p2/22313662.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/794900354?book_show_action=false">Jan 26, 2015</a>      <a title="Laz" class="user" name="Laz" href="/user/show/22313662-laz">Laz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810606" href="/book/show/8786481-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">magic world lovers</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=classics">classics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=sci-fi">sci-fi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer794900354" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17609565594260867960"><b> <blockquote>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D</blockquote> </b><br /><br />The last stand. <br /><br />Holy shit, this was definitely one of the best books I've ever read. It was interesting to the core and never bored me for even a second. This was through and through a pain in the ass. It pained me to read the last chapter, the last book. I didn't want this to end. Still don't want to.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Fred, Dora, Lupin... Snape... <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>Why is Mrs. Rowling so keen on killing? Holy</span>  <span id="freeText17609565594260867960" style="display:none"><b>  <blockquote>U+201CDo not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love.U+201D</blockquote></b><br /><br />The last stand. <br /><br />Holy shit, this was definitely one of the best books I've ever read. It was interesting to the core and never bored me for even a second. This was through and through a pain in the ass. It pained me to read the last chapter, the last book. I didn't want this to end. Still don't want to.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Fred, Dora, Lupin... Snape...  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>Why is Mrs. Rowling so keen on killing? Holy shit, she's turned this into heart-break. My heart shatters every time someone dies, I'm emotional and a cry-baby just like that.<br /><br />There were moments in the book when it reminded me how fun it all used to be. No matter how morbid it all becomes, Mrs. Rowling always manages to keep some things intact, like the humor. The humor is definitely reduced but not non-existent.<br /><br />I laughed so hard when Molly Weasley screamed "NOT MY DAUGHTER YOU BITCH!" at Bellatrix <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[and then killed her.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> How can you not love Mum Weasley? She is mama bear. She'd protect her cubs at all costs.<br /><br />The Epilogue is such an emotional thing. It wrecks your soul and then it puts it all back together... James. Albus Severus. Lily. Hugo. Rose.<br /><br />I was crying because it just occurred to me that Harry, Ron and Hermione were like 11 in the first book and ended up having kids and being in their late 30's which at this point I had lost my shit and crying and did not know what to do with myself.<br /><br /><b>  <blockquote>U+201COf course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?U+201D</blockquote></b><br /><br />I just want to say that Harry Potter taught me to be brave and love rather than hate and not being afraid of even dying for those I love. Harry chose to be the better man and he defeated Voldemort not with power but with bravery and courage that only love can armor you with. He fought with friends by his side. Loved ones.</span>  <a data-text-id="17609565594260867960" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review794900354">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link794900354" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=794900354&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_794900354'><a id="like_count_review_794900354" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/794900354?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">66 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_794900354" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_794900354" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=66&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=794900354&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_794900354" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 794900354, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">8 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/794900354?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_794900354' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/794900354/comments?reverse=true">View all 8 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_113510242" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Laz" href="/user/show/22313662-laz"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459126457p1/22313662.jpg" alt="22313662" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/22313662-laz">Laz</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9481306443168433571"><i>Antonia wrote: "I wouldn't know but there were a lot of people. No hogwarts, not enough closure, too many deaths or too much cheese in the epilogue, I</i></span>  <span id="freeText9481306443168433571" style="display:none"><i>Antonia wrote: "I wouldn't know but there were a lot of people. No hogwarts, not enough closure, too many deaths or too much cheese in the epilogue, I heard a lot of things"</i><br /><br />I love cheese. I'm a cheesy person. I take my books with cheese. XD</span>  <a data-text-id="9481306443168433571" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jan 26, 2015 02:09PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_151639802" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Lizzy" href="/user/show/54597505-lizzy"><img href="/user/show/54597505-lizzy">Lizzy</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer13438367236084818782">Well said!!!!!</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      May 13, 2016 07:47PM itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1177948098" />    <a title="Elesia" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5301777-elesia"><img alt="Elesia" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474174459p2/5301777.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1177948098?book_show_action=false">Feb 02, 2015</a>      <a title="Elesia" class="user" name="Elesia" href="/user/show/5301777-elesia">Elesia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545583008" href="/book/show/17347379-harry-potter-and-the-deathly-hallows">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5301777-elesia?shelf=love-love-loved">love-love-loved</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5301777-elesia?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1177948098" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10414327730590125823">Gosh, I wish this series would go on forever! I've fallen in love with the Wizarding World and all the amazing characters so hard! When I first started this series I didn't expect to be so attached and I didn't except for this series to pull on my heart as much as it did! I go through so many emotions in this series, it can break my heart one chapter then fill it with love and joy in the next, it's amazing. I'm so so glad I finally read this series, it has completely stole my heart and I will</span>  <span id="freeText10414327730590125823" style="display:none">Gosh, I wish this series would go on forever! I've fallen in love with the Wizarding World and all the amazing characters so hard! When I first started this series I didn't expect to be so attached and I didn't except for this series to pull on my heart as much as it did! I go through so many emotions in this series, it can break my heart one chapter then fill it with love and joy in the next, it's amazing. I'm so so glad I finally read this series, it has completely stole my heart and I will never forget these characters or this world. Such an amazing and magical series.. I already can't wait to revisit this world and fall in love all over again! </span>  <a data-text-id="10414327730590125823" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1328672389p1/665584.jpg" alt="665584" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/665584-alejandro">Alejandro</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer13146324663559013109">Wicked review! ;)</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Feb 02, 2015 class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/857516965?book_show_action=false">Feb 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Norah Una id="reviewTextContainer857516965" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15921718551955414080"><b>I'm dying a bit over here.</b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446647035i/16854950._SY540_.png" width="370" height="520" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I did it guys.I've reread the whole series in 2015.As you can guess I'm an emotional wreck right now.My thoughts and feelings are all over the place.I just have to say how much I love this story and these phenomenal characters-Hermione's intelligence,Ron's bravery and humor,Harry's selflessness,Doby's loyalty,Fred and George's uniqueness and forgiveness,Percy's redemption,Neville's fearlessness and confidence,Luna's helpfulness and kindness,Tonks's fierceness,Dumbledore</span>  <span id="freeText15921718551955414080" style="display:none"><b>I'm dying a bit over here.</b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446647035i/16854950._SY540_.png" width="370" height="520" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I did it guys.I've reread the whole series in 2015.As you can guess I'm an emotional wreck right now.My thoughts and feelings are all over the place.I just have to say how much I love this story and these phenomenal characters-Hermione's intelligence,Ron's bravery and humor,Harry's selflessness,Doby's loyalty,Fred and George's uniqueness and forgiveness,Percy's redemption,Neville's fearlessness and confidence,Luna's helpfulness and kindness,Tonks's fierceness,Dumbledore's humanity and darkness,Snape's complexness...<b>This was one hell of a journey</b>.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446648333i/16855291.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Favourite quotes:<br><br>U+201C<b>We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201CWhy are they all staring?" demanded Albus as he and Rose craned around to look at the other students.<br>"<b>DonU+2019t let it worry you</b>," said Ron. "<b>ItU+2019s me. IU+2019m extremely famous</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness</b>?U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>He must have known I'd want to leave you</b>."<br>"<b>No, he must have known you would always want to come back</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201CIt is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it.<b> Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201CWhat are you doing with all those books anyway?" Ron asked. <br>"Just trying to decide which ones to take with us," said Hermione. When we're looking for the Horcruxes."<br>"<b>Oh, of course</b>," said Ron, clapping a hand to his forehead. "<b>I forgot we'll be hunting down Voldemort in a mobile library</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>Hello, Minister!</b>" bellowed Percy, sending a neat jinx straight at Thicknesse, who dropped his wand and clawed at the front of his robes, apparently in awful discomfort. "<b>Did I mention I'm resigning?</b>U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>Are you planning to follow a career in Magical Law, Miss Granger</b>?U+201D asked Scrimgeour.<br>U+201C<b>No, IU+2019m not</b>,U+201D retorted Hermione. U+201C<b>IU+2019m hoping to do some good in the world!</b>U+201D </span>  <a data-text-id="15921718551955414080" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review857516965">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link857516965" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=857516965&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_857516965'><a id="like_count_review_857516965" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/857516965?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">61 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_857516965" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_857516965" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=61&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=857516965&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_857516965" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 857516965, true, &#39;&#39;);  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_431520680" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/431520680" />    <a title="Carolina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13539913-carolina"><img alt="Carolina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479436376p2/13539913.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/431520680?book_show_action=false">Jun 21, 2016</a>      <a title="Carolina" class="user" name="Carolina" href="/user/show/13539913-carolina">Carolina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13539913-carolina?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13539913-carolina?shelf=cry-worthy-books">cry-worthy-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13539913-carolina?shelf=on-my-shelf">on-my-shelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer431520680" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18260343320477320936"><b>Finishing this series was like a punch to the heart.</b><br /><br />I'm not gonna write a review because 1. I'm a little late to the party (but I've finally read them all *proud moment*) and 2. This book deserves more than one of my mediocre and very emotional reviews.<br /><br />Anyway, I bow to J.K. Rowling because this is, without a doubt, the best series there is. Ever. And my favorite one.<br /><br />The feelings are wayyy to many. It hurt ending this book, but it also put a so deserving smile on my face. I loved this with all my</span>  <span id="freeText18260343320477320936" style="display:none"><b>Finishing this series was like a punch to the heart.</b><br /><br />I'm not gonna write a review because 1. I'm a little late to the party (but I've finally read them all *proud moment*) and 2. This book deserves more than one of my mediocre and very emotional reviews.<br /><br />Anyway, I bow to J.K. Rowling because this is, without a doubt, the best series there is. Ever. And my favorite one.<br /><br />The feelings are wayyy to many. It hurt ending this book, but it also put a so deserving smile on my face. I loved this with all my heart and more.<br /><br />5 stars are not enough. <br /><br /><i>  <b>"All was well"</b></i><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="18260343320477320936" href="#" <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1707879396" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1707879396?book_show_action=false">Jul 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Markus" class="user" name="Markus" href="/user/show/26681101-markus">Markus</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=childrens-books">childrens-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1707879396" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4037991664457545434"><i>U+201COf course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?U+201D </i><br><br>I must admit to being a bit disappointed that the series did not conclude on the level or the fifth and sixth books, but I did find it surprisingly entertaining as a whole. Overall, I quite enjoyed my time with Harry Potter.<br><br>There were a lot of good things in the last book as well, most of all the final developments of the best character in the series:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1469701248i/19846348.jpg" width="" height="" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Full review to come.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1707879396">  <td colspan="2"> id="reviewTextContainer1284712533" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1502445341546016749"><blockquote>"Is this real? Or has this been happening inside my head? <br><br>"Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?U+201D <br> </blockquote><br><br>This marks off my Harry Potter rereadathon. <br>All I know is I want more. *dab tears<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432231657ra/14911038.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span> id='like_container_review_1284712533'><a id="like_count_review_1284712533" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1284712533?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">30 likes</span></a>U+00A0 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1284712533?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1284712533' style='display: </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_24132880" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/24132880" />    <a title="Adriana" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1227525-adriana"><img alt="Adriana" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_5f-6a03a5c12233c941481992b82eea8d23.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/24132880?book_show_action=false">Jun 11, 2008</a>      <a title="Adriana" class="user" name="Adriana" href="/user/show/1227525-adriana">Adriana</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">be tossed in a garbage heap and set aflame</span></div>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer24132880&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer24132880" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17950077815772281758">I waited 9 years for Rowling to do the right thing and kill off the Christ Figure, you know, like the *professional* writers do. Don't get me wrong, Harry was my favorite character--brave, deeply loyal, naturally talented--all wonderful qualities not meant for this foul Earth. I wanted him to die in his prime, to be celebrated in song, like all the great heros before him. Alas...<br /><br />Rowling didn't write so much a novel, as she did a Hollywood screenplay! Complete with lame wincing juvenile lines lik</span>  <span id="freeText17950077815772281758" style="display:none">I waited 9 years for Rowling to do the right thing and kill off the Christ Figure, you know, like the *professional* writers do. Don't get me wrong, Harry was my favorite character--brave, deeply loyal, naturally talented--all wonderful qualities not meant for this foul Earth. I wanted him to die in his prime, to be celebrated in song, like all the great heros before him. Alas...<br /><br />Rowling didn't write so much a novel, as she did a Hollywood screenplay! Complete with lame wincing juvenile lines like the one uttered by Molly Weasley to Bellatrix LeStrange in the Battle for Hogwarts, "Not my daughter, you BITCH!" A line meant to draw applause, cheers, and laughter from a bunch of teenagers in a darkened movie theater, not a line that would have been used by the prim and proper mother, Molly Weasley, that we grew to know and love in books 1-6.<br /><br />The book could have been better edited as there were long stretches of BORING reading throughout. It's as if Rowling just ran out of creative juices in the end and chose to let her fans write the final book for her. She inserted "PotterWatch" as a nod to the PotterCasters(PotterCast and MuggleCast), and she wrote in a nude scene for Harry Potter, as a nod to Daniel Radcliffe's nude stint in Equus. The whole *camping out in the forest waiting for something to happen* part was NOT something I expected after Book 6, when it was shown with such great care how Voldemort had hidden the locket horcrux. I can't believe they are making 2 films out of this, the crappiest book in the series!<br /><br />Oh, and that Epilogue, where to begin? If Rowling sent out apology letters to all her fans for writing it, that still wouldn't be enough of an atonement! The woman should be tarred, feathered, drawn, and quartered for that criminally putrid Epilogue! The visual of a middle aged Harry Potter waiting at the train station to get to his 9 to 5 job was the let-down of the century. I loved Harry because he was special and because of his aura of destiny! I loved that, despite his emotionally abusive childhood, he chose to become a decent human being, instead of following Tom Riddle's path of evil and bitterness! I loved that, when presented with a challenge, he almost always chose to do the right and moral thing, over what was easy. <br /><br />I didn't want to see him become a regular, boring adult, with a lame, humdrum life, he was too talented, too moral, too heroic for all of that mundane crap!</span>  <a data-text-id="17950077815772281758" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review24132880">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link24132880" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=24132880&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_24132880'><a id="like_count_review_24132880" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/24132880?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">29 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_24132880" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_24132880" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=29&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=24132880&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_24132880" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 24132880, true, &#39;&#39;);
